0: In a large mixing bowl, stir together the all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, ground cinnamon, and baking soda.
1: Add the finely shredded carrots, the cooking oil, and eggs. Beat the mixture with an electric mixer until it's just combined. Stir in the chopped pecans.
2: Transfer the carrot mixture to a greased 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool the cake in the pan on a wire rack.
3: Prepare the Cream Cheese Frosting. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake. Cover and store in the refrigerator. Makes 16 bars.
4: In a medium mixing bowl, beat together cream cheese, softened, and vanilla with an electric mixer until the ingredients are light and fluffy. Gradually add 2 cups of sifted powdered sugar, beating the mixture well. Gradually beat in 2 to 2-1/2 cups additional sifted powdered sugar until mixture is spreadable. Makes 1-1/2 cups frosting.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6 3/4 ounces  (1-1/2 cups) all-purpose flour
1: 2  tablespoons  granulated sugar
2: 1/2 teaspoon  baking powder
3: Pinch table salt
4: 2  ounces  (4 tablespoons) unsalted cold butter, cut into small pieces
5: 1   large egg, beaten slightly
6: 1  tablespoon  cold water; 1-1/2 teaspoons more if needed
7: 1/2 cup  cashews, well toasted
8: 1/2 cup  sliced almonds, well toasted
9: 1/2 cup  walnut pieces, well toasted
10: 1/3 cup  shredded coconut, well toasted
11: 1/2 cup  golden raisins
12: 1 1/4 cups  warm Butterscotch Sauce
13: 4  ounces  (8 tablespoons) unsalted butter
14: 2/3 cup  firmly packed dark brown sugar
15: 2/3 cup  sugar
16: 1 1/2 teaspoons  salt
17: 2  tablespoons  water
18: 3/4 cup  light corn syrup
19: 3/4 cup  heavy cream
20: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the butter and cut it into the dough using two knives, a pastry blender, or your fingertips until the dough looks crumbly. Add the egg and 1 tablespoon water; mix with a fork until the dough just holds together. (If the dough won't come together, add up to another 1-1/2 teaspoons water, a tiny bit at a time.) Don't overmix; the dough should feel slightly sticky. Shape the dough into a 6-inch log. Wrap it in plastic and refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour.
1: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the chilled dough into six equal pieces. Roll each piece into a round about 1/8 inch thick. Prick the rounds all over with a fork and gently fit them into 4-inch tartlet pans, trimming any excess dough.
2: Line each tartlet with foil and fill with dried beans or pie weights. Bake the tartlet shells for about 15 minutes. Remove the pie weights and the foil and bake an additional 5 minutes until golden. Cool on a rack.
3: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Combine the toasted nuts, coconut, and raisins with the warm butterscotch sauce. Divide the filling among the six tartlet shells. Bake until the filling just starts to bubble, 7 to 9 minutes. Using a wide spatula, carefully transfer the tartlets to a rack. Allow the tartlets to cool for 5 minutes. Carefully remove the tartlets from their pans and serve warm with a dollop of unsweetened whipped cream or creme fraiche, if you like.
4: In a medium, heavy-based saucepan, melt the butter. Stir in the two sugars, the salt, water, and corn syrup. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve the sugars. Let the mixture boil for 5 minutes, stirring often. You'll see big, slow bubbles as it boils. Remove the sauce from the heat. Carefully whisk in the cream and vanilla (the sauce may sputter). Allow the sauce to cool to warm before serving.
5: Make Ahead: Refrigerated, this sauce will keep for about two weeks. Reheat it gently, adding a little cream if it's too thick.
recipe_description: You'll need six 4-inch tartlet pans to make these small tarts. If you don't have all the nuts on hand, just use 1-1/2 cups total of what you do have; I've made this recipe with just cashews--it's delicious.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   box Betty Crocker® SuperMoist® carrot cake mix
1: 1/2 cup  vegetable oil
2: 1/4 cup  water
3: 2   eggs
4: 3/4 cup  raisins
5: 1/2 cup  chopped nuts
6: 1   container Betty Crocker® Rich & Creamy cream cheese frosting
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F (325 degrees F for dark or nonstick pan). Grease and flour, or spray with baking spray with flour, bottom and sides of 15x10x1-inch pan.
1: In large bowl, mix cake mix, oil, water and eggs with spoon. Stir in raisins and nuts. Spread evenly in pan.
2: Bake 18 to 24 minutes (25 to 29 minutes for dark or nonstick pan) or until bars spring back when touched lightly in center. Cool completely, about 1 hour. Spread with frosting. For bars, cut into 8 rows by 6 rows.  Store loosely covered at room temperature.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake 22 to 27 minutes.
recipe_description: Love carrot cake? Try a sweet cousin in bar form made with the help of a cake mix.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 cups  sliced almonds
1: 1  box Betty Crocker® SuperMoist® white cake mix
2: 1 1/4 cups  water
3: 1/3 cup  vegetable oil
4: 3   eggs
5: 1  teaspoon  almond extract
6: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine
7: 1  cup  packed brown sugar
8: 1/4 cup  milk
9: 2  cups  powdered sugar
recipe_name: Toasted Almond Cupcakes with Caramel Frosting
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F (325 degrees F for dark or nonstick pans). Place paper baking cup in each of 24 regular-size muffin cups. In shallow pan, bake almonds 6 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown. Cool 15 minutes. Reserve 1 cup almonds for garnish. In food processor, grind remaining almonds until finely ground.
1: In large bowl, beat cake mix, water, oil, eggs and almond extract with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally. (Batter will be lumpy.) Fold in ground almonds. Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.
2: Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
3: In 2-quart saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low; boil and stir 2 minutes. Stir in milk. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Cool to lukewarm, about 30 minutes.
4: Gradually stir powdered sugar into brown sugar mixture. Place saucepan of frosting in bowl of cold water. Beat with spoon until smooth and spreadable. If frosting becomes too stiff, stir in additional milk, 1 teaspoon at a time. Frost a few cupcakes at a time with 1 tablespoon frosting each; press reserved almonds lightly into frosting. Store loosely covered at room temperature.
5: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Make 30 cupcakes.
recipe_description: In this recipe, nutty, easy-mix cupcakes are topped with a rich, cooked brown sugar frosting.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  sugar
1: 1  tablespoon  vegetable oil
2: Generous dash ground cinnamon
3: 8  slices Pepperidge Farm® Whole Grain Soft Honey Whole Wheat Bread, crusts removed and cut into cubes (about 3 cups)
4: 1  cup  coarsely chopped unblanched almond
5: 1  cup  dried apple, diced
6: 1  cup  dried cranberries
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
1: Stir the sugar, oil and cinnamon in a large bowl.  Add the bread cubes and almonds and toss to coat.  Spread the bread mixture on a rimmed baking sheet.
2: Bake for 15 minutes or until the bread cubes are lightly browned, stirring occasionally.  Let the mixture cool completely on the baking sheet on a wire rack.
3: Place the bread mixture into a large bowl or resealable container.  Stir in the apples and cranberries.
4: You can substitute Pepperidge Farm® Whole Grain Cinnamon Swirl Bread for the Soft Honey Whole Wheat Bread. Just omit the dash of ground cinnamon from the recipe.
recipe_description: Here's a crunchy, quick and tasty breakfast idea that also makes a great snack.  It features dried apples and cranberries tossed with almonds and toasted cinnamon sugar bread cubes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  sliced fresh strawberries
1: 1/2 cup  granulated sugar
2: 2 1/4 cups  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
3: 3  tablespoons  granulated sugar
4: 2 1/2 teaspoons  baking powder
5: 1  teaspoon  salt
6: 3/4 cup  milk
7: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine, melted
8: 1  bag semisweet chocolate chips (1 cup, 6 ounces)
9: 1  tablespoon  shortening
10: 1 1/2 cups  whipping cream
11: 1/3 cup  powdered sugar
12: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
13: Additional strawberries, if desired
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Lightly grease cookie sheet with shortening. In medium bowl, mix strawberries and 1/2 cup granulated sugar; set aside.
1: To make shortcakes, in medium bowl, mix flour, 3 tablespoons granulated sugar, the baking powder and salt. Stir in milk and butter until soft dough forms. Onto cookie sheet, drop dough by 8 heaping tablespoonfuls. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack. Cool completely.
2: In small microwavable bowl, microwave chocolate chips and shortening uncovered on Medium 1 to 2 minutes, stirring after 1 minute, until melted.
3: In chilled medium bowl, beat whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla with electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form.
4: Break shortcakes into bite-size pieces. In parfait glasses, alternate layers of shortcake, strawberries, chocolate mixture and whipped cream. Garnish with additional strawberries.
recipe_description: Try this shortcake parfait recipe made with Gold Medal® all-purpose flour from Betty Crocker.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2 1/4 cups  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
1: 1/2 teaspoon  baking powder
2: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
3: 1 1/2 cups  packed light brown sugar
4: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
5: 1  cup  butter, softened
6: 4   eggs
7: 2  teaspoons  vanilla
8: 3/4 cup  milk
9: 1  cup  butter
10: 1/2 cup  packed light brown sugar
11: 2  tablespoons  milk
12: 1  tablespoon  light corn syrup
13: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
related_categories:
0: Birthday Cake
1: Bundt Cake
2: Cake
3: Desserts
recipe_name: Brown Sugar Cake with Buttery Brown Sugar Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease bottom and side of 12-cup fluted tube cake pan or 10-inch angel food (tube cake) pan with shortening; lightly flour. In medium bowl, mix flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
1: In large bowl, beat 1-1/2 cups brown sugar, the granulated sugar and softened butter with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on medium speed about 5 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally, until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add 2 teaspoons vanilla. Beat in flour mixture alternately with 3/4 cup milk on low speed until smooth. Pour into pan.
2: Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of cake comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 2 hours.
3: Meanwhile, in 2-quart saucepan, heat sauce ingredients except vanilla to boiling over medium heat, stirring constantly; boil and stir 2 minutes. Remove from heat; cool to room temperature. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla. Serve warm sauce with cake.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Increase flour to 2-1/2 cups; increase milk to 1 cup. Bake 55 to 65 minutes.
recipe_description: The recipe title says it all--rich buttery brown sugar flavor, mmm.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 cup  whole blanched almonds
1: 2/3 cup  plus 1/2 cup unsalted pistachios  (about 7 ounces)
2: 6  tablespoons  unsalted butter, softened
3: 1 1/4 cups  sugar
4: 4   large eggs
5: 1  tablespoon  finely grated  lemon zest
6: 1  tablespoon  fresh lemon juice
7: 1   vanilla bean, halved lengthwise and seeds scraped
8: 1/4 cup  plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
9: 2/3 cup  all-purpose flour
10: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
11: Finely grated zest of 1 lemon
12: Juice of 2 lemons
13: 1/4 cup  sugar
14: 2  tablespoons  water
15: Creme fraiche, for serving
recipe_instructions:
0: MAKE THE CAKE: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 10-inch round cake pan, line the bottom with parchment paper and butter the paper. In a food processor, pulse the almonds with 23 cup of the pistachios until finely ground.
1: In a large bowl, using a handheld electric mixer, beat the butter with the sugar at medium speed until it's the texture of moist sand. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well between additions. Add the lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla seeds and beat until smooth. Gradually beat in the olive oil in a thin stream. Using a rubber spatula, fold in the ground nuts, flour, and salt. Scrape the batter into the prepared pan.
2: Bake the cake for about 55 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Transfer the pan to a rack and let the cake cool for 15 minutes. Invert the cake onto the rack and peel off the parchment paper. Invert the cake again onto a serving plate.
3: Meanwhile, toast the remaining 1/2 cup of pistachios in a pie plate for about 8 minutes, or until fragrant.
4: MAKE THE SYRUP: In a small saucepan, combine the lemon zest, lemon juice, sugar, and water and bring to a simmer over moderate heat, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Pour the syrup over the warm cake and scatter the toasted pistachios all over the top. Let stand for 1 hour, then cut into wedges and serve with creme fraiche.
5: The cake can be kept in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.
recipe_description: The original recipe for Ryan Hardy's delicious citrusy, nutty, and dense cake comes from London's River Cafe restaurant. He substitutes olive oil for some of the butter and insists that it be served with tangy creme fraiche and an espresso.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  sugar
1: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
2: 3/4 cup  blackberries, halved
3: 3/4 cup  blueberries
4: 3/4 cup  raspberries
5: 1 1/2 cups  frozen whipped topping, thawed
6: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
8: Pinch salt
9: 4   large eggs
10: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
11: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
12: 2  tablespoons  confectioners' sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
1: In a small saucepan, stir together the sugar and cornstarch. Stir in berries and 1 tablespoon water and heat over medium heat. Cook 9 to 10 minutes, until thickened, bubbly and most of the berries have popped. Break up remaining berries with a spoon. Remove from heat; cool.
2: Coat a 15 x 10 x 1-inch jelly roll pan with nonstick cooking spray. Line bottom of pan with parchment or waxed paper. Spray paper. In a medium-size bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl, beat the eggs with an electric mixer for 5 minutes, until very light yellow. Add granulated sugar in batches, beating until smooth. Beat in vanilla extract.
3: Fold flour mixture into egg mixture until no lumps remain. Pour into prepared pan, spreading level. Bake at 350 degrees F for 12 to 14 minutes or until lightly browned.
4: Meanwhile, dust a clean kitchen towel with confectioners' sugar. When cake is done, turn out onto towel. Roll up towel and cake; cool completely.
5: Unroll cake; spread with filling. Roll up again, without the towel. Frosting: Transfer cake to a platter; spread with thawed whipped topping. Slice and serve.
recipe_description: Fresh blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries make the perfect filling for this white jelly roll cake. Serve with a few berries on the side to make this dessert extra special.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  milk chocolate pieces
1: 1/4 cup  whipping cream
2: 1/4 cup  plus 1 Tbsp. butter
3: 1   egg
4: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
5: 2  teaspoons  unsweetened cocoa powder
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 3/4 cup  sugar
8: 2  teaspoons  red food coloring
9: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
10: 1/2 cup  buttermilk
11: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
12: 1/2 teaspoon  vinegar
13: Raspberry preserves (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: For truffle filling, in a small saucepan combine chocolate pieces, cream, and 1 Tbsp. butter. Stir over low heat until chocolate is melted. Transfer to a small bowl; cool for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cover and freeze about 1 hour, until fudgelike consistency. Divide filling in 12 portions. Working quickly with hands, roll each portion in a ball. Place truffles in freezer.
1: Meanwhile, let 1/4 cup butter and egg stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 12 (2-1/2-inch) muffin cups with paper bake cups. Set aside.
2: For batter, in a small bowl stir together flour, cocoa powder, and salt; set aside. In a medium mixing bowl beat the 1/4 cup softened butter with mixer on medium to high for 30 seconds. Gradually add sugar; beat on medium until combined. Beat on medium 2 minutes more, scraping bowl occasionally. Beat in egg, food coloring, and vanilla. Alternately add flour mixture and buttermilk, beating on low after each addition just until combined. In a small bowl combine baking soda and vinegar; stir into batter.
3: Divide half the batter among the prepared cups, partially filling cups. Place a frozen truffle on batter in each cup, centering truffles away from sides of cups. Spoon remaining batter into cups, covering truffles.
4: Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, until tops spring back when lightly touched. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm, topped with raspberry preserves.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  poppy seeds (about 1-1/2 oz.)
1: 3/4 cup  milk
2: 1 1/2 teaspoons  vanilla
3: 5   eggs
4: 3/4 cup  butter
5: 1 3/4 cups  all-purpose flour
6: 1  teaspoon  baking powder
7: 1  teaspoon  salt
8: 1/2 cup  sugar
9: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
10: 1 1/2 cups  milk
11: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
12: 1 1/2 cups  sugar
13: 1 1/2 cups  whipping cream
14: 1/2 cup  sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, soak poppy seeds in 3/4 cup milk and 11/2 teaspoons vanilla for 1 hour. Meanwhile, separate eggs. Let egg whites, yolks and the butter stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Grease two 8- or 9-inch round cake pans. Line bottoms with parchment paper; grease again and lightly flour. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
1: For filling: In a heavy medium saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar and the cornstarch. Gradually stir in  11/2 cups milk and the egg yolks. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla. Pour filling into a bowl. Cover the surface with plastic wrap and chill until completely cooled. Do not stir.
2: For cake: Preheat oven to 375 degrees . In a large bowl, beat butter with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds. Gradually add 11/2 cups sugar, about 2 tablespoons at a time, beating on medium to high speed until sugar is nearly dissolved. Alternately add flour mixture and poppy seed mixture, beating on low to medium speed after each addition just until combined. Thoroughly wash beaters.
3: In another large bowl, beat egg whites on medium to high speed until stiff peaks form (tips stand straight when beaters are lifted). Gently fold egg whites into cake batter. Divide batter between prepared pans.
4: Bake for 30 to 35 minutes for 8-inch pans or  25 to 30 minutes for 9-inch pans or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the centers comes out clean.
recipe_description: The recipe for this four-layer cake--with a puddinglike filling, unmistakable poppy seed flavor and soft whipped cream frosting--comes from Wisconsins White Gull Inn.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  cranberry juice
1: 1 1/2 cups  dried cranberries
2: 2 2/3 cups  all-purpose flour
3: 2 1/4 teaspoons  baking powder
4: 1/4 teaspoon  baking soda
5: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
6: 3/4 cup  unsalted butter, softened
7: 1 1/3 cups  granulated sugar
8: 6   large egg whites
9: 1 1/2 teaspoons  vanilla
10: 1/2 teaspoon  coconut extract
11: 3/4 cup  buttermilk
12: 3/4 cup  unsalted butter, softened
13: 1/3 cup  unsweetened coconut milk (find with Asian foods)
14: 2  pounds  powdered sugar
15: 1  teaspoon  coconut extract
16: 1  cup  chopped walnuts, toasted
17: 1 1/2 cups  flaked coconut, toasted
recipe_name: Toasted Coconut Cake with Walnuts and Cranberries
recipe_instructions:
0: Grease and flour three 9-inch round cake pans; set aside.
1: In a medium saucepan bring cranberry juice to boiling; add dried cranberries then return to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat; cover and let stand at least 20 minutes. Drain.
2: Meanwhile, position two racks in center of oven. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a large mixing bowl, combine 3/4 cup butter and the granulated sugar; beat with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. With mixer on low speed, beat in the egg whites, vanilla, and 1/2 teaspoon coconut extract. On low speed and making three additions, beat the flour mixture into the sugar mixture, alternating with the buttermilk until combined. Evenly divide batter among the prepared pans*.
3: Bake cakes for 18 to 20 minutes, until a wooden pick inserted in center of each cake comes out clean. Cool in pans on wire racks 10 minutes. Remove from pans; cool cakes completely on wire racks.
4: For frosting, in a large mixing bowl beat 3/4 cup butter with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Gradually add 2 cups of the powdered sugar, beating well. Slowly beat in coconut milk and coconut extract. Gradually beat in remaining powdered sugar until fluffy (beat in milk, 1 teaspoon at a time, if frosting appears dry).
5: Place one cake layer on a cake plate. Spread with one-third of the frosting. Spread the cranberries on frosting. Place a second cake layer on cranberry filling. Spread with one-third of the frosting, then top with 2/3 cup of the walnuts and 1/2 cup of the coconut. Top with remaining layer. Spread with remaining frosting. Top with remaining coconut and walnuts.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 1/2 cups  fresh or packaged whole-milk ricotta cheese
1: 1/2 cup  raisins
2: 3  tablespoons  dark rum
3: Butter, at room temperature for greasing pan
4: 1/4 cup  fine dry bread crumbs, or as needed
5: 5  large eggs, separated
6: 3/4 cup  sugar
7: Pinch salt
8: Grated zest of 1 large lemon
9: Grated zest of 1 large orange
10: 1/2 cup  heavy cream
11: 1/2 cup  pine nuts
recipe_instructions:
0: Spoon the ricotta into a large fine-mesh sieve or a colander lined with a double thickness of cheesecloth or basket-type coffee filter. Set the sieve over a bowl and cover the ricotta well with plastic wrap. Drain in the refrigerator at least overnight, or up to 24 hours. Discard the liquid in the bottom of the bowl.
1: In a small bowl, soak the raisins in rum, tossing occasionally, until the raisins are softened and have absorbed most of the rum, 1 to 2 hours.
2: Smear an 8-inch springform pan with enough softened butter to coat lightly. Sprinkle the bread crumbs over the butter to coat generously. Shake out the excess crumbs. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
3: In a large bowl, use a whisk to beat the egg yolks, sugar, and salt until pale yellow, Add the drained ricotta and lemon and orange zest, and beat until blended thoroughly. Beat in the heavy cream. Use a rubber spatula to fold in the pine nuts and the raisins and rum. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites with a handheld electric mixer or wire whisk until they form stiff peaks. Fold about one-fourth of the egg white into the ricotta mixture to lighten ituse a large rubber spatula to scrape the batter from the bottom of the bowl up and over the whites. Fold in the remaining egg whites in the same way.
4: Pour the ricotta mixture into the prepared pan, and bake until the cake is golden brown on top and set in the center, about 1 hour and 10 minutes.
5: Cool the cake completely before removing the sides of the pan. Serve the cake at room temperature or chilled.
recipe_description: Cakes made with ricotta cheese, such as this one, are very typical of Italian desserts. Here, bread crumbs serve as the crust.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  canola oil
1: 2  cups  cut-up trimmed fresh asparagus or chopped trimmed broccoli
2: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
3: 1/2 cup  chopped red or yellow sweet pepper
4: Nonstick cooking spray
5: 3   whole grain English muffins, torn or cut into bite-size pieces (4 cups)
6: 2  cups  shredded smoked chicken or cooked chicken breast (10 ounces)
7: 3/4 cup  shredded Swiss cheese (3 ounces)
8: 1  cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed, or 4 eggs, lightly beaten
9: 1  cup  fat-free milk
10: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add asparagus, mushrooms, and sweet pepper; cook about 3 minutes or just until vegetables are crisp-tender.
1: Lightly coat six 12-ounce individual casserole dishes with cooking spray. Divide half of the English muffin pieces among the dishes. Top with the chicken, asparagus mixture, and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Top with the remaining English muffin pieces.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and black pepper. Pour egg mixture evenly over the layers in dishes. Using the back of a large spoon, press muffin pieces down. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Cover; chill for 2 to 24 hours.
3: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Bake, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in centers comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6 - 7   purchased croissants
1: 8  slices bacon
2: 1  cup  chopped onion
3: 1  cup  chopped red and/or green sweet peppers or sliced, halved zucchini
4: 1  cup  sliced fresh cremini mushrooms
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  dried basil, oregano or thyme, crushed
6: 2  cups  lightly packed, coarsely chopped fresh spinach
7: 8  ounces  colby and Monterey Jack cheese or American cheese, shredded (2 cups)
8: 6   eggs
9: 2  cups  milk
10: 3  tablespoons  Dijon-style mustard
11: 1/2 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the broiler. Slice the croissants in half horizontally. Arrange croissant halves, cut sides up, in a single layer on an extra--arge baking sheet. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until light brown. Set aside.
1: In a very large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in skillet. Crumble bacon; set aside.
2: Cook onion, sweet peppers, mushrooms, and basil in hot bacon drippings about 5 minutes or until vegetables are almost tender, stirring occasionally. Add spinach; stir until wilted and well coated. Transfer onion mixture to a colander set in sink; drain. Stir in bacon. Set aside.
3: In a greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish, arrange croissant bottoms, cut sides up, in a single layer, overlapping slightly. Sprinkle cheese over croissants. Spoon onion mixture over cheese; add croissant tops, cut sides down.
4: In a large bowl, beat eggs with a rotary beater; beat in milk, mustard and black pepper. Carefully pour egg mixture over strata; gently press down on croissants. Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 8 to 24 hours.
5: Uncover strata. Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Bake, uncovered, in a 325 degree F oven for 50 to 55 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean and strata puffs up, covering with foil the last 15 minutes of baking time to avoid overbrowning. Remove from oven. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm. Makes 10 to 12 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   egg yolks
1: 4   egg whites
2: 1/4 cup  butter or margarine
3: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
4: 1/4 teaspoon  dry mustard
5: dash ground red pepper
6: 1  cup  milk
7: 2  cups  shredded cheddar, colby, Havarti, and/or process Swiss cheese (8 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Allow the egg yolks and egg whites to stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.
1: For cheese sauce, in a medium saucepan melt butter; stir in flour, dry mustard, and cayenne pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Add cheese, a little at a time, stirring until melted. In a medium bowl beat egg yolks with a fork until combined. Slowly add cheese sauce to egg yolks, stirring constantly. Cool slightly.
2: In a large mixing bowl beat egg whites with an electric mixer on medium to high speed until stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold about 1 cup of the stiffly beaten egg whites into cheese sauce.
3: Gradually pour cheese sauce over remaining stiffly beaten egg whites, folding to combine. Pour into an ungreased 2-quart souffle dish.
4: Bake in a 350 degree F oven for about 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Light, airy, and beautifully golden, this souffle main dish tastes even better when made with a combination of cheeses.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  ground beef
1: 1  15  ounce can tomato sauce
2: 1  cup  chopped onion
3: 1  cup  chopped green sweet pepper
4: 1/2 cup  water
5: 1  1 1/2 ounce package dry spaghetti sauce mix
6: 1  teaspoon  dried oregano, crushed
7: 1   clove garlic, minced
8: Several dashes bottled hot pepper sauce
9: 1  cup  milk
10: 1/4 cup  butter, melted
11: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
12: 2   eggs
13: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
14: 8  ounces  shredded mozzarella cheese (2 cups)
15: 1/2 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 12-inch skillet, cook ground beef until brown. Drain off the fat.
1: Stir in tomato sauce, onion, green pepper, water, spaghetti sauce mix, oregano, garlic, and hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, beat milk, eggs, butter, and cooking oil with an electric mixer on medium speed for 1 minute. Add the flour and beat for 2 minutes more.
3: Turn meat mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; sprinkle with the mozzarella. Top with the flour mixture. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Bake in a 400 degree F oven about 30 minutes or until puffed and golden.
4: Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 10 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  tiny new potatoes, cut into 1/4-inch slices
1: 1/3 cup  thinly sliced leek
2: Nonstick cooking spray
3: 3/4 cup  chopped lower-fat and lower-sodium cooked ham
4: 3  ounces  reduced-fat Swiss cheese, cut into small pieces
5: 1 1/4 cups  fat-free milk
6: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
7: 3/4 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed
8: 2  teaspoons  snipped fresh thyme or 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a covered large saucepan cook sliced potatoes in a small amount of boiling, lightly salted water about 10 minutes or just until tender, adding the leek the last 5 minutes of cooking. Drain potato mixture.
1: Coat a 2-quart rectangular baking dish with cooking spray. Place potato mixture in bottom of the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the ham and Swiss cheese.
2: In a medium bowl stir the milk into the flour until smooth. Stir in the egg product, thyme, and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over potato mixture.
3: Bake in a 350 degrees  oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve immediately.
recipe_description: Serve this thyme-flavored, ham, potato, and egg breakfast casserole for brunch or dinner with fresh fruit and juice.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6  ounces  dried gemelli pasta (1-2/3 cups) or dried medium noodles (3 cups)
1: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine
2: 1 1/2 cups  sliced cremini mushrooms or sliced button mushrooms
3: 1  cup  chopped onion
4: 3  cups  chopped cooked chicken*
5: 1  15  ounce bottle mushroom alfredo pasta sauce
6: 1 1/2 cups  shredded Italian-blend cheeses (6 ounces)
7: 1  9 - 10  ounce package frozen cut asparagus or frozen peas, thawed
8: 1/2 cup  dairy sour cream
9: 1/2 cup  finely chopped bottled roasted red sweet peppers
10: 1  teaspoon  dried fines herbes or Italian seasoning, crushed
11: 1/2 cup  panko (Japanese bread crumbs) or fine dry bread crumbs
12: 1/4 cup  sliced almonds or chopped pecans, toasted
13: 2  tablespoons  grated Parmesan cheese
14: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine, melted
recipe_name: The Ultimate Chicken and Noodle Casserole
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Return to pan.
1: Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat until melted. Add mushrooms and onion; cook and stir until mushrooms are tender. Stir into pasta along with the chicken, pasta sauce, Italian-blend cheeses, asparagus, sour cream, sweet peppers and fines herbes. Transfer mixture to a 13x9x2-inch baking dish (3-quart rectangular).
2: In a small bowl, combine panko, nuts, Parmesan cheese and 2 tablespoons melted butter. Sprinkle over chicken mixture. Bake, uncovered, in a 350 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through and topping is golden. Makes 6 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10  ounce container refrigerated light Alfredo pasta sauce
1: 1/2 cup  milk
2: 2 1/2 cups  cooked white rice or wild rice
3: 2  cups  cubed cooked chicken
4: 1  cup  frozen peas
5: 1/3 cup  chopped bottled roasted red sweet peppers
6: 1/4 cup  slivered almonds, toasted (optional)
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or 1/2 tsp. dried basil, crushed
8: 1  cup  soft bread crumbs
9: 1  tablespoon  butter, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine pasta sauce and milk. Stir in rice, chicken, peas, sweet peppers, nuts, and basil. Transfer to 1-1/2-quart baking dish.
1: Bake, covered, 30 minutes. Uncover and stir. Combine bread crumbs and melted butter; sprinkle atop. Bake, uncovered, 20 to 25 minutes more or until heated through and crumbs are golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4.
recipe_description: Looking for a yummy casserole recipe? This old-fashioned chicken and rice main dish is truly comfort food at its best.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 6  ounces  dried medium noodles
2: 3/4 pound  boneless chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
3: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
4: 4   green onions, sliced
5: 1/2 of a medium red sweet pepper, chopped
6: 1/4 cup  chicken broth
7: 2  cloves garlic, minced
8: 1  10 3/4 ounce can reduced-fat, reduced-sodium, condensed cream of broccoli or cream of chicken soup
9: 1  8  ounce container fat-free dairy sour cream
10: 1  teaspoon  dry mustard
11: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
12: 1  10  ounce package frozen chopped broccoli, thawed
13: 1/4 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
14: 1  tablespoon  butter or margarine, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Coat a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
1: Cook noodles according to package directions, except omit salt or oil. Drain. Rinse with cold water and drain.
2: Coat a large skillet with more cooking spray. Add the chicken. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Transfer the mixture from the skillet to a large mixing bowl.
3: Add mushrooms, green onions, red pepper, broth, and garlic to skillet. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
4: Transfer to large bowl with chicken. Add soup, sour cream, mustard, and pepper to chicken mixture. Gently stir in the noodles and broccoli.
5: Spoon into prepared baking dish. Mix bread crumbs and melted butter. Sprinkle over noodles. Cover with foil. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 10 to 15 minutes more or until heated through. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  lean ground beef
1: 1  15  ounce can Italian-style tomato sauce
2: 1  4  ounce can sliced mushrooms, drained
3: 1/4 cup  sliced pitted ripe olives (optional)
4: 1 - 1 1/2 cups  shredded mozzarella cheese (4 to 6 ounces)
5: 1  10  ounce package refrigerated biscuits (10 biscuits)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large skillet cook beef until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in tomato sauce, mushrooms, and olives (if using). Heat through. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart rectangular baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese.
1: Flatten each biscuit with your hands. Arrange the biscuits on top of cheese. Bake for 15 to 17 minutes or until biscuits are golden.
2: Makes 5 servings
recipe_description: A bubbly concoction of cheese, beef, and tomatoes is tucked beneath a golden brown biscuit topping for a family-friendly meal.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium eggplant (1 pound), peeled if desired
1: 2  tablespoons  margarine or vegetable oil spread
2: 1 1/2 cups  chopped onion
3: 2  cups  chopped green sweet pepper
4: 1  tablespoon  margarine or vegetable oil spread
5: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
8: 1/2 cup  sliced pitted ripe olives
9: 1/2 cup  shredded sharp American cheese or cheddar cheese (2 ounces)
10: 1  8  ounce can tomato sauce
11: 3/4 cup  soft bread crumbs (1 slice)
12: 1  tablespoon  margarine or vegetable oil spread, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch cubes. Cook eggplant cubes in the 2 tablespoons margarine until tender. Remove from skillet.
1: In the same skillet cook onion and sweet pepper in the 1 tablespoon margarine until tender, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir in flour, salt, and black pepper. Add olives.
2: Layer half the eggplant in a 1-1/2-quart casserole. Add half the olive mixture and half the cheese. Repeat layers. Pour tomato sauce over all. Mix crumbs with melted margarine or vegetable oil spread; sprinkle over tomato sauce. Bake, uncovered, in a 375 degree F oven for about 30 minutes or until edges are bubbly. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
recipe_description: This vegetable side-dish casserole recipe goes well with chicken and fish. The original recipe, from the 1950s, called for eggplant when likely only one type was available. Today's cooks have more choices. Whichever variety is used, purchase slightly more than a pound to equal the 5 to 5-1/2 cups of cubes needed for this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium white onion, sliced
1: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
2: 2   medium zucchini or other summer squash (10 ounces total), thinly sliced
3: 2  cups  salsa
4: 2  cups  chicken or vegetable broth
5: 4  cups  torn, stemmed spinach leaves (about 5 ounces)
6: 8  ounces  tortilla chips (about 8 cups, loosely packed)
7: 1/2 cup  finely grated Mexican queso anejo, Parmesan or Romano cheese (2 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook the onion in oil until tender, but not brown. Add zucchini. Cook and stir until the vegetables begin to brown.
1: Add salsa, broth and spinach. Bring to boiling. Add the tortilla chips and stir to coat. Remove from heat. Cover and let mixture stand for 5 minutes.
2: Very carefully stir the mixture to check that the chips have softened nicely. (Rick prefers them to have a few chewy edges. If there's still too much crunch remaining, the chef dribbles in a little extra broth and returns the mixture in saucepan to heat for a few minutes.)
3: Sprinkle with cheese. Serve from the pan. Or you can spoon mixture onto warm plates or into shallow bowls in the kitchen before sprinkling with cheese. Makes 4 to 6 main-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10 3/4 ounce can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
1: 1/2 cup  milk
2: 2   eggs
3: 1  16  ounce can whole kernel corn, drained
4: 1  8  ounce package corn muffin mix
5: 1/4 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
6: 1  2.8 ounce can French fried onions (about 1 1/3 cups)
recipe_instructions:
0: Beat the soup, milk and eggs in a medium bowl with a fork or whisk.  Stir in the corn, corn muffin mix, cheese, and 23 cup onions.  Pour the soup mixture into a 1 1/2-quart casserole.
1: Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until the mixture is hot.
2: Top with the remaining onions.  Bake for 5 minutes or until the onions are golden brown.
recipe_description: Reminiscent of cornbread, this enticing casserole adds the favorite flavor upgrade of corn in another form to any daily dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  bulk pork sausage
1: 1  8  ounce package sliced mushrooms
2: 2   stalks celery, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
3: 1   large red pepper, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
4: 1   large onion, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
5: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme leaves, crushed
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried marjoram leaves, crushed
7: 1  6  ounce box seasoned long-grain and wild rice mix
8: 1 3/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Stock
9: 1  10 3/4 ounce can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
10: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (about 4 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook the sausage in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to separate meat. Pour off any fat.
1: Add the mushrooms, celery, pepper, onion, thyme, marjoram and seasoning packet from the rice blend to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
2: Stir the sausage mixture, stock, soup, rice blend and 1/2 cup cheese in a 3-quart shallow baking dish. Cover the baking dish.
3: Bake at 375 degrees F. for 1 hour or until the sausage is cooked through and the rice is tender. Stir the sausage mixture before serving. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
4: For an extra-special touch, substitute 1 package (8 ounces) baby portobello mushrooms, sliced, for the sliced mushrooms.
recipe_description: Come in from the cold and enjoy this flavorful sausage, vegetable and rice casserole that's easy to put together and even better to eat!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8   meaty veal shanks, cut 1-1/2 inches thick  (7 pounds)
1: Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper
2: 6  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil
3: 6   carrots, cut into 1/4-inch dice
4: 6   celery ribs, cut into 1/4-inch dice
5: 2   onions, cut into 1/4-inch dice
6: 6   garlic cloves, 4 whole, 2 minced
7: 3   bay leaves
8: 4  cups  chicken stock or low-sodium broth
9: 2  cups  dry white wine
10: 1  15  ounce can diced Italian tomatoes
11: 6   thyme sprigs
12: 2  2 1/2 inch strips orange zest, minced
13: 2  2 1/2 inch strips lemon zest, minced
14: 2  tablespoons  minced flat-leaf parsley
related_categories:
0: Casseroles
1: Italian Veal Dishes
2: More Veal Favorites
3: Veal
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Season the veal shanks with salt and pepper. In a very large, deep skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of the olive oil until shimmering. Working in batches, cook the veal over moderately high heat until browned on both sides, about 8 minutes total per batch. Transfer the osso buco to a large roasting pan.
1: Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil to the skillet. Add the diced carrots, celery, onions, 4 whole garlic cloves, and the bay leaves and cook over moderate heat until they are softened, about 12 minutes. Add the chicken stock, white wine, diced tomatoes, and thyme sprigs and bring to a boil. Pour the vegetables and liquid over the veal, cover the roasting pan with foil and transfer to the oven. Braise the shanks for about 2-1/2 hours, until very tender.
2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the orange zest, lemon zest, parsley, and the 2 minced garlic cloves. Lightly season the gremolata with salt and pepper.
3: Transfer the veal shanks to a baking sheet and cover with foil. Carefully strain the cooking liquid into a large bowl. Reserve the vegetables; discard the bay leaves and thyme sprigs. Pour the cooking liquid back into the roasting pan and boil over high heat until it is reduced by half, about 25 minutes. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Stir in the reserved vegetables and simmer over moderately low heat for 2 minutes. Transfer the osso buco to shallow bowls. Spoon the sauce and vegetables on top and sprinkle lightly with the gremolata. Serve with the remaining gremolata at the table.
4: The osso buco can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
recipe_description: Ethan Stowell sticks to Italian tradition when making osso buco, topping braised veal shanks with a citrusy gremolata (orange and lemon zest mixed with garlic and parsley). He advises spooning out and eating all of the marrow from the bones for what he calls "a mouthful of fatty goodness."

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  lean ground beef
1: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
2: 1/2 cup  chopped green bell pepper
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
5: 1/4 teaspoon  seasoned salt
6: 3 1/2 cups  hot water
7: 1/2 cup  milk
8: 1  package Betty Crocker® Hamburger Helper® beef pasta
9: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
10: 1/4 cup  barbecue sauce
11: 2  tablespoons  ketchup
12: 1 1/2 cups  Original Bisquick® mix
13: 1  cup  milk
14: 2   eggs
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Casseroles
2: Ground Beef
3: Ground Beef Casserole
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In 10-inch skillet, cook beef, onion, bell pepper, salt, pepper and seasoned salt over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until beef is brown; drain.
1: Stir hot water, 1/2 cup milk and the Sauce Mix into beef mixture. Stir in brown sugar, barbecue sauce and ketchup. Heat to boiling, stirring occasionally.  Spoon beef mixture into ungreased rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches; stir in uncooked pasta. Set aside.
2: In medium bowl, stir Bisquick mix, 1 cup milk and the eggs until blended. Pour evenly over beef mixture.
3: Bake cobbler 30 to 35 minutes or until light golden.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Use 4 cups hot water. Bake 38 to 42 minutes.
recipe_description: From Betty's Soul Food Collection...    Hamburger Helper jumpstarts casserole-making.  A touch of this and that make this one a winner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  32  ounce bag Southern-style hash-brown potatoes, thawed (about 7 1/2 cups)
1: 1  6  ounce can French's® French Fried Onions (2 2/3 cups)
2: 1  cup  frozen peas, thawed
3: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (4 ounces)
4: 4  slices bacon, cooked and crumbled
5: 2  10 3/4 cans Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Celery Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
6: 1  cup  milk
recipe_instructions:
0: Stir the potatoes, 1 1/3 cups of the onions, peas, cheese and bacon in a 13 x 9-inch (3-quart) shallow baking dish. Stir the soup and milk in a medium bowl. Pour the soup mixture over the potato mixture. Cover.
1: Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until hot. Stir.
2: Sprinkle with the remaining onions. Bake for 5 minutes more or until the onions are golden brown.
3: Time-Saving Tip: To thaw the hash browns, cut off 1 corner on bag and microwave on HIGH for 5 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 15  ounce package (1 crust) rolled refrigerated unbaked piecrust
1: 1   medium fennel bulb
2: 1  pound  fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
3: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
4: 3/4 cup  fat-free milk
5: 2  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
6: 3   eggs
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil, crushed
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
10: 1  cup  shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese (4 ounces)
11: Fresh basil leaves (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Let piecrust stand at room temperature according to package directions. Line a 9-inch pie plate with piecrust. Crimp edge as desired. Line unpricked pastry with a double thickness of foil. Bake for 8 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 4 to 5 minutes more or until pastry is set and dry. Remove from oven. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F.
1: Meanwhile, trim top off fennel bulb, reserving some of the feathery leaves for garnish. Trim fennel bulb and thinly slice. In a covered medium saucepan, cook fennel, asparagus, and onion in a small amount of boiling water for 4 to 6 minutes or just until vegetables are tender. Drain vegetables; set aside.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk and flour until smooth. Add eggs, snipped or dried basil, salt, and pepper, whisking until combined.
3: Spoon fennel mixture into baked piecrust. Sprinkle with cheese. Slowly pour egg mixture over all.
4: Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 35 minutes or until egg mixture is set in center. If necessary to prevent overbrowning, cover edge of pie with foil for the last 5 to 10 minutes of baking. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Top with reserved fennel leaves and, if desired, fresh basil leaves.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  8  ounce package Mexican-blend shredded cheese
1: 1  15  ounce can black beans, rinsed and drained
2: 1  7  ounce can corn, drained
3: 2/3 cup  salsa
4: 2  tablespoons  chopped cilantro
5: 2  4 1/2- 4 3/4 ounce packages skinless, boneless roasted chicken breast
6: 2  10 - 12  inches  flour tortillas
recipe_instructions:
0: Place a burrito-size flour tortilla on a serving plate. Sprinkle with 1/4 of shredded cheese. In a bowl, combine black beans, corn, 1/3 cup salsa and 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro.
1: Spread bean mixture onto the tortilla. Sprinkle with another 1/4 of cheese. Top with a flour tortilla, and sprinkle with 1/4 of cheese. Slice chicken breast, and combine in bowl with 1/3 cup salsa and 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro. Place chicken mixture on top of cheese, sprinkle with remaining 1/4 of cheese, and top with a flour tortilla. Cover with a piece of parchment or wax paper, and microwave for 10 minutes at 50 percent power. Cut into slices.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  pounds  meaty chicken or rabbit pieces, skinned
1: 1 1/2 cups  onion cut into small wedges
2: 4   cloves garlic, minced
3: 1  14 1/2 ounce can tomatoes, cut up
4: 1  10  ounce package frozen sliced okra
5: 1/2 cup  chicken broth
6: 1  teaspoon  yellow mustard
7: 1  teaspoon  Worcestershire sauce
8: 1/2 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
10: 1/4 teaspoon  bottled hot pepper sauce
11: 1  8  ounce can whole kernel corn, drained
12: 1  8  ounce can baby lima beans, drained
13: 1/2 cup  cubed ham
14: 1  12  ounce jar brown gravy
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 4-1/2-quart Dutch oven, combine chicken or rabbit, onion, garlic, tomatoes, okra, chicken broth, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, pepper, and hot pepper sauce. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes or until chicken or rabbit is tender.
1: Add corn, lima beans, and ham. Stir in gravy. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: From Brunswick County, Virginia or North Carolina? The debate still rages over where this country hearty chicken stew gets its name.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  chicken breast tenderloins, halved crosswise
1: Salt and ground black pepper
2: 1  tablespoon  olive oil or cooking oil
3: 1  pound  fresh asparagus, trimmed
4: 1  pound  fresh sugar snap or snow pea pods, trimmed
5: 6  cups  watercress, tough stems removed
6: 2   medium yellow sweet peppers, seeded and cut into thin strips
7: 1  cup  grape tomatoes
8: 1   recipe Garlic Ginger Soy Dressing (see recipe below)
9: 1  tablespoon  sesame seeds, toasted
10: 1/2 cup  rice vinegar
11: 1/3 cup  olive oil
12: 1   clove garlic, minced
13: 2  teaspoons  honey
14: 2  teaspoons  soy sauce
15: 1  teaspoon  sesame seeds, toasted
16: 3/4 teaspoon  ground ginger
17: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
18: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Sprinkle chicken lightly with salt and pepper. In a large skillet cook chicken in hot oil over medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes or until no longer pink, turning to brown evenly. Remove chicken from skillet. Cool slightly; place in an airtight container. Chill at least 1 hour or up to 2 days until ready to serve.
1: In a large saucepan cook asparagus and pea pods, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 2 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain; rinse with cold water. Drain well. Use immediately or place in an airtight container and chill up to 2 days.
2: To serve, in a very large bowl toss together chilled chicken, asparagus  spears,  pea pods, watercress, sweet peppers, and tomatoes. Add Garlic Ginger Soy Dressing; toss well. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Makes 12 servings.
3: In a screw-top jar combine rice vinegar, olive oil, minced garlic, honey, soy sauce, sesame seeds, ground ginger, salt, and black pepper. Cover and shake well. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator up to 1 week; shake before serving.
recipe_description: Eliminate the chicken for a vegetarian version of this main dish salad.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  chicken thighs
1: Salt (divided) and pepper
2: 2  teaspoons  canola oil
3: 2  cups  diced onion
4: 1 1/2 cups  diced celery
5: 1  cup  frozen diced carrots
6: 2  teaspoons  sage
7: 1  teaspoon  garlic powder
8: 1/4 teaspoon  thyme
9: 1/8 teaspoon  nutmeg
10: 4  cups  low-salt chicken broth
11: 1  cup  water
12: 2  cups  cooked brown rice
recipe_instructions:
0: Remove skin from chicken; season with salt and pepper. Heat an 8-quart pot on medium. Sear chicken in oil until golden, 10 minutes. Meanwhile, mix onions, celery, carrots, sage, garlic powder, a little more salt, thyme, and nutmeg.
1: Add vegetable-and-spice mixture to chicken. Saute until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add broth and the water. Cover pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer 30 minutes, until chicken pulls away from the bone. Remove chicken; discard bones and add meat back to the pot. Mix in rice; heat 2 to 3 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  mayonnaise
1: 3  tablespoons  finely chopped red onion
2: 3  tablespoons  finely chopped celery
3: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
4: 2  teaspoons  fresh lemon juice
5: 2  cups  chopped, cooked chicken (reserved from No-Fuss Snack Mix Chicken, bones removed if present)
6: 8  slices wheat bread, toasted if desired
7: Romaine lettuce leaves, arugula or lettuce
8: 8   thin tomato slices, about 1 medium tomato
recipe_instructions:
0: In medium bowl stir together mayonnaise, onion, celery, lemon peel, and lemon juice. Add chopped chicken, stir to coat; set aside.
1: Arrange lettuce leaves on 4 bread slices; top with tomato slices. Spoon chicken mixture on tomatoes; top with remaining bread slices. Serve immediately or wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate up to 6 hours. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Chicken is added to a simple mayonnaise and lemon mixture for these quick-and-easy lunch sandwiches. Try multi-grain bread to add a healthy touch to this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
1: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
2: 1  teaspoon  ground coriander
3: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
4: 1  teaspoon  ground paprika
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/2 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
7: 2   medium onions, cut into wedges
8: 3   cloves garlic, minced
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 1  28  ounce can crushed tomatoes
11: 1  15  ounce can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
12: 1 1/2 cups  water
13: 1/2 cup  raisins
14: 1/3 cup  small pitted ripe olives
15: 3  cups  hot cooked couscous
16: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh cilantro
recipe_instructions:
0: In a bowl coat chicken pieces with a mixture of flour, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and cinnamon. Set aside.
1: In a 4-quart Dutch oven cook onion and garlic in hot oil about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from Dutch oven, reserving oil in pan. Add chicken pieces, about half at a time, to pan. Cook quickly until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Return all chicken and the onion mixture to pan. Add crushed tomatoes, beans, water, raisins, and olives. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 10 minutes or until chicken is tender, stirring occasionally. Spoon couscous into soup bowls. Ladle stew over the couscous and sprinkle with snipped cilantro. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: This low fat chicken dish gives you a complete meal in just 35 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cups  finely chopped fresh mushrooms
1: 1  14  ounce can reduced-sodium chicken broth
2: 1  cup  finely chopped onion
3: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
4: 1  teaspoon  dried basil, crushed
5: 1  cup  soft bread crumbs (1 1/3 slices bread)
6: 6   skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (about 2 pounds)
7: Salt and ground black pepper
8: 2  tablespoons  butter
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 1  cup  purchased marinara sauce
11: 1/2 cup  whipping cream
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet, combine mushrooms, broth, onion, thyme and basil. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and boil gently, uncovered, about 20 minutes or till chicken broth has almost evaporated, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; cool for 10 minutes. Stir in bread crumbs.
1: Meanwhile, place a chicken breast half between 2 pieces of plastic wrap. Using the flat side of a meat mallet, pound chicken lightly to about 1/4 inch thick. Remove plastic wrap. Repeat with remaining chicken breast halves. Sprinkle chicken breasts lightly with salt and pepper. Evenly spread about 1/4 cup of the filling on each chicken piece. Fold in the bottom and sides; roll up. Press all edges firmly to seal in the filling. Secure with wooden toothpicks.
2: In a 12-inch oven-going skillet, heat the butter and oil. Add chicken rolls. Cook over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or till golden brown, turning to brown all sides. Bake, uncovered, in a 375 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till chicken is no longer pink (170 degree F). Remove toothpicks.
3: Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, stir together marinara sauce and cream; heat through (do not boil). To serve, slice stuffed breasts. Serve with sauce. Makes 6 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/4 pounds  ground raw chicken
1: 2  cups  chopped onion
2: 1  teaspoon  salt
3: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
4: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
5: 3  tablespoons  packed brown sugar
6: 3  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar
7: 2  tablespoons  water
8: 1  tablespoon  unsalted butter
9: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
10: 2  large red tomatoes, thinly sliced
11: 1  large yellow tomato, thinly sliced
12: 4  cups  fresh Italian bread crumbs
13: 1/2 cup  fresh basil leaves
14: 1/4 cup  oil-packed dried tomatoes
15: 1  clove garlic, sliced
16: 8  ounces  shredded Monterey Jack cheese with jalapeno peppers (2 cups)
17: 1/2 15  ounce package rolled refrigerated unbaked pie crusts (1 crust)
18: 2 - 3  tablespoons  snipped fresh parsley
19: 1 - 2  tablespoons  crumbled farmers or goat cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 12-inch oven-going skillet, cook chicken, onion, salt and pepper in 2 tablespoon hot olive oil over medium heat for 10 minutes or until onion is tender and chicken is no longer pink, stirring frequently; drain and return to skillet. Stir in the brown sugar, vinegar and water. Cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes more. Remove meat mixture from skillet; set aside.
1: In the same skillet, heat the unsalted butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat until butter is melted, tilting skillet to coat bottom with melted butter mixture. Remove from heat. Arrange red and yellow tomato slices in the bottom of the skillet, overlapping slices as needed.
2: In a food processor, combine bread crumbs, basil leaves, dried tomatoes and garlic. Cover and process until basil is chopped and mixture is combined. Layer bread crumb mixture over tomatoes in skillet, pressing down lightly. Spoon cooked chicken mixture over bread crumb mixture. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
3: Unroll pie crust and, if necessary, roll to diameter large enough to cover mixture in skillet. Lay pie crust on top of layers in skillet.
4: Bake in a 425 degrees  oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove skillet from oven. Let stand 5 minutes on a wire rack. Loosen edges; invert skillet over a large serving plate. Garnish with parsley and crumbled cheese. Serve warm.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  buttermilk
1: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh dill
2: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh chives
3: 2  cloves garlic, minced
4: 1  tablespoon  lemon juice
5: 1  teaspoon  Dijon-style mustard
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
8: 2  pounds  chicken breast tenders
9: Nonstick cooking spray
10: 4  cups  corn flakes, crushed
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl combine the buttermilk, herbs, garlic, lemon juice, mustard, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken to the bowl and turn to coat in the marinade. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes or overnight, stirring the mixture occasionally.
1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place a wire cooling rack in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan or over a baking sheet. Coat the rack with nonstick cooking spray; set aside. Place corn flakes in a shallow dish. Remove the chicken tenders from the marinade a few at a time and dip in crumbs to coat. Arrange chicken on prepared rack. Sprinkle with any remaining crumbs and pat lightly.
2: Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside and crumbs start to brown.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6   ears fresh corn
1: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2: 4  slices bacon (preferably thick-cut), chopped into 1/4-inch pieces
3: 1   onion, chopped
4: 4  cups  low-fat milk
5: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
6: 1/4 cup  chopped fresh parsely
7: 1  cup  shredded leftover chicken
recipe_instructions:
0: Shuck the corn, then stand each ear up in a bowl and use a knife to scrape off the kernels; set aside. Put the cobs, 1 cup water, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper in a 4-quart pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat so the water bubbles gently, cover, and cook for 20 to 30 minutes. Leave the cobs in the pot until you are ready to make the soup, then discard them, reserving the corncob stock.
1: In the last few minutes of cooking the corn, add 1 cup shredded leftover cooked chicken.
2: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until it begins to render its fat and turns golden-brown, about 4 to 6 minutes. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, another 5 minutes or so.
3: Add the milk, reserved corn kernels, and bacon and onion to the stock, and bring to a boil; lower the heat so that the soup bubbles gently. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until the corn is tender, about 10 minutes.
4: Whisk the cornstarch in a small bowl with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to the soup, stirring until the soup thickens, about a minute. Taste, adjust the seasoning, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   large eggs
1: 1/3 cup  vegetable oil
2: 1  teaspoon  salt
3: 1  cup  matzoh meal
4: 1 1/2 tablespoons  kosher salt, more to taste
5: 3   stalks celery, cut into large chunks
6: 1   large parsnip, peeled and cut into large chunks
7: 1   onion, peeled and halved
8: 6  sprigs fresh dill
9: 4  sprigs fresh parsley
10: 1  3 - 3 1/2 pound  chicken, skinned and quartered
11: 3   large carrots, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch rounds
12: Chopped fresh dill, for garnish (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Whisk together the eggs, 1/2 cup cold water, the oil, and the salt. Stir in the matzoh meal slowly to avoid creating lumps. Stir until smooth and thick. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate until coldat least 2 hours. Makes 6 dozen.
1: In a large pot bring 4 quarts water and the salt to a boil. Place the celery, parsnip, onion, dill, and parsley sprigs in a large square of cheesecloth and tie with kitchen string. When the water comes to a boil, add the chicken, carrots, and vegetable bundle. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the carrots are soft, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove the chicken to a bowl and reserve for another use; remove and discard the vegetable bundle.
2: Form the matzoh mixture into 3/4-inch balls (keep a small bowl of water nearby to prevent hands from getting sticky).
3: Bring broth and carrots to a simmer. Drop in the matzoh balls and simmer until they are cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:

4: 1  tablespoon  minced fresh garlic (6 cloves)

1: Add the beans and broth. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until the flavors have melded, about 15 minutes. Serve over chips or rice, if desired, and garnish with cilantro and cheese.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  chopped cooked chicken
1: 4  stalks celery, chopped (2 cups)
2: 2  medium carrots, shredded (1 cup)
3: 1  cup  chopped red sweet pepper
4: 2  4  ounce can (drained weight) sliced mushrooms, drained
5: 2/3 cup  sliced or slivered almonds, toasted
6: 2  tablespoons  diced pimiento, drained
7: 2  10 3/4 ounce cans condensed cream of chicken soup
8: 2  cups  chow mein noodles
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In an extra-large bowl, stir together chicken, celery, carrots, sweet pepper, mushrooms, almonds, and pimiento. Add soup to chicken mixture; mix well.
1: Transfer chicken mixture to an ungreased 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Bake, covered, for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with chow mein noodles. Bake, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes more or until heated through. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   medium skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (1 pound)
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil or canola oil
2: 2  tablespoons  lemon juice
3: 1 1/2 tablespoons  snipped fresh basil or 1 teaspoon dried basil or Italian seasoning, crushed
4: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
5: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
6: 2  cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
7: 1   medium zucchini, cut into thin strips (about 1-1/2 cups)
8: 2   medium carrots, cut into thin strips (about 2/3 cup)
9: Hot cooked rice or orzo (optional)
10: Fresh basil sprigs (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Fold four 28x12-inch pieces of foil in half to make four 14x12-inch rectangles. To assemble chicken bundles, place 1 chicken breast on each piece of foil, tucking under thin tip of the chicken breast. Fold up edges of foil slightly.
1: In a small bowl, stir together the oil, lemon juice, basil, salt and pepper. Drizzle oil mixture over the chicken breasts. Top with mushrooms, zucchini and carrots, dividing equally among chicken bundles.
2: Bring up 2 opposite edges of foil; seal with a double fold. Fold remaining ends to enclose the chicken and vegetables, leaving space for steam to build. Place foil bundles on a shallow baking pan.
3: Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till an instant-read thermometer inserted into chicken registers 170 degree F (carefully open foil when you check doneness).
4: Serve in foil packets or transfer chicken and vegetables to serving plates and drizzle with cooking juices. If you like, serve with rice or orzo and garnish with basil. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  orange juice
1: 1/3 cup  dried cranberries
2: 1 1/2 pounds  uncooked ground chicken
3: 1/3 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
4: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh marjoram or 1 teaspoon dried marjoram, crushed
5: 1/4 teaspoon  kosher salt or 1/8 teaspoon regular salt

7: 4  thin slices fresh mozzarella cheese or 4 slices regular mozzarella cheese
8: 4   Kaiser rolls or sesame hamburger buns, split and toasted

recipe_instructions:
0: In a small saucepan, bring orange juice to boiling. Remove from heat; stir in cranberries. Let stand for 5 minutes. Drain cranberries, discarding orange juice.
1: Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine ground chicken, bread crumbs, marjoram and salt. Shape chicken mixture into 8 1/2-inch-thick patties. (The mixture may be sticky. If necessary, wet hands to shape patties.)
2: Place one-fourth of the cranberries and one-fourth of the Parmesan cheese on the center of each of 4 patties. Top with the remaining patties; press edges to seal.
3: For a charcoal grill: Grill patties on the greased rack of an uncovered grill directly over medium coals for 14 to 18 minutes or until no longer pink (165 degrees F)*, turning once halfway through grilling. (For a gas grill: Preheat grill. Reduce heat to medium. Place patties on greased grill rack over heat. Cover; grill as above.) Top each burger with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Grill, uncovered, about 3 minutes more or until cheese begins to melt. Serve burgers on toasted rolls with lettuce leaves. Makes 4 burgers.

recipe_ingredients:

1: In covered microwave-safe dish place carrots, remaining ginger, and 2 tablespoons water. Cook on HIGH 4 minutes. Add rice, peas, pepper. Cook, covered, 5 minutes; stir twice.
2: Remove chicken and juices. Wipe skillet with paper towels; return to heat. Add eggs, cook and stir 30 seconds to scramble. Stir in rice mixture; heat through. Serve chicken and juices with fried rice, onions, and soy sauce.
recipe_description: Chicken drumsticks are served with a simple vegetable and rice mixture in this quick-fix dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4 - 6   medium chicken breast halves (2 to 3 pounds total)
1: 1 1/2 cups  dry white wine
2: 1/2 cup  olive oil
3: 1  tablespoon  dried Italian seasoning, crushed
4: 2  teaspoons  minced fresh garlic
recipe_instructions:
0: Remove skin from the chicken, if you like. Put the chicken in a plastic bag set in a shallow baking dish.
1: In a small bowl, stir together the wine with the olive oil, Italian seasoning and garlic. Pour the mixture over the chicken in a plastic bag. Close the bag. Marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight.
2: Drain chicken, reserving the marinade. In a covered grill, arrange the preheated coals around a drip pan for indirect grilling. Test for medium heat above the pan.
3: Place the chicken on a grill rack, with the bone side up, over a drip pan. Cover the chicken and grill for 50 to 60 minutes or until the meat is tender and no longer pink, turning once. Brush the chicken once with the reserved marinade halfway through the grilling time.
4: Discard the remaining marinade. Garnish with sprigs of fresh herbs, if you like.

recipe_ingredients:

Simmer, uncovered, about 30 minutes or until slightly thickened. Serve topped with sour cream and bacon.
