recipe_description: This versatile, slow-cooked side dish can be served over rice for a meatless main-course, but on it's own, it makes a fabulous side dish for buffets, barbecues and everyday meals.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 stick (3/4 cup) plus 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened, plus additional for baking dish
1: 2 1/2 cups  all-purpose flour
2: 1  teaspoon  baking soda
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1  cup  firmly packed light brown sugar
5: 2  large eggs, at room temperature
6: 2  tablespoons  heavy cream
7: 1/2 teaspoon  almond extract
8: 1  cup  dried cherries
9: 1/2 cup  old-fashioned oats
10: 1/2 cup  sweetened flaked coconut
11: 1/2 cup  sliced almonds
12: 1  12  ounce jar apricot preserves
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 325 degree F and arrange rack in center. Butter a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish, then line with foil, allowing a 2-inch overhang on longer sides to use as handles; butter foil.
1: Whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl.
2: Beat together 1-1/2 sticks butter and the sugar in a large bowl on high speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add cream and extract; beat until combined well.
3: Reduce speed to low and slowly add flour mixture, beating until just combined. Fold in cherries. Evenly spread batter in prepared dish.
4: Bake until golden, about 30 minutes. Transfer cookie layer in dish to rack and cool completely.
5: Meanwhile, using fingertips, mix together oats, coconut, almonds, and remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Spread out on a baking sheet and bake, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 12 to 14 minutes. Cool.
6: Spread preserves over cookie layer in dish, then sprinkle evenly with oat mixture. Holding foil handles, lift out of dish and place on work surface. Cut into 1-inch squares. (Can be stored at room temperature in an airtight container, in single layers separated by waxed paper, up to 1 week. Makes about 60 bar cookies.
recipe_description: Dried cherries, oats, and coconut make these apricot bars nice enough to give as a gift.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  all-purpose flour
1: 1/2 cup  powdered sugar
2: 2  tablespoons  cornstarch
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 3/4 cup  butter
5: 4   eggs, lightly beaten
6: 1 1/2 cups  granulated sugar
7: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
8: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
9: 3/4 cup  lemon juice
10: 1/4 cup  half-and-half, light cream, or milk
11: Powdered sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 13x9x2-inch baking pan with foil. Grease foil; set aside. In a large bowl combine the 2 cups flour, the 1/2 cup powdered sugar, the cornstarch, and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Press mixture into the bottom of prepared pan. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until edges are golden.
1: Meanwhile, for filling, in a medium bowl stir together eggs, the granulated sugar, the 3 tablespoons flour, the lemon peel, lemon juice, and half-and-half. Pour filling over hot crust. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes more or until center is set. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Grasping foil overhang, lift from pan. Cut into bars. Right before serving, sift powdered sugar over tops. Cover and store in the refrigerator.
recipe_description: An extra splash of lemon juice plus lemon peel adds tremendous tang to this classic recipe. Pucker up and enjoy this luscious dessert.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  butter, softened
1: 1/3 cup  packed brown sugar
2: 1/4 cup  granulated sugar
3: 3/4 teaspoon  baking powder
4: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
5: 1/2 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/8 teaspoon  ground allspice
8: 1   egg
9: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
10: 3/4 cup  all-purpose flour
11: 1  cup  quick-cooking rolled oats
12: 1/2 cup  miniature semisweet chocolate pieces
13: 1/3 cup  chopped dried fruit such as dried cranberries, dried tart cherries, or dried blueberries
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In mixing bowl beat butter with electric mixer on medium speed 30 seconds. Beat in sugars, baking powder, soda, cinnamon, salt, and allspice. Beat in egg and vanilla until combined. Beat in flour and oats. Stir in chocolate pieces and dried fruit.
1: Drop cookies by small spoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until cookies are golden. Transfer to rack; cool. Makes 48.
recipe_description: Add an element of surprise with this drop cookie recipe that contain bits of dried fruit and chocolate pieces.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   egg whites
1: 1/8 teaspoon  cream of tartar
2: Dash salt
3: 1/2 cup  sugar
4: 1/2 cup  creamy peanut butter
5: 2  cups  chocolate-flavored crisp rice cereal
6: 1/3 cup  chopped honey-roasted peanuts
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 300 degree F. Lightly grease 2 cookie sheets or line with parchment paper; set aside.
1: In a medium mixing bowl beat egg whites, cream of tartar, and salt with an electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add sugar, about 1 tablespoon at a time, beating until stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold in peanut butter. Fold in cereal. Drop mixture by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts.
2: Bake 10 minutes. Turn oven off and let cookies dry in oven with door closed for 15 minutes. Remove macaroons from cookie sheets to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 30 macaroons.
recipe_description: We added peanuts and peanut butter to this classic flourless cookie.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/3 cups  granulated sugar
1: 2  tablespoons  finely shredded lime peel
2: 1  tablespoon  peeled minced fresh ginger
3: 3/4 cup  plus 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, cut into chunks and just slightly softened
4: 1   egg yolk
5: 1 1/2 tablespoons  fresh lime juice
6: 1 1/2 tablespoons  light-color corn syrup
7: 2 - 3  teaspoons  ground ginger, to taste
8: 1/2 teaspoon  lemon or vanilla extract
9: 1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
10: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
11: 2 1/4 cups  unbleached all-purpose flour
12: Powdered sugar
13: Finely shredded lime peel
14: Coarse green sugar (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Position a rack in middle of oven; preheat to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheets; set aside.
1: In a food processor combine sugar, lime peel, and fresh ginger. Cover and process for 2 to 3 minutes, scraping sides of bowl occasionally, until ginger is completely pulverized and mixture is thoroughly blended and smooth. Reserve 1/2 cup; transfer to a saucer to use as garnish.
2: In a large bowl combine remaining lime-sugar mixture,  butter, egg yolk, lime juice, corn syrup, ground ginger, lemon extract, baking soda, and salt. Beat with an electric mixer on low, then medium speed, until very well blended and lightened in color, about 1 1/2 minutes. Beat in half the flour on low speed just until evenly incorporated, scraping sides of bowl occasionally. Stir in remaining flour until evenly incorporated. If the dough seems too wet, stir in up to 3 tablespoons more flour; if too dry, stir in up to 1 teaspoon water.
3: Shape dough into a flat disc; cut it into quarters. Divide each quarter into 11 or 12 equal portions. Shape portions into balls; roll in lime-sugar mixture and gently reshape. Space balls about 2 1/2 inches apart on prepared baking sheets; flatten to about 1/8- to 1/4-inch thickness with the bottom of a glass.
4: Bake one sheet at a time for 6 to 8 minutes or until edges are light brown and cookies are not quite firm when gently pressed in the center. (For chewier cookies bake slightly shorter; for crisper ones, bake slightly longer.) Let cool 5 minutes to firm up. Using a spatula, transfer cookies to wire rack. Dust with powdered sugar; sprinkle with lime peel, and, if desired, coarse green sugar. Cool completely.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  sticks unsalted butter, softened
1: 1/2 cup  plus 1 tablespoon sugar
2: 1  teaspoon  pure vanilla extract
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 2 1/4 cups  plus 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
5: 1  tablespoon  finely ground espresso beans
6: 4  tablespoons  unsalted butter, softened
7: 1  tablespoon  strong-brewed espresso
8: 1/3 cup  packed light brown sugar
9: 1  tablespoon  light corn syrup
10: Pinch of salt
11: 40 chocolate-covered espresso beans
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees and position a rack in the center of the oven. Line the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch baking pan with parchment paper.
1: MAKE THE SHORTBREAD: In the bowl of a standing electric mixer fitted with the paddle, beat the butter with the sugar at medium speed until fluffy and very pale, about 5 minutes. Beat in the vanilla and salt. In a small bowl, whisk the flour with the ground espresso beans. Add the dry ingredients to the mixer in 3 batches, scraping down the side of the bowl and beating just until the dough is combined.
2: Press the dough into the baking pan in an even layer. Spread a sheet of plastic wrap directly onto the dough and, using a flat-bottomed glass, smooth the dough into an even layer. Remove the plastic wrap and bake the shortbread for about 50 minutes, until very lightly browned on top and firm but not solid to the touch. Transfer the pan to a rack to cool slightly, about 10 minutes.
3: Using a ruler, cut the warm shortbread lengthwise into 8 strips, then cut crosswise into 5 rows. Let the shortbread bars cool completely.
4: MAKE THE GLAZE: In a small, heavy saucepan, combine the butter, brown sugar, espresso, corn syrup, and salt and bring to a boil over moderate heat, swirling the pan. Boil just until slightly thickened, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes; remove from the heat. When the bubbling subsides, immediately pour the hot glaze over the shortbread. Working quickly with a small offset spatula, spread the glaze in an even layer. Using the tip of a lightly oiled paring knife, score the glaze between the cuts, without dragging. Press an espresso bean into the center of each bar. Let cool slightly, then carefully lift out the bars and transfer to a plate.
5: The bars can be stored in an airtight container for up to 1 week.
recipe_description: Flo Braker flavors her ethereally light shortbread with finely ground espresso beans. The best part is the golden, gooey butterscotch glaze, which becomes deliciously fudgy as the bars sit in the cookie jar.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 9  ounces  slivered almonds, toasted (2-1/4 cups)
1: 4 1/2 ounces  cake flour (1-1/4 cups)
2: 4 1/2 ounces  all-purpose flour (1 cup)
3: 8  ounces  unsalted butter, softened at room temperature (16 Tbs.)
4: 3/4 teaspoon  table salt
5: 10  ounce (2-2/3 cups) confectioners' sugar (2-2/3 cups)
6: 1   large egg, at room temperature
recipe_instructions:
0: Blend the almonds and both flours; set aside. With the paddle of an electric mixer (or regular beaters), cream the butter on medium speed until soft and creamy but not melted. Add the salt and confectioners' sugar; mix on medium-low speed until thoroughly combined, about 5 minutes, scraping the bowl as needed. Reduce the speed to low and add the egg; mix until blended. Add the flour mixture; as soon as the dough comes together, stop the mixer. Scrape the dough onto a large sheet of plastic wrap. Using the wrap to help shape and protect the dough, gently press it into a rectangle that's about 4-1/2 x 8 inches and about 1-1/2 inches thick. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate until dough is firm enough to slice, at least 3 hours.
1: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment. Unwrap the dough, trim the edges, and slice it into three 1-1/2-inch-square logs. Slice each log into square cookies between 1/8 and 1/4 inch thick. Lay the squares 1/2 inch apart on the baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned around the edges, about 8 minutes, rotating the sheet halfway through. Cool on the baking sheet until cool enough to handle (about 10 minutes) and then transfer the cookies to a rack.
recipe_description: If the dough starts to get too soft as you cut the cookies, stick it in the freezer to firm it up.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2/3 cup  sugar
1: 1/2 cup  dark corn syrup
2: 1/2 cup  butter
3: 1  cup  sifted all-purpose flour
4: 1  cup  slivered almonds
5: 2  tablespoons  orange zest
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with silicone baking sheets such as Silpats*.
1: In a medium saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, and butter. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add flour, nuts, and zest, stirring well.
2: Drop batter by teaspoonfuls 3 inches apart onto prepared baking sheets.
3: Bake for 5 minutes per batch. Let cool on pan for 5 minutes per batch. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
4: *This recipe will not work with parchment paper; you must use a silicone baking sheet.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  unsalted butter, softened
1: 1/2 cup  plus 1 tablespoon sugar, divided
2: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
3: 2   large egg yolks
4: 3  cups  all-purpose flour
5: 2  tablespoons  heavy whipping cream
6: 2  tablespoons  fresh orange zest
7: 1  teaspoon  orange extract
8: 1  teaspoon  vanilla extract
9: 2  4  ounces  bars semisweet chocolate, melted
10: 1/2 cup  toasted hazelnuts, chopped
recipe_instructions:
0: In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter with paddle attachment for approximately 3 minutes, or until creamy. Add 1/2 cup sugar and continue to beat for 1 minute. Add salt and egg yolk, beating until blended. Add flour, beating until mixture forms a dough. With mixer on lowest speed, add cream, zest, and extracts
1: Shape dough into a disc and wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper; set aside.
2: On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to a 1/4-inch thickness. Using a 2 1/2-inch fluted round cutter, cut dough. Place rounds approximately 1 inch apart on cookie sheet. Evenly sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon sugar.
3: Bake for 14 minutes per batch, or until edges are lightly browned. Let cool on pans for 2 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
4: When cool, dip half of each cookie into melted chocolate. Evenly sprinkle nuts over chocolate. Place on parchment paper to dry for at least 1 hour.
5: Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   Betty Crocker® sugar cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
1: 1/2 cup  shortening
2: 1/4 cup  mild-flavor (light) molasses
3: 1  tablespoon  ground ginger
4: 1 1/4 teaspoons  ground cinnamon
5: 1  teaspoon  ground cloves
6: 1   egg
7: 1  cup  powdered sugar
8: 1  teaspoon  grated lemon peel
9: 4  teaspoons  lemon juice
10: 1/4 cup  finely chopped crystallized ginger
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In large bowl, stir cookie ingredients until very soft dough forms (dough will be sticky).
1: On ungreased cookie sheets, drop dough with 1 tablespoon-size cookie scoop or by tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart.
2: Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheets to cooling racks. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
3: In small bowl, stir powdered sugar, lemon peel and lemon juice until smooth. Spread glaze on cookies. Sprinkle with crystallized ginger.
recipe_description: Prize-Winning Recipe 2009! Spices and molasses turn sugar cookie mix into a homemade ginger cookie.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pouch Betty Crocker® sugar cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
1: 1/2 cup  buttermilk
2: 1/4 cup  butter or margarine, softened
3: 1  teaspoon  grated lemon peel
4: 2   eggs
5: 3  cups  powdered sugar
6: 1/4 cup  whipping cream
7: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine
8: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
9: 1/3 cup  dark chocolate chips (2 ounces)
10: 1  tablespoon  whipping cream
related_categories:
0: Chocolate Cookies
1: Cookies
2: Desserts
3: Sugar Cookies
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl, stir cookie ingredients until batter-like dough forms.
1: With medium cookie scoop or heaping tablespoon, scoop dough 3 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
2: Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 5 minutes; remove from cookie sheets. Cool completely.
3: Place powdered sugar in large bowl; set aside. In small microwavable bowl, microwave 1/4 cup cream and 2 tablespoons butter on High about 1 minute; stir until butter is melted. Add butter mixture and vanilla to powdered sugar; stir until mixture is smooth.
4: In medium microwavable bowl, microwave chocolate chips and 1 tablespoon cream on High 1 minute; or until melted. Stir half of vanilla icing into melted chocolate mixture until smooth and well blended. If necessary, add additional cream to thin both vanilla and chocolate icing.
5: For each cookie, turn cookie flat side up; spread chocolate icing in thin layer on half of cookie. Spread other half with white icing. Store covered at room temperature.
6: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake 14 to 17 minutes.
recipe_description: Prize-Winning Recipe 2007! Use sugar cookie mix as a quick-and-easy way to get to the classic New York cake-like cookie with distinctive half-moons of chocolate and vanilla frosting.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   Betty Crocker® peanut butter cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
1: 3  tablespoons  vegetable oil
2: 1  tablespoon  water
3: 1   egg
4: 1  cup  semisweet chocolate chips (6 ounces)
5: 1/4 cup  butter or margarine
6: 1/4 cup  peanut butter
7: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
8: 1 1/2- 2  cups  powdered sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In large bowl, stir cookie mix, oil, water and egg until soft dough forms.
1: Shape dough into 1-inch balls. On ungreased cookie sheets, place balls 2 inches apart.
2: Bake 8 to 9 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheets to cooling racks. Cool completely, about 15 minutes.
3: In small microwaveable bowl, microwave chocolate chips, butter and peanut butter uncovered on High 1 minute to 1 minute 30 seconds; stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla.
4: Place 1-1/2 cups powdered sugar in 1-gallon resealable food-storage plastic bag; set aside. Place 12 cooled cookies in large bowl. Pour 1/3 of chocolate mixture over cookies in bowl. Using rubber spatula, toss cookies gently to coat. Place cookies in bag with powdered sugar; seal bag. Gently turn bag to coat cookies. Remove cookies from bag to cooling rack to set. Repeat with 12 more cookies and 1/2 of remaining chocolate mixture; repeat again until all cookies are coated, adding additional powdered sugar to bag as needed.
recipe_description: Prize-Winning Recipe 2009! Here's a must-try cookie treat that's reminiscent of a favorite sweet cereal snack with chocolate, peanut butter and powdered sugar.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1  teaspoon  grated orange peel
2: 1/4 cup  fresh orange juice
3: 2   eggs
4: 1  pouch Betty Crocker® sugar cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
5: 1  cup  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
6: 1/2 cup  slivered almonds
7: 1/2 cup  white vanilla baking chips
8: 1/4 cup  finely chopped crystallized ginger
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl, using wire whisk, beat melted butter, grated orange peel, orange juice and eggs. Stir in remaining ingredients until soft dough forms. Divide dough in half. On 1 side of ungreased cookie sheet, shape half of dough into 12x2-inch log. Repeat with remaining dough on same cookie sheet.
1: Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool on cookie sheet 10 minutes. Place logs on cutting board. Cut crosswise into 3/4-inch slices. Place slices cut sides down on ungreased cookie sheet.
2: Bake 15 minutes. Immediately remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack. Cool completely. Store loosely covered.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Increase flour in dough to 1-1/4 cups and add up to 1/4 cup additional flour as needed when shaping dough into logs.
recipe_description: Prize-Winning Recipe 2006! Ginger lovers, you'll get a satisfying flavor punch in twice-baked classic Italian cookies.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  cups  Golden Grahams® cereal
1: 5  cups  miniature marshmallows
2: 1 1/2 cups  milk chocolate chips
3: 1/4 cup  light corn syrup
4: 5  tablespoons  butter or margarine
5: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
6: 1  cup  miniature marshmallows, if desired
related_categories:
0: Chocolate Desserts
1: Cookies
2: Desserts
3: No Bake Cookies
recipe_instructions:
0: Into large bowl, measure cereal. Butter 13x9-inch pan. In large microwavable bowl, microwave 5 cups marshmallows, the chocolate chips, corn syrup and butter uncovered on High 2 minutes to 3 minutes 30 seconds, stirring after every minute, until melted and smooth when stirred. Stir in vanilla.
1: Pour over cereal; quickly toss until completely coated. Stir in 1 cup marshmallows.
2: Press mixture evenly in pan, using buttered back of spoon. Let stand uncovered at least 1 hour, or refrigerate if you prefer a firmer bar. For bars, cut into 6 rows by 4 rows. Store loosely covered at room temperature up to 2 days.
3: Into large bowl, measure cereal. Butter 13x9-inch pan. In 3-quart saucepan, heat 5 cups marshmallows, the chocolate chips, corn syrup and butter over low heat, stirring occasionally, until melted; remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Continue as directed above.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change.
recipe_description: Share the great-tasting flavor of this favorite campfire snack with kids of any age!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pouch Betty Crocker® peanut butter cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
1: 1  tablespoon  water
2: 3  tablespoons  vegetable oil
3: 1   egg
4: 4 1/2 cups  chocolate or vanilla ice cream, slightly softened
5: Chopped peanuts or tiny candies, if desired
related_categories:
0: Cookies
1: Cookie Sandwiches
2: Desserts
3: Ice Cream
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Make cookie mix as directed on pouch, using water, oil and egg. Shape dough into 36 balls, about 1 inch each. On ungreased cookie sheet, place balls 2 inches apart (or drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls). Flatten in crisscross pattern with fork.
1: Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges begin to brown. Cool 2 minutes; remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 30 minutes.
2: For each ice cream sandwich, press about 1/4 cup ice cream between 2 cookies. Roll the ice cream edges in chopped peanuts or candies. Wrap sandwiches individually in plastic wrap. Freeze about 30 minutes or until firm. Store in freezer.
recipe_description: Nothing could be simpler--or more delicious--to have on hand when a peanut butter craving strikes!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  Original Bisquick® mix
1: 1 1/2 cups  powdered sugar
2: 3/4 cup  butter or margarine, softened
3: 1  teaspoon  almond extract
4: 2   eggs
5: 1  cup  granulated sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 400 degrees F. In large bowl, stir all ingredients except granulated sugar until soft dough forms.
1: Shape dough into balls, about 1 inch in diameter; roll in granulated sugar to coat. On ungreased cookie sheets, place balls about 2 inches apart. Flatten balls slightly with bottom of glass.
2: Bake 5 to 6 minutes or until edges are light golden brown. Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets to cooling racks to cool. Store in airtight container.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake 6 to 8 minutes.
recipe_description: Six easy ingredients will let you make melt-in-your-mouth sugar cookies anytime.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pouch (1 lb 1.5 oz) Betty Crocker® sugar cookie mix
1: 1/3 cup  butter or margarine, softened
2: 1   egg
3: 1/4 cup  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
4: 1/2 cup  toasted chopped hazelnuts
5: 1/2 cup  cherry-flavored dried cranberries, coarsely chopped
6: 2  cups  semisweet chocolate chips
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl, stir cookie mix, butter, egg, flour, hazelnuts, cranberries and 1-1/2 cups chocolate chips until stiff dough forms. Shape half of dough at a time into 8x2 1/2-inch rectangle on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on cookie sheet 15 minutes.
1: Cut crosswise into 3/4-inch slices. Place slices, cut sides down, on cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes, turning once, until crisp. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack. Cool completely, about 20 minutes.
2: In small microwavable bowl, microwave 1/2 cup chocolate chips on High 30 to 60 seconds; stir until smooth. Drizzle chocolate over one side of each biscotti. Let stand until chocolate is set.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Heat oven to 375 degrees F.
recipe_description: They're Italian! Baked twice for a crunchy texture, biscotti are meant to be dunked in coffee.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  butter
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 2  medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cut in 3/4-inch cubes (3 cups)
3: 1  cup  finely chopped onion
4: 6  cloves garlic, minced
5: 1  28  ounce can crushed fire-roasted tomatoes
6: 1  16  ounce jar salsa
7: 4  ears fresh sweet corn, kernels cut from the cob (2 cups)
8: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh dill or 1 teaspoon dried dillweed
9: 1  teaspoon  salt
10: 1 1/2 cups  whole milk
11: 2  pounds  boneless, skinless walleye fillets or white fish fillets, cut in 1-inch pieces or 1 1/2 pounds peeled, deveined shrimp
12: 1  cup  whipping cream
13: 1/4 cup  chopped fresh cilantro
14: 6  small sourdough bread rounds
15: 4  ounces  cheddar cheese, finely shredded (1 cup)
16: 1/3 cup  sour cream
17: Fresh cilantro sprigs
recipe_name: Sweet & Sassy Walleye Chowder in Bread Bowls
recipe_instructions:
0: In a Dutch oven, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Add sweet potatoes, onion and garlic. Cook 10 minutes or until nearly tender. Stir in tomatoes, salsa, corn, dill and salt. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes. Add milk and return to a simmer. Add walleye, whipping cream and chopped cilantro; return to a simmer. Simmer, uncovered, 3 to 5 minutes or until walleye is opaque and flakes when tested with a fork.
1: Meanwhile, slice off the top of the bread rounds and hollow out center of bread to make a bread bowl. Place bread bowls on a baking sheet and place the top slice of the bread, cut side up, alongside of bowls. Sprinkle tops with cheddar. Bake 3 to 5 minutes to warm bowls and melt the cheese.
2: Ladle chowder into bowls. Swirl sour cream into the top of the soup and garnish with additional cilantro sprigs. Serve with cheddar bread tops.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6   ears fresh corn
1: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2: 4  slices bacon (preferably thick-cut), chopped into -inch pieces
3: 1   onion, chopped
4: 4  cups  low-fat milk
5: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
6: 1/4 cup  chopped fresh parsley
7: 1  cup  chopped scallops or 1 cup small (or chopped) peeled shrimp, or combination of both
recipe_name: Shore-Style Corn Chowder By Mark Bittman
recipe_instructions:
0: Shuck the corn, then stand each ear up in a bowl and use a knife to scrape off the kernels; set aside. Put the cobs, 1 cup water, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper in a 4-quart pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat so the water bubbles gently, cover, and cook for 20 to 30 minutes. Leave the cobs in the pot until you are ready to make the soup, then discard them, reserving the corncob stock.
1: In the last few minutes of cooking the corn, add the seafood.
2: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until it begins to render its fat and turns golden-brown, about 4 to 6 minutes. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, another 5 minutes or so.
3: Add the milk, reserved corn kernels, and bacon and onion to the stock, and bring to a boil; lower the heat so that the soup bubbles gently. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until the corn is tender, about 10 minutes.
4: Whisk the cornstarch in a small bowl with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to the soup, stirring until the soup thickens, about a minute. Taste, adjust the seasoning, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 17.3 ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
1: 1  package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
2: 1  tablespoon  milk
3: 1  tablespoon  prepared horseradish
4: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
5: 1  can (about 6 ounces) refrigerated pasteurized crabmeat , drained
6: 4   green onions, sliced (about 1/2 cup)
7: 1/2 cup  sliced almond
8: Paprika
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F.
1: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Cut the pastry sheet into 12 (2-inch) circles with a cutter.  Place the pastry circles onto a baking sheet.
2: Bake for 15 minutes or until the pastries are golden brown.  Remove the pastries from the baking sheet and let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.  Split each pastry into 2 layers, making 24 in all.
3: Stir the cream cheese in a medium bowl until smooth.  Stir in the milk, horseradish, black pepper and crabmeat.
4: Spread the crabmeat mixture on 12 bottom pastry layers. Top with the onions, almonds and top pastry layers.  Sprinkle with the paprika.
5: To soften the cream cheese, remove from the wrapper.  Place the cheese onto a microwaveable plate.  Microwave on HIGH for 15 seconds or until softened.
recipe_description: Here's some tasty appetizers sure to impress your guests.  The crabmeat-cream cheese filling is flavored with a bit of horseradish...sliced green onions and almonds add both crunch and color.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10  ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Shells
1: 4  tablespoons  butter
2: 1/3 cup  minced shallot
3: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
4: 1  cup  Swanson® Chicken Stock
5: 12  ounces  fresh or thawed frozen small shrimp, peeled and deveined
6: 2  cups  thawed frozen whole kernel corn
7: 1/2 cup  heavy cream
8: 1 1/2 tablespoons  lemon juice
9: 1   hot pepper sauce
10: Chopped fresh cilantro leaves
related_categories:
0: Fish and Seafood
1: Shrimp
2: Shrimp Pasta
recipe_name: Creamy Shrimp and Corn Stew in Shells
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare the pastry shells according to the package directions.
1: Heat the butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook for 3 minutes. Add the flour and cook and stir for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in the stock. Cook and stir until the mixture boils and thickens.
2: Add the shrimp and corn to the skillet. Reduce the heat to low.  Stir in the cream, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce and cook until the shrimp are cooked through. Season to taste.  Spoon the shrimp mixture into the pastry shells.  Sprinkle with the cilantro.
3: For Creamy Shrimp, Lobster and Corn Stew in Shells, reduce the amount of shrimp to 8 ounces and add 4 ounces diced, cooked lobster meat with the corn.
recipe_description: Tender and flaky puff pastry shells are filled with a heavenly mixture of shrimp, shallots and corn bathed in a creamy golden sauce with a hint of lemon and a dash of hot pepper sauce.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   salmon fillet, 3/4-inch thick (about 1 pound), cut into 4 pieces
1: 2  teaspoons  lemon juice
2: 2  tablespoons  butter
3: 2  cups  sliced mushrooms (about 6 ounces)
4: 2   green onions, chopped (about 1/4 cup)
5: 1   egg
6: 1  tablespoon  water
7: 1/2 17.3 ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
8: Dilled Cream Sauce
9: 3/4 cup  sour cream
10: 1  tablespoon  Dijon-style mustard
11: 1  tablespoon  chopped fresh dill weed or 1 teaspoon dried dill weed,crushed
related_categories:
0: Baked Salmon
1: Fish and Seafood
2: Salmon
3: Salmon Fillet
recipe_instructions:
0: Drizzle the salmon with the lemon juice.  Heat the butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat.  Add the salmon and cook for 5 minutes or until it flakes easily when tested with a fork, turning the salmon over once halfway through cooking.  Remove the salmon from the skillet.
1: Add the mushrooms and onions to the skillet and cook until they're tender and any liquid is evaporated, stirring often.  Remove the mushroom mixture from the skillet.  Cover and refrigerate the salmon and the mushroom mixture for 1 hour or until chilled.
2: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.  Carefully remove the skin from the salmon.
3: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Roll the pastry sheet into a 14-inch square.  Cut into 4 (7-inch) squares.  Spoon the mushroom mixture in the center of the pastry squares.  Top each with 1 salmon piece.  Brush the edges of the pastry with the egg mixture.  Fold the corners of the pastry up over the salmon and press to seal.   Place seam-side down onto a baking sheet.  Brush with the egg mixture.
4: Bake for 25 minutes or until the pastries are golden brown.  Serve the pastries with the Dilled Cream Sauce.
5: The cooked salmon and the mushroom mixture can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours.
6: Stir sour cream, mustard and dill weed in a small bowl until the mixture is smooth.
recipe_description: What an elegant entree--salmon fillets topped with sauteed mushrooms and green onions--served Wellington-style in a flaky puff pastry wrapping.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  fresh or frozen salmon fillets with skin
1: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh Italian (flat leaf) parsley
2: 2  teaspoons  finely shredded lemon peel
3: 1/4 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
4: 1  pound  fresh asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
5: 1  teaspoon  olive oil
6: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
7: 1   clove garlic, minced
8: Lemon wedges
recipe_instructions:
0: That fish, if frozen. Line a large shallow roasting pan with foil and place pan in a cold oven; heat oven to 450 degrees F. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine parsley, lemon peel, and pepper. Remove half of the parsley mixture and set aside. Cut salmon into 4 portions. Rub remaining half of mixture over skinless tops of salmon portions.
1: In a medium bowl combine asparagus, olive oil, and salt. Remove roasting pan from oven. Place fish portions, skin side down in the pan. Place asparagus in a single layer in the pan around the fish. Return pan to oven. Roast for 14 to 16 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork and asparagus is crisp-tender.
2: Add minced garlic to reserved parsley mixture. Sprinkle over cooked fish. Cut fish into 4 portions and serve with asparagus and lemon wedges.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  fresh or frozen skinless cod fillets, 1/2- to 1-inch thick
1: 1  large red onion, thinly sliced
2: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
3: 8  medium roma tomatoes, coarsely chopped
4: 1/2 cup  sliced, pitted Kalamata olives
5: 6  cloves garlic, minced
6: 1/2 cup  snipped fresh Italian (flat-leaf) parsley
7: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel (set aside)
8: 1/4 cup  lemon juice
9: Nonstick cooking spray
10: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
11: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
12: 1/3 cup  whole wheat panko (Japanese-style bread crumbs)
13: 1/4 cup  chopped pine nuts
14: Lemon wedges (optional)
15: Fresh Italian (flat-leaf) parsley sprigs (optional)
recipe_name: Pine Nut-Crusted Cod with Caramelized Onions and Tomatoes
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw fish, if frozen. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a very large skillet cook onion, covered, in hot oil over medium-low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Uncover onions. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes more or until onion is lightly browned and very tender, stirring occasionally. Add tomatoes, olives, and garlic; cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes more or until tomatoes are just softened and mixture is heated through. Stir in parsley and lemon juice.
1: Meanwhile, line a 15x10x1-inch baking pan with foil; coat foil with cooking spray. Set aside. Rinse fish; pat dry with paper towels. Place fish in prepared pan; measure thickness of fish. Sprinkle top of fish with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine panko, pine nuts, and lemon peel. Evenly spoon on top of fish, spreading to an even layer.
2: Bake fish for 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork and crumb mixture is golden brown.
3: To serve, divide onion mixture among eight serving plates. Top each with a piece of fish. If desired, garnish with lemon wedges and parsley sprigs. Makes 8 (1 piece fish and 1/3 cup onion mixture each) servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  10  ounce can whole baby clams, undrained
1: Water
2: Nonstick cooking spray
3: 2  slices turkey bacon, halved
4: 1   medium onion, chopped
5: 1   stalk celery, thinly sliced
6: 2   medium potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
7: 2  cups  small cauliflower florets (about 1-inch pieces)
8: 1/4 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
10: 2 1/2 cups  fat-free milk
11: 1/2 cup  fat-free half-and-half
12: 2  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
13: 3/4 cup  coarsely shredded carrots
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain clams, reserving liquid. Chop half of the clams; set chopped and whole clams aside. Add enough water to the reserved clam liquid to measure 1 1/2 cups; set clam liquid aside.
1: Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray; heat saucepan over medium heat. Add bacon, onion, and celery to saucepan. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes or until onion is tender and bacon is cooked through, stirring occasionally. Remove bacon from pan; drain on paper towels. Chop bacon and set aside.
2: Stir potatoes, cauliflower, thyme, pepper, and reserved clam liquid into onion mixture. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat; cool slightly. Transfer half of the potato mixture (about 2 cups) to a blender or food processor. Cover and blend or process until smooth. Return to the remaining potato mixture in saucepan.
3: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk, half-and-half, and flour until smooth. Add all at once to potato mixture. Cook and stir just until boiling. Stir in chopped and whole clams and carrots. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cook for 1 minute more. Sprinkle each serving with chopped bacon.
recipe_description: Using a combo of cauliflower and potatoes, rather than all potatoes, lowers the carbs in this creamy meal-in-a-bowl.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  large onion, chopped
1: 1  clove garlic, finely chopped
2: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
3: 1/4 teaspoon  red pepper flakes
4: 1  14 1/2 ounce can Italian-style stewed tomatoes
5: 1  8  ounce can no-salt-added tomato sauce
6: 1/2 pound  shrimp, peeled, deveined, halved lengthwise
7: 12  ounces  angel hair pasta
recipe_instructions:
0: Saute onion and garlic in oil in saucepan 3 minutes. Add pepper flakes; saute 1 minute.
1: Add tomatoes and sauce; simmer 5 minutes. Add shrimp; simmer until shrimp are translucent, 5 minutes.
2: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Top with sauce. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Diavolo is the Italian word for devil and refers to sauces seasoned with hot chiles. In this quick and easy recipe, the sauce is made with stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, and red pepper flakes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  fresh tuna steak, cut into 20 pieces (about 1-inch cubes, 1/2-inch thick)
1: 2  tablespoons  hoisin sauce
2: 2  tablespoons  reduced-sodium teriyaki sauce
3: 1  tablespoon  lime juice
4: 2  tablespoons  sesame seeds
5: 1  tablespoon  hoisin sauce
6: 1  tablespoon  reduced-sodium teriyaki sauce
7: 1  tablespoon  lime juice
8: 1  teaspoon  minced fresh ginger
9: 2  teaspoons  sugar
10: 1/4 teaspoon  hot pepper flakes
recipe_name: Sesame Tuna with Ginger Dipping Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F.
1: Combine hoisin, teriyaki and lime juice. Arrange tuna pieces in a glass baking dish just large enough to hold them in a single layer. Brush with hoisin mixture; let stand 15 minutes at room temperature or refrigerate for 2 hours.
2: Combine hoisin, teriyaki sauce, line juice, ginger, sugar and hot pepper. Microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds to dissolve sugar.
3: To serve, sprinkle tuna with sesame seeds. Bake at 350 degrees F for 8 to 10 minutes or until firm. Serve with dipping sauce.
recipe_description: For an appetizer with Asian flair, try these cubes of fresh tuna coated with sesame seeds. Serve with toothpicks so guests can dip the flavorful morsels in the spicy dipping sauce.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  pounds  carrots, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch pieces
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
3: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
4: 6  cups  vegetable broth
5: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
6: 1   large onion, peeled and chopped
7: 3   cloves garlic, peeled and chopped
8: 3  cups  arborio rice
9: 1  cup  dry white wine
10: 3/4 teaspoon  salt
11: 1  10  ounce box frozen corn, thawed
12: 1/4 cup  shredded Parmesan cheese
13: 1/4 cup  parsley, chopped
14: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
15: 2   cloves garlic, peeled and chopped
16: 1  pound  large shrimp, shells removed and deveined
17: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
18: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 450 degree F. Place carrots on large rimmed baking sheet and toss with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 450 degree F for 45 minutes or until fork tender. Serve half with the Corn and Shrimp Risotto and reserve half for Stuffed Peppers (see recipes on www.familycircle.com)
1: In a large pot bring broth and 3 cups water to a simmer.
2: In a second large heavy-bottom pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion; cook 3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 2 minutes.
3: Add rice to onion, stirring to evenly coat with the oil; cook 1 minute. Add wine and salt. Cook, stirring constantly until wine is absorbed, about 3 minutes.
4: Add 2 cups of the broth mixture to rice and stir until liquid is absorbed. Add remaining broth mixture, 1 cup at a time. Stir continuously until all the broth is absorbed before adding the next cup. Stir in corn after 20 minutes. All the broth mixture should be absorbed after about 25 to 30 minutes of cooking time. Stir in thawed corn during last 5 minutes of cooking. Remove 6 cups of risotto for use in Black Bean Risotto Cakes and Stuffed Peppers recipes in database. To the remaining 3 cups risotto, stir in the Parmesan cheese and parsley. Cover and keep warm.
5: In a large skillet heat oil. Add garlic and shrimp and season with the salt and pepper. Saute about 2 minutes per side.
6: Serve the risotto with the shrimp and half of the roasted carrots.
recipe_description: Corn adds a new dimension to risotto served with sauteed shrimp and roasted carrots for a satisfying meal that takes the guesswork out of dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  slices turkey bacon
1: 1/4 cup  light mayonnaise
2: 2  tablespoons  prepared basil pesto
3: 3/4 pound  U.S. farm-raised large shrimp (about 20), shelled and deveined
4: 8  slices light whole-wheat bread, toasted
5: 1  large tomato, thinly sliced
6: 4  large pieces of iceberg lettuce
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet, cook the turkey bacon over medium-high heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper-towel-lined plate.
1: In a small measuring cup, mix together mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon of the pesto. Set aside.
2: Heat broiler. Place shrimp on a lightly greased broiler pan and brush with remaining 1 tablespoon pesto. Broil for 2 minutes per side. Remove to a plate and keep warm.
3: Spread each slice of toast with about 1-1/2 teaspoons of the pesto mayonnaise. Evenly distribute shrimp among 4 slices of the bread and top each with 2 slices of bacon, tomato and lettuce. Top each with the remaining bread slices.
recipe_description: Shrimp and a pesto mayonnaise spread are added to the traditional bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich. Purchase deveined shrimp to keep the preparation time at less than 30 minutes for this recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  salted dry roasted pistachio nuts, chopped
1: 1/2 cup  packed brown sugar
2: 3  tablespoons  lemon juice
3: 1  teaspoon  dried dillweed
4: 1  teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
5: 6  6  ounces  skinless salmon fillets
6: 1/4 cup  purchased basil pesto (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a small bowl combine pistachio nuts, brown sugar, lemon juice, dillweed, and pepper; set aside.
1: Place salmon fillets in a greased, foil-lined 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Measure thickness of fish. Spoon pistachio mixture evenly on each fillet. Gently press in place to form a crust.
2: Bake for 6 to 8 minutes for each 1/2-inch thickness of fish or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Pass pesto to serve with fish. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Salmon cooks quickly which means this healthy dinner will be ready in about 30 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  fresh or frozen skinless salmon fillet
1: 3/4 cup  finely chopped pecans
2: 1/2 cup  fine dry bread crumbs
3: 1/2- 1  teaspoon  ground black pepper
4: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
5: 1   egg
6: 2  tablespoons  water
7: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
8: 1/2 7  ounce jar roasted red sweet peppers (about 1/2 cup), drained
9: 1/4 cup  mayonnaise or salad dressing
10: 1  tablespoon  mango chutney, finely chopped
11: 1  tablespoon  lemon juice
12: 1/4 teaspoon  garlic salt
13: 1/8 teaspoon  ground red pepper
14: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
recipe_name: Pecan Salmon with Sweet Pepper Mayo
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw fish, if frozen. Rinse fish; pat dry with paper towels. Slice fish in half horizontally so that it is of nearly an even thickness (about 1/2 inch thick). Cut fish into 6 equal portions.
1: In a shallow dish combine pecans, bread crumbs, black pepper, and salt. In another dish beat together egg and water; place flour in a third dish. Coat each fish portion with flour, dip in egg mixture, and finally in pecan mixture. Place portions on a large plate; cover and chill for up to 30 minutes while preparing mayonnaise mixture.
2: For mayonnaise mixture, pat the drained, roasted peppers dry on paper towels; coarsely chop. In a small serving bowl stir together chopped peppers, mayonnaise or salad dressing, chutney, lemon juice, garlic salt, and ground red pepper. Set aside.
3: In a 12-inch nonstick skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Add fish; cook for 3 minutes. Turn fish; cook for 3 to 4 minutes more or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. (Reduce heat as necessary during cooking to prevent overbrowning.) Serve with mayonnaise mixture. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Heart healthy salmon is coated with nuts and topped with flavored  mayonnaise to create a restaurant-style fish dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  fresh or frozen swordfish, shark, or tuna steaks, cut 1 inch thick
1: 1/2 cup  water
2: 2  tablespoons  white wine Worcestershire sauce or Worcestershire sauce
3: 1  teaspoon  cornstarch
4: 1/2- 1  teaspoon  grated gingerroot or 1/8 teaspoon ground ginger
5: 1/2 teaspoon  instant chicken bouillon granules
6: 1/8 teaspoon  onion powder
7: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
8: 3  cups  loose-pack frozen broccoli, carrots, water chestnuts, and red peppers, thawed and drained
9: 1  3  ounce can chow mein noodles or 1-1/2 cups hot cooked rice
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes. Set aside.
1: For sauce, in a small bowl stir together the water, white wine Worcestershire sauce or Worcestershire sauce, cornstarch, gingerroot or ground ginger, chicken bouillon granules, and onion powder. Set aside.
2: Pour cooking oil into a wok or large skillet. (Add more oil as necessary during cooking.) Preheat over medium-high heat. Stir-fry the thawed vegetables for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender. Remove the vegetables from the wok or skillet.
3: Add the fish to the hot wok or skillet. Stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or just till the fish begins to flake easily. Push fish from the center of the wok or skillet.
4: Stir sauce. Add sauce to the center of wok or skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Return vegetables to the wok or skillet. Stir all ingredients together to coat with sauce. Cook and stir about 1 minute more or till heated through. Serve over chow mein noodles or hot rice. Makes 2 servings.
5: Complete your meal by serving cookies and scoops of ice cream.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  canola or vegetable oil
1: 1/4 cup  cherry preserves
2: 2  tablespoons  cider vinegar
3: 2  teaspoons  yellow mustard
4: 3   grilled salmon portions from Salmon Hobo Packs
5: 1   small pear, cored and coarsely chopped
6: 1   avocado, seeded, peeled, and chopped
7: 1/2 cup  sliced green onions (about 4)
8: 1/2 cup  honey-roasted almonds, coarsely chopped
9: 2  ounces  blue cheese, crumbled
10: Salt and pepper
11: 2  cups  spinach or arugula leaves, coarsely shredded
12: 4  10  inches  flour tortillas
13: Lemon and Lime Wedges
recipe_instructions:
0: In a blender container combine oil, cherry preserves, vinegar, and mustard; cover and blend until combined.
1: Flake salmon into large chunks. In a large bowl combine salmon, pear, avocado, green onions, nuts, and cheese; toss with preserve mixture to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
2: Serve with shredded spinach, folded tortillas, and lemon and lime wedges. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  large fresh or frozen shrimp with tails (about 7 ounces)
1: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded orange peel
2: 3  tablespoons  orange juice
3: 1  tablespoon  packed brown sugar
4: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh parsley
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground ginger
6: 1 1/2 cups  shredded zucchini and/or yellow summer squash
7: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/2 cup  finely chopped red sweet pepper (1 small)
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped white onion
10: 1   egg, lightly beaten
11: 3  tablespoons  crushed multigrain saltine crackers
12: 1/8 teaspoon  garlic powder
13: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
14: 2  tablespoons  crumbled reduced-fat feta cheese (optional)
15: 1  recipe Dipping Sauce
16: 1/4 cup  plain fat-free Greek yogurt
17: 1  teaspoon  grated orange peel
18: 2 - 3  teaspoons  orange juice
19: 1/8 teaspoon  ground ginger
recipe_instructions:
0: Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Peel and devein shrimp, leaving tails intact if desired.
1: For marinade, in a medium bowl combine orange peel, orange juice, brown sugar, parsley, and ginger. Add shrimp; toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain shrimp, discarding marinade. Thread four shrimp onto each of two skewers,* leaving 1/4 inch between pieces.
2: Meanwhile, in a medium bowl combine zucchini and salt; let stand for 30 minutes. Drain excess liquid from zucchini. Stir in sweet pepper, onion, egg, crackers, and garlic powder.
3: For charcoal or gas grill, place skewers on the rack of a covered grill directly over medium heat. Grill for 5 to 8 minutes or until opaque, turning once. Remove from grill and keep warm.
4: In a very large nonstick skillet heat oil over medium heat. Spoon zucchini mixture into hot oil to form four mounds. Pressing down lightly with the back of a spoon, flatten each mound into a cake about 3 inches in diameter. Cook for 4 to 6 minutes or until golden brown, turning once halfway through cooking time.
5: To serve, place two fritters and a shrimp skewer on each of two serving plates. If desired, sprinkle feta cheese over fritters. Serve with Dipping Sauce.
6: In a small bowl whisk together yogurt, orange peel, orange juice, and ginger.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  teaspoons  olive oil
1: 2   fresh poblano chile peppers, stemmed, seeded, and thinly sliced*
2: 1/2  of a sweet onion, such as Vidalia, thinly sliced
3: 2  ounces  part-skim queso fresco, cut into small cubes
4: 2  tablespoons  Mexican crema or creme fraiche
5: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet heat oil over medium-low heat. Add peppers and onion; cook about 15 minutes or until onions are translucent.
1: Stir in queso fresco, crema, and salt; cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or until heated through. Serve as a side dish.
recipe_description: Chili peppers are delicious and a great source of vitamins and capsicum, a natural anti-inflammatory. I took my grandmother's traditional recipe, substituting olive oil for butter, cut the amount of cream in half and opted for skim milk cheese, lowering calories, fat and saturated fat. - Chef LaLa

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  teaspoons  light sour cream
1: 1  teaspoon  snipped fresh chives
2: 1/4 teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
3: 1  teaspoon  lemon juice
4: 1/2 teaspoon  honey
5: 1/3 cup  packaged shredded broccoli (broccoli slaw mix)
6: 2   hard-cooked eggs, sliced
7: 1  8 - 9  inch  low-carb whole wheat tortilla
8: 2  tablespoons  chopped, drained bottled roasted red sweet pepper
9: Ground black pepper (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, combine sour cream, chives, lemon peel, lemon juice, and honey. Add broccoli slaw; toss gently to coat. Cover and chill overnight. Wrap and chill egg slices overnight.
1: Spread broccoli mixture along the bottom edge of the tortilla, leaving a 1-1/2-inch space on both ends of the mixture. Top with roasted pepper and egg slices. Sprinkle with black pepper, if desired. Fold in sides of tortilla over filling. Starting from the bottom edge, roll up tortilla. Makes 1 serving

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 cup  sugar
1: 1  envelope unflavored gelatin
2: 4  cups  whole milk
3: 4   eggs, beaten
4: 1  16  ounce package frozen unsweetened whole strawberries, partially thawed, or 4 cups fresh strawberries
5: 1  12  ounce package frozen lightly sweetened red raspberries or 3 cups fresh red raspberries
6: 1/2 cup  frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
recipe_instructions:
0: Partially thaw frozen strawberries, if using. Mash strawberries slightly to break up; set aside.
1: In a large saucepan, combine sugar and gelatin. Stir in milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture just starts to boil. Remove from heat. Whisk about 1 cup of the hot mixture into beaten eggs; return all to saucepan. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer registers 175 degree F and mixture coats the back of a clean metal spoon. Do not boil. Stir in strawberries, raspberries, and orange juice concentrate. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. (Mixture will be very thick after chilling.)
2: Transfer the mixture to a 4- or 5-quart ice cream freezer; freeze according to the manufacturers directions. If desired, ripen. Makes about 2-1/2 quarts.
recipe_description: Frozen strawberries and raspberries team up in this sweet dessert for kids and diabetic. Only 1-carb-choice!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  chopped onion
1: 1 1/2 cups  chopped green sweet pepper
2: 1  14 1/2 ounce can tomatoes, cut up
3: 3/4 cup  bottled picante sauce or green salsa
4: 2  teaspoons  ground cumin
5: 2  cloves garlic, minced
6: 2  15  ounce cans black beans and/or red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
7: 12  6  inches  corn tortillas
8: 2  cups  shredded reduced-fat Monterey Jack cheese
9: 1  cup  chopped cherry or grape tomatoes
10: Chopped fresh cilantro, sliced green onions, and/or sliced pitted ripe olives
11: 1/2 cup  light sour cream or plain low-fat Greek yogurt (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet combine onion, sweet pepper, undrained tomatoes, picante sauce, cumin, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Stir in beans.
1: Spread one-third of the bean mixture over the bottom of a 3-quart rectangular baking dish. Top with six of the tortillas, overlapping as necessary, and 1 cup of the cheese. Add another one-third of the bean mixture; top with remaining 6 tortillas and remaining bean mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
2: Bake, covered, in a 350 degrees  oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 10 minutes. Before serving, if desired, top with tomatoes and cilantro, green onions and/or olives. If you like, serve with sour cream.
recipe_description: This low-fat Tex-Mex recipe calls for bottled picante sauce, which is a less chunky salsa. For a twist, substitute salsa verde, a green salsa made with tomatillos and chile peppers.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   Gala or Fuji apples
1: 1/2 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
2: 1  tablespoon  brown sugar
related_categories:
0: Apples
1: Fruit
2: Healthy Cooking
3: Healthy Snacks
recipe_instructions: 0: Heat the oven to 225 degrees . Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper. With a sharp knife or mandoline, thinly slice apples. (The thinner the slice, the crispier the chip.) Remove the seeds with a paring knife. Place the slices in a single layer on the prepared sheets. Stir together cinnamon and brown sugar. Sprinkle half the mixture onto the apples. Bake for 1 hour. Use tongs to flip the slices and sprinkle with the remaining cinnamon sugar. Bake for 1 hour more. Turn the oven off, but leave the apples inside for another hour to crisp. Let them cool, then store them in an air-tight container until ready to eat.
recipe_description: Sweet! These crispy apple chips have no added fat.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  boneless beef sirloin steak
1: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
2: 2  14  ounce can lower-sodium beef broth
3: 1  cup  water
4: 1  cup  bite-size strips carrot (2 medium)
5: 1/3 cup  long-grain rice
6: 1  tablespoon  grated fresh ginger
7: 3   cloves garlic, minced
8: 2  cups  coarsely chopped broccoli
9: 1/4 cup  sliced green onion (2)
10: 3  tablespoons  teriyaki sauce
11: 1  teaspoon  toasted sesame oil
12: 1/4 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from beef. Cut beef into bite-size strips. In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in hot oil for 2 to 3 minutes or until beef is brown. Remove beef with a slotted spoon; set aside.
1: In the same skillet combine broth, water, carrot, uncooked rice, ginger, and garlic. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, 15 minutes or until the carrot and rice are tender.
2: Stir in beef, broccoli, green onion, teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, and red pepper. Simmer, covered, for 3 minutes. Makes 4 servings (6 cups).
recipe_description: The flavors and ingredients of a classic beef stir fry make up this low calorie main dish soup recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  3 - 4  pound  fresh beef brisket
1: 2  medium onions, thinly sliced and separated into rings
2: 1   bay leaf
3: 1  12  ounce can beer
4: 1/4 cup  chili sauce
5: 2  tablespoons  no-calorie, heat-stable granular sugar substitute
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
7: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
9: 1  clove garlic, minced
10: 2  tablespoons  cornstarch
11: 2  tablespoons  cold water
12: 10   Italian bread rolls
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from meat. If necessary, cut brisket to fit into a 3 1/2- to 6-quart slow cooker. Place the onions, bay leaf, and brisket in the cooker. In a medium bowl combine beer, chili sauce, sugar substitute, thyme, salt, pepper, and garlic; pour over meat.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5 to 6 hours.
2: Using a slotted spoon, transfer brisket and onions to a serving platter; cover with foil to keep warm. Discard bay leaf.
3: For gravy, pour juices into a large measuring cup; skim fat. Measure 2 1/2 cups liquid; discard remaining liquid. In a medium saucepan stir together cornstarch and water; stir in the cooking liquid. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Serve meat on bread rolls topped with gravy. Makes 10 (3 1/2 ounces cooked meat, 1/4 cup gravy, and a 2-ounce bread roll) servings.
recipe_description: The flavorful gravymade from the beer-spiked cooking liquid--is the finishing touch to this tender meat dish.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   egg white
1: 1  tablespoon  water
2: 4  cups  raw whole cashews, whole almonds, walnut halves, and/or pecan halves
3: 3  tablespoons  packed brown sugar or brown sugar substitute* equivalent to 3 tablespoons brown sugar
4: 1  tablespoon  ground cumin
5: 2  teaspoons  chili powder
6: 1  teaspoon  garlic salt
7: 1/8 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine egg white and the water; beat with a fork until frothy. Add nuts; toss to coat. Let stand for 5 minutes.
1: Meanwhile, in a large plastic bag, combine brown sugar, cumin, chili powder, garlic salt, and cayenne pepper. Add nuts; shake well to coat. Spread nuts evenly in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
2: Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until nuts are toasted and coating is dry, stirring twice. Transfer to a large sheet of foil. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  4 - 5  ounces  boneless beef chuck top blade (flat iron) steaks or cubed steaks, cut 1/2 inch thick
1: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
2: 1/2 teaspoon  Montreal or Kansas City steak seasoning
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed
5: 2  tablespoons  fat-free milk
6: 1  cup  crushed cornflakes (2 cups whole flakes)
7: Nonstick cooking spray
8: 1  teaspoon  butter
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped onion
10: 1   clove garlic, minced
11: 1  tablespoon  bourbon (optional)
12: 3/4 cup  fat-free milk
13: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
14: 1/4 teaspoon  Montreal or Kansas City steak seasoning
15: Freshly ground black pepper (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from steaks. If necessary, place each steak between two pieces of plastic wrap and pound lightly with the flat side of a meat mallet until 1/2 inch thick; remove plastic wrap.
1: In a shallow dish, combine 1/3 cup flour, 1/2 teaspoon steak seasoning, and salt. In another shallow dish, combine egg and 2 tablespoons milk. Place crushed cornflakes in a third shallow dish. Dip steaks into flour mixture, turning to coat evenly. Dip into egg mixture, then into cornflakes, turning to coat evenly.
2: Coat a very large nonstick skillet with cooking spray; heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks to skillet. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes for medium-rare (145 degrees F) to medium (160 degrees F), turning once halfway through cooking. If steaks brown too quickly, reduce heat to medium. Remove steaks from skillet; cover and keep warm.
3: In the same skillet, heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add onion and garlic to skillet; cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. If desired, add bourbon, stirring to scrape up any crusty browned bits. In a small bowl, whisk together 3/4 cup milk, 1 tablespoon flour, and 1/4 teaspoon steak seasoning until smooth. Add all at once to onion mixture. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
4: Serve steaks with gravy. If desired, sprinkle with pepper.
recipe_description: The key to ensuring that the coating gets crispy is to use a very large nonstick skillet so all the steak pieces fit in a single layer.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  12.3 ounce package light firm silken-style tofu (fresh bean curd)
1: 1/2 cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed, or 2 eggs
2: 3  ounces  cheddar-flavored soy cheese, finely shredded (3/4 cup)
3: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh basil
4: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
5: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
6: 2  teaspoons  olive oil
7: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh assorted mushrooms (such as cremini, stemmed shiitake, morel, and/or button)
8: 12  ounces  fresh asparagus spears, trimmed and cut into 1-inch-long pieces
9: 1/4 cup  finely chopped shallots
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a blender or food processor, combine tofu and eggs. Cover and blend or process just until combined. Transfer to a large bowl; stir in soy cheese, 1 tablespoon of the basil, the pepper, and salt. Set aside.
1: In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms, asparagus, and shallots. Cook and stir for 5 to 8 minutes or just until tender; cool slightly. Stir vegetable mixture into tofu mixture, stirring until well mixed.
2: Divide mixture among six 6-ounce ramekins or au gratin dishes. Place filled ramekins in a 15101-inch baking pan.
3: Bake, uncovered, about 20 minutes or until set and edges are bubbly. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon basil. Serve warm.
recipe_description: Tofu and soy cheese boost the protein in these mini vegetable-and-egg casseroles. Serve them for brunch or a weekend breakfast.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  teaspoon  unflavored gelatin
1: 1/3 cup  peach nectar or apricot nectar
2: 2  6 - 8  ounces  cartons vanilla or peach fat-free yogurt with sweetener
3: 1/3 26  ounce  jar refrigerated mango slices, drained, or one 8-ounce can peach slices, drained
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small saucepan combine the unflavored gelatin and peach or apricot nectar. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cook and stir over medium heat until gelatin is dissolved.
1: In a blender container combine gelatin mixture, yogurt, and drained mango or peach slices. Cover and blend until smooth. Spoon mixture into eight 3-ounce paper cups. Cover each cup with foil. Cut a small slit in the center of each foil cover and insert a rounded wooden stick into each. Freeze pops for 4 to 6 hours or until firm.
2: To serve, remove the foil and tear paper cups away from pops. Makes 8 pops.
recipe_description: Made with real fruit and fat-free yogurt, these pops are a healthful low-calorie treat.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  medium carrot, cut into large chunks
1: 1  medium russet potato, cut into large chunks
2: 1  medium parsnip or  turnip, peeled and cut into large chunks
3: 1  small onion, quartered
4: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
5: 1  tablespoon  balsamic vinegar
6: 1   Cornish game hen or poussin (about 1-1/2 pounds)
7: 2  cloves garlic, minced
8: 2  teaspoons  snipped fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
10: 1/8 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
11: Fresh rosemary or sage leaves (optional)
12: Pear-shaped cherry tomatoes (optional)
recipe_name: Cornish Game Hen with Roasted Root Vegetables
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large bowl, combine carrot, potato, parsnip or turnip, and onion. Add oil and balsamic vinegar; toss to lightly coat. Spread in a 9x9x2-inch baking pan; cover with foil. Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F.
1: Meanwhile, gently separate the skin from the hen breast and tops of drumsticks by easing a paring knife or your fingers between the skin and the meat to make 2 pockets that extend all the way down to the neck cavity and over the drumsticks. In a small bowl, combine garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Set aside 1 teaspoon of the fresh rosemary mixture (1/2 teaspoon if using dried rosemary). Rub remaining rosemary mixture under the skin onto the breast and drumsticks. Using 100%-cotton string, tie drumsticks to tail; tie wing tips to body. Sprinkle the reserved rosemary mixture on the skin. Uncover vegetables. Add hen to baking pan.
2: Roast hen and vegetables, uncovered, for 1 to 1-1/4 hours or until vegetables are tender and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thigh of the hen registers 180 degrees F (the thermometer should not touch the bone), stirring vegetables once or twice.  Remove string. Cover with foil; let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
3: If desired, garnish with fresh rosemary or sage leaves and tomatoes. To serve hen, use kitchen shears or a long heavy knife to carefully cut hen in half lengthwise.  Remove skin and discard. Serve with vegetables. Makes 2 (1/2 of the game hen and 1 1/4 cup vegetables).
recipe_description: Balsamic vinegar lends a subtly sweet accent to the roasted vegetables in this recipe while garlic and rosemary boost the flavor of the tender, juicy game hen. To round out the meal, toss some salad greens with your favorite salad dressing.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 1  pound  packaged chicken, pork, or beef stir-fry strips
2: 1/2 cup  water
3: 1/2 cup  spicy brown mustard
4: 4  teaspoons  fajita seasoning
5: 5  7 - 8  inches  low-carb flour tortillas, warmed*
6: 1  cup  red, green, and/or yellow sweet pepper, seeded and cut into thin strips
7: Snipped fresh cilantro and/or sliced green onion (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Lightly coat a large skillet with cooking spray. Heat skillet over medium-high; add stir-fry strips. Cook and stir until brown. Drain off fat.
1: In a 1-1/2-quart slow cooker stir together water, mustard, and fajita seasoning. Add stir-fry strips, stirring to coat.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 7 hours. If no heat setting is available, cook for 6 to 7 hours. Using a slotted spoon, transfer meat to a cutting board. Discard cooking liquid. Using two forks, pull meat apart into shreds.
3: Divide meat mixture evenly among the warmed tortillas. Top with sweet pepper strips and, if desired, cilantro and/or green onion. Roll up tortillas. Using a serrated knife, cut filled tortillas crosswise into bite-size pieces. If desired, skewer with decorative toothpicks.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  dry red beans or dry red kidney beans
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 2  pounds  boneless beef chuck pot roast, cut into 1-inch pieces
3: 1  cup  coarsely chopped onion
4: 1  15  ounce can tomato sauce
5: 1  14 1/2 ounce can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers, undrained
6: 1  14  ounce can lower sodium beef broth
7: 2 - 3   chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, finely chopped plus 2 teaspoons adobo sauce*
8: 2  teaspoons  dried oregano, crushed
9: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
10: 3/4 cup  finely chopped red sweet pepper
11: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh cilantro
recipe_instructions:
0: Rinse beans. Place beans in a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Add enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover; let stand for 1 hour.
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the meat and the onion; cook and stir until meat is brown. Transfer to a 3 1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker using a slotted spoon. Repeat with remaining meat. Stir tomato sauce, undrained tomatoes, broth, chipotle peppers and adobo sauce, oregano, and cumin into mixture in slow cooker. Drain and rinse the beans; stir into mixture in cooker.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 5 to 6 hours. Top individual servings with sweet pepper and cilantro. Makes 8 (1-cup) servings.
recipe_description: This chunky Mexican-style beef stew recipe owes its flavor to an intriguing blend of chipotle pepper, oregano, cumin, and cilantro.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  sweetened oat square cereal or brown sugar-flavored oat biscuit cereal
1: 1/2 cup  sliced almonds
2: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine, melted
3: 1/2 teaspoon  apple pie spice
4: salt
5: 1  cup  dried cherries and/or golden raisins
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F. In a 15x10x1-inch baking pan, combine cereal and almonds. In a small bowl, stir together melted butter, apple pie spice, and salt. Drizzle butter mixture over cereal mixture; toss to coat evenly.
1: Bake about 20 minutes or until almonds are toasted, stirring once during baking. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Stir in dried cherries or raisins. Cool completely. Store in a tightly covered container at room temperature for up to 1 week.  Makes 5 cups, 20 (1/4-cup) servings.
recipe_description: Oat cereal, almonds, and dried cherries in this recipe team up for a tempting snack that will fit right in to your diabetic meal plan.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  9  pound  beef rib roast (about 4 ribs), meat cut from bone, meat and bone tied together with kitchen twine
1: 2 1/2 teaspoons  kosher salt
2: 2  tablespoons  Dijon mustard
3: 1  tablespoon  minced garlic
4: 1/3 cup  heavy cream
5: 1/3 cup  prepared horseradish
6: 1/4 cup  cognac
7: 1  14  ounce can low-sodium beef broth
8: 2  teaspoons  whole pink peppercorns, coarsely crushed, plus more for garnish
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Healthy Cooking
2: Low Carb
3: Prime Rib
recipe_instructions:
0: Place rib roast, fat side up, in a roasting pan and let stand at room temperature 1 hour.
1: Heat oven to 450 degrees F and place rack in center. Sprinkle roast with 2 teaspoons salt. Combine mustard and garlic; evenly spread over top of roast and season with black pepper.
2: Roast 20 minutes, then reduce temperature to 325 degrees F. Roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted in center by 2 inches (without touching bone) registers 125 degrees  to 130 degrees F for medium-rare (loosely tenting with foil if top browns too quickly), about 2-1/2 hours. Transfer to a cutting board, tent with foil and let stand 15 minutes before carving. (Internal temperature will rise 5 to 10 degrees.) Reserve pan and juices.
3: Meanwhile, for Creamed Horseradish, whisk cream in a medium bowl until thickened but not yet holding soft peaks, 1 to 2 minutes. Gently fold in horseradish and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; season with black pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl; chill 30 minutes or up to 1 hour.
4: For pan sauce, pour pan juices into a fat separator; drain off fat. Add cognac and 1/2 cup broth to roasting pan. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, scraping up any browned bits with a spoon. Simmer until liquid has almost evaporated, about 8 minutes. Add remaining broth, the pan juices and peppercorns; simmer 2 minutes more. Transfer to a gravy boat.
5: Cut twine from roast, remove bone and transfer meat to a cutting board; garnish with peppercorns, if desired. Serve sauce and Creamed Horseradish on the side.
recipe_description: Mustard and garlic coat the rib roast as it cooks. The flavored beef goes perfectly with the heavy cream and horseradish dip in this elegant dinner.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
1: 2  cups  pumpkin seeds (pepitas) (9 ounces)
2: 1/2 cup  dried golden berries or golden raisins
3: 1/2 cup  cocoa nibs
4: 1  teaspoon  coarse sea salt
5: 1/2 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_name: Toasted Seeds with Golden Berry and Cocoa Nibs
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add pumpkin seeds; cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until toasted, stirring frequently. (You'll begin to smell the aroma of the seeds and notice them turning a golden brown color.)
1: Transfer pumpkin seeds to a large bowl. Stir in golden berries, cocoa nibs, sea salt, and pepper.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cloves garlic, crushed
1: 1/2 teaspoon  pepper
2: 1  2 3/4- 3  pound  beef sirloin tip roast or tri-tip roast
3: 2  cups  water
4: 1  tablespoon  instant beef bouillon granules
5: 1  teaspoon  crushed red pepper
6: 3  medium green peppers, cut into 1/2-inch strips
7: 8   firm or crisp Italian rolls
recipe_instructions:
0: Combine garlic and pepper. Rub evenly over roast. Place roast, fat side up, on a rack in a roasting pan. Insert a meat thermometer. Roast, uncovered, in a 325 degree F oven for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until thermometer registers 145 degree F (medium rare).
1: Transfer to a platter. Cool for 30 minutes. Cover; refrigerate until chilled. Reserve pan juices; chill separately.
2: Meanwhile, skim fat from drippings; discard fat. Pour drippings into a Dutch oven. Stir in water, bouillon granules, and crushed red pepper. Bring to boiling. Add green pepper strips; reduce heat and simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until green peppers are crisp-tender. With a slotted spoon, remove green pepper strips; keep warm.
3: With a very sharp knife or electric knife, slice meat very thin. Add to broth mixture and heat through.
4: Split rolls horizontally. Place on a plate. Spoon some of the broth over each half. Arrange beef on bottom half. Place pepper strips over beef; cover with top half of roll. Serve with individual dishes of broth mixture for dipping. Makes 8 sandwiches.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil (use more if necessary)
1: 1/4 cup  chopped pancetta (Italian Bacon), or bacon
2: 2   medium eggplants, cut into 1/2-to 1-inch chunks
3: Salt
4: Freshly ground black pepper
5: 1  pound  farfalle or other dried pasta
6: 6   small or 3 medium tomatoes, cored, seeded, and cut into 1/2- to 1-inch chunks
7: 1 - 2  teaspoons  thinly sliced garlic
8: 1/2 cup  freshly grated Parmesan cheese
9: Chopped fresh basil for garnish (optional)
related_categories:
0: European Cuisine
1: Italian Cuisine
2: Pasta
3: Vegetables
recipe_name: Pasta with Eggplant, Italian Bacon, and Parmesan
recipe_instructions:
0: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it. Put the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pancetta and cook until just starting to brown. Add the eggplant, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and stir occasionally until browned and tender, about 15 minutes. (The meat should render enough fat to cook the eggplant, but if the pan seems dry, add another tablespoon or two of oil).
1: Add pasta to boiling water and prepare as directed. While its cooking, add the tomatoes and garlic to the eggplant mixture and cook, stirring occasionally, until everything is nicely softened, about 10 more minutes.
2: When the pasta is done, drain it and toss with the eggplant mixture and the Parmesan. Taste and adjust the seasoning, garnish with basil if you like, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 2   medium onions, cut into 1-inch chunks
2: 1   large red sweet pepper, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
3: 1  14  ounce jar spaghetti sauce
4: 1 1/2 pounds  zucchini, cut into 3/4-inch chunks
5: Salt
6: Pepper
7: Hot cooked spaghetti
related_categories:
0: European Cuisine
1: Italian Cuisine
