recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from roast. Cut roast into 1-inch cubes. In a 3-1/2- to 4-quart electric crockery cooker layer beef, onions, and red sweet pepper. Add spaghetti sauce. Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 9 to 10 hours or cook on high-heat setting for 5 hours.
1: If cooking on low, turn cooker to high. Add zucchini; cook 1 hour more or until meat is tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked spaghetti.
recipe_description: Slow cooker beef roast with vegetables and sauce is an excellent topping for pasta.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 24  ounces  prepared polenta, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices
1: 1/4 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
2: 1  pound  sweet or hot Italian pork sausage, casing removed
3: 1   large zucchini, cut in half lengthwise and sliced (about 2 cups)
4: 2  cups  Prego® Traditional Italian Sauce or Roasted Garlic and Herb Italian Sauce
5: 6  ounces  shredded fontina or mozzarella cheese (about 1 1/2 cups)
related_categories:
0: European Cuisine
1: Italian Cuisine
2: Italian Sausage Dishes
3: Sausage
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Arrange the polenta slices to cover the bottom of a 3-quart shallow baking dish, trimming the slices as needed to fit. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.
1: Cook the sausage in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to break up the meat. Remove the sausage from the skillet.  Pour off any fat.
2: Add the zucchini to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes or until it's tender. Stir in the sauce and heat to a boil. Return the sausage to the skillet. Cook until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Spoon the sausage mixture over the polenta. Top with the fontina cheese.
3: Bake for 25 minutes or until hot and the cheese is melted.
recipe_description: Don't overlook the wonderful change of pace that polenta makes from pasta or rice. This dish is sure to become a frequently requested one.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   purchased roasted chicken
1: 8  ounces  dried spaghetti or linguine, broken in half
2: 12  ounces  fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
3: 8  ounces  small whole fresh mushrooms
4: 3  medium red and/or yellow sweet peppers, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
5: 2  tablespoons  butter
6: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1/8 teaspoon  black pepper
8: 1  14  ounce can chicken broth
9: 3/4 cup  milk
10: 1/2 cup  shredded Swiss cheese (2 oz.)
11: 1  tablespoon  finely shredded lemon peel
12: 2  slices sourdough bread, cut into cubes (about 1-1/2 cups)
13: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
14: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh parsley
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove meat from chicken; discard bones. Cut chicken pieces in chunks to equal 3 cups. Save remaining chicken for another use.
1: In Dutch oven cook spaghetti according to package directions. Add asparagus the last 1 minute of cooking. Drain. Return to pan.
2: Meanwhile, in large skillet cook mushrooms and sweet peppers in hot butter over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in flour and black pepper until well combined. Add broth and milk all at once. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly.
3: Add mushroom mixture, chicken pieces, Swiss cheese, and half the lemon peel to pasta mixture in Dutch oven. Toss gently to coat. Spoon pasta mixture into a 13x9x2-inch baking dish or 3-quart rectangular casserole.
4: In a medium bowl toss together bread cubes, olive oil, and remaining lemon peel. Spread bread cube mixture on pasta mixture. Bake, uncovered, for 15 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Makes 10 (1-cup) servings.
recipe_description: The original dish was created in 1908 in San Francisco in honor of opera star Luisa Tetrazzini.Once the ingredients are mixed together, including chicken, asparagus, spaghetti, and mushrooms, the all-in-one casserole recipe bakes in just 15 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:

1: Meanwhile, for dressing, in a screw-top jar combine the vinegar, oil, Italian seasoning, mustard, black pepper, and garlic powder. Cover and shake well. Set aside.
2: In a large bowl combine the pasta mixture and sweet pepper. Shake dressing. Pour the dressing over pasta mixture; toss gently to coat.
recipe_description: This meatless main dish salad is ready to eat in fewer than 25 minutes.

recipe_instructions:
0: In 3-1/2- to 4-quart slow cooker, mix carrots, celery, bell pepper, basil and water. Sprinkle turkey with salt and pepper; place on vegetable mixture.
1: Cover and cook on Low heat setting 6 to 7 hours.
2: Remove turkey from cooker. Stir rice and oregano into vegetable mixture; return turkey to cooker. Cover and cook on Low heat setting about 1 hour or until rice is tender.
3: Remove turkey from cooker. Stir cheese into rice mixture until melted. Serve with turkey.

recipe_ingredients:

3: 1/2 teaspoon  salt

recipe_instructions:

2: Increase heat to medium-high and add wine. Simmer 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and continue to simmer 3 minutes. Stir in beans; heat through, about 1 minute. Serve warm.
recipe_description: Dinner will be ready in 30 minutes when this pork and bean stew is on the menu. Crispy bacon and Italian seasoning adds flavor to this recipe; kielbasa adds a hint of spice.

recipe_ingredients:

3: 3  tablespoons  olive oil

recipe_instructions:

1: Stir in tomatoes, wine, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 20 to 25 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in basil.

Add cream and wine all at once. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Stir in parsley and basil.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  pounds  russet potatoes (about 4 medium), scrubbed
1: 6 3/4 ounces  unbleached all-purpose flour, more for kneading and rolling (1-1/2 cups)
2: 1  teaspoon  kosher salt
3: 1   large egg, lightly beaten
recipe_instructions:
0: Put the unpeeled potatoes in a large pot. Fill the pot with enough cold water to cover the potatoes by at least 2 inches and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium, partially cover the pot, and simmer the potatoes until they are completely tender and easily pierced with a skewer, 30 to 35 minutes.
1: Drain the potatoes, let them cool just enough that you can handle them, and then peel them. Cut them in half crosswise and pass them through a ricer into a large bowl. Let cool until almost at room temperature, at least 20 minutes.
2: Lightly flour a work surface. In a small bowl, mix the flour with the salt. Add the egg to the potatoes and then add the flour mixture. Mix with your hands until the flour is moistened and the dough starts to clump together; the dough will still be a bit crumbly at this point. Gather the dough together and press it against the bottom of the bowl until you have a uniform mass. Transfer it to the floured surface and wash your hands.
3: Knead gently until the flour is fully incorporated and the dough is soft, smooth, and a little sticky, 30 seconds to 1 minute. (Don't overmix it, or the gnocchi will be tough; the dough should feel very delicate.) Move the dough to one side, making sure the surface underneath it is well floured. Cover it with a clean kitchen towel.
4: Cover two large rimmed baking sheets with parchment and sprinkle lightly with flour.
5: Remove any lingering bits of dough from your work surface and lightly reflour the surface. Tear off a piece of dough about the size of a large lemon and put the towel back on the rest of the dough so it doesn't dry out.
6: With the palms of both hands, roll the dough piece on the floured surface into a rope about 3/4 inch in diameter.
7: With a sharp knife or a bench knife, cut the rope crosswise every 3/4 inch to make roughly 3/4-inch-square gnocchi. Arrange the gnocchi in a single layer on the parchment-covered baking sheets, making sure they don't touch. Repeat until you run out of dough, reflouring the work surface as needed. When all the gnocchi have been cut and spread out on the baking sheets, sprinkle them with a little more flour.
8: If you're going to use the gnocchi within 2 to 3 hours, they can sit out on the counter. For longer storage, see the make ahead tips below.
9: You can serve freshly made gnocchi right away or within a couple of hours, or you can freeze them for later use. Put the gnocchi in the freezer while they're still on the baking sheets and freeze until they are hard to the touch, at least one hour. Transfer them to a large zip-top bag or several smaller bags and freeze for up to two months. Cook frozen gnocchi in boiling water in two batches. Frozen gnocchi cause the temperature of the cooking water to drop, so they'll fall apart before the water returns to a boil if there are too many in the pot. Don't refrigerate fresh gnocchi for more than two or three hours, as they tend to ooze water and become soggy.
10: To save time, skip the fork: Classic Italian homemade gnocchi are pressed on a fork to curl them and impart the traditional ridges. To save time, I just cut them in small squares and leave them as cute little pillows. I think they look prettier, and they're a lot less fussy to make.
recipe_description: Gnocchi's plump, pillowy texture and mild, delicate flavor make them perfect for rich, hearty sauces like Pan-Seard Gnocchi with Browned Butter & Sage, Gnocchi with Creamy Gorgonzola Sauce, and Gnocchi with Sausage & Leek Ragu. In general, meat sauces are a fantastic match, but butter and cream-based sauces work well, too.   In Italy, gnocchi are usually served after appetizers (antipasti) as a first course (or primo piatto), instead of pasta. And they're followed by a meat and vegetable course (secondo piatto and contorno). When Italians eat gnocchi this way, the portions tend to be on the small side. However, gnocchi can just as easily be served as a main course, preceded or followed by a light green salad. The servings here are for gnocchi served as a main course.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 cup  water
1: 2  cups  all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
2: 1  tablespoon  honey
3: 1   package active dry yeast
4: 3  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil
5: 1/2 teaspoon  juniper berries, crushed or ground to a powder
6: 1  tablespoon  kosher salt
7: Cayenne pepper, for dusting
related_categories:
0: Appetizers
1: Bread
2: European Cuisine
3: Italian Breads
4: Italian Cuisine
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, stir the water with 1/2 cup of the flour, the honey, and the yeast. Let stand until foamy, about 10 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1-1/2 cups of flour, the olive oil, juniper, and salt and knead until a smooth dough forms. Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let stand in a warm place until doubled in volume, about 1 hour.
1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Line 3 large baking sheets with parchment paper. Punch down the dough and cut it into 4 equal pieces. On a floured work surface, roll out each piece of dough to a 6-by-10-inch rectangle. Cut the rectangles lengthwise into 1/2-inch-wide strips. Arrange the strips on the prepared sheets and sprinkle lightly with cayenne pepper. Let stand until puffed, about 15 minutes.
2: Bake the grissini for about 15 minutes, until golden brown; switch the pans halfway through baking. Let the grissini cool and crisp on the baking sheet before serving.
3: The grissini can be stored in an airtight container for up to 2 days. Rewarm in a 350 degrees oven for about 3 minutes before serving.
recipe_description: These long, crispy bread sticks are a lovely accompaniment to any soup, including Mario Batali's vegetable-and-farro version. Batali makes the bread sticks with leaves from the lightly bitter Mediterranean herb myrtle; crushed juniper berries are a good substitute. He also seasons the grissini with cayenne pepper, one of his favorite spices; he keeps it in a salt shaker so it's easy to dispense.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 2  cups  milk
3: 1 1/2 cups  coarse-ground yellow cornmeal or quick-cooking polenta mix*
4: 1  cup  ricotta cheese

recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly grease a 3-quart rectangular baking dish; set aside.
1: In a large saucepan, bring broth and butter to boiling. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, stir together milk and cornmeal. Slowly add cornmeal mixture to boiling broth, stirring constantly. Cook and stir until mixture returns to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes or until mixture is very thick, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Spread two-thirds (about 4 cups) of the polenta in the prepared baking dish; set aside.
2: In a very large skillet, cook sausage, mushrooms, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is brown and onion is tender. Drain off fat. Stir in pasta sauce; heat through. Spoon sausage mixture over polenta in dish, spreading evenly. Dollop remaining polenta on top of sauce and sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella and Asiago cheeses.
3: Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until top is lightly golden and set. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. If desired, garnish with fresh basil.  Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: A trio of Italian cheeses--ricotta, mozzarella, and Parmesan--gives this hearty casserole recipe a cheesey gooeyness that balances the gutsy, sausage sauce.

recipe_instructions:
0: In a food processor, combine the mint, parsley, and chives with the shallot, lemon juice, sherry vinegar, crushed red pepper, and a pinch of salt and process until finely chopped. Add the olive oil and process the salsa verde until smooth.
1: Transfer half of the salsa verde to a small bowl. Transfer the remaining salsa verde to another bowl and stir in the paprika and cumin. Add the lamb pieces and turn to coat thoroughly. Thread the lamb onto 8 long skewers and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.
2: Light a grill or preheat a grill pan. Grill the lamb skewers over high heat, turning them occasionally, until the lamb is lightly charred in spots, about 6 minutes for medium meat. Serve the lamb skewers with the salsa verde.
3: The salsa verde can be covered and refrigerated overnight.
recipe_description: Seamus Mullen marinates leg-of-lamb pieces in a mix of more than 10 ingredients (including saffron and Spanish paprika), many of which he also uses to make the accompanying salsa verde. Save a step and marinate the lamb in a bit of the salsa verde.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 1  tablespoon  olive, vegetable, or canola oil
2: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
3: 1 1/2 teaspoons  chili powder
4: 1  teaspoon  minced garlic
5: 1  14  ounce can chopped tomatoes (with 1/3 cup of juice reserved)
6: 1/4 cup  tomato paste
7: 2  15 1/2 ounce can white, black, or kidney beans (rinsed and drained)
8: 1  15  ounce can sweet corn kernals, drained (or 1 1/2 cups frozen corn, thawed)
9: 3  cups  coarsely chopped spinach
10: 4   medium-sized (8-inch) flour tortillas
11: 2  cups  shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese
12: Chopped fresh cilantro (optional), for garnish
13: Sour cream (optional), for serving
14: Salsa (optional), for serving
15: Kosher salt and pepper, to taste
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch round cake pan, springform pan, or baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
1: Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, cumin, chili powder, and garlic and cook until you can smell the spices and the onion is softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes with the 1/3 cup of reserved juice and the tomato paste, then stir in the beans. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Let the bean mixture simmer until everything is hot, about 3 minutes. Add the corn and spinach and stir until the spinach has wilted and everything is well blended and hot, about 3 minutes. Taste for seasonings, adding more salt and/or pepper as necessary.
2: Place 1 tortilla in the prepared cake pan. Spread one fourth of the bean and vegetable mixture evenly over the tortilla, then sprinkle 1/2 cup of the shredded cheese evenly over the top. Repeat with 3 more layers, ending with the last quarter of the bean mixture and then the last 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
3: Bake the tortilla casserole until it is hot throughout and the top is lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Let the casserole sit for about 5 minutes, then cut it into wedges using a sharp knife and serve it with a spatula or better yet a pie server. Sprinkle the top with cilantro, if desired, and serve with sour cream and/or salsa on the side, if you like.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  butter, softened
1: 3  cups  fresh sweet corn kernels or frozen whole kernel corn, thawed
2: 1  14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk
3: 1/2 cup  butter, softened
4: 1/2 cup  sugar
5: 4   eggs (room temperature)
6: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
7: 2  teaspoons  baking powder
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: cinnamon or vanilla ice cream
10: honey (optional)
11: ground cinnamon (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Adjust oven rack to middle position. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 2-quart square baking dish with the 1 tablespoon butter; set aside.
1: In a blender combine corn and sweetened condensed milk. Cover and blend until kernels are partially chopped but small pieces remain; set aside.
2: In a bowl beat the 1/2 cup butter and the sugar with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in corn mixture.
3: In a small bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Add flour mixture to corn mixture, beating until just combined.
4: Pour batter into prepared baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Transfer to a wire rack and cool about 1 hour or to room temperature. Serve with ice cream. If desired, drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon. Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: This sweet, dense dessert tastes like the love child of cornbread and classic cake. Top each slice with a scoop of cinnamon ice cream and a drizzle of honey.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  sour cream
1: 1/4 cup  milk
2: 1/4 cup  mayonnaise
3: 2  tablespoons  minced cilantro
4: 2  tablespoons  fresh lime juice
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 4  cups  cooked pot roast meat, torn into bite-sized pieces
7: 1/2 cup  Frontera Habanero Salsa
8: 1  cup  Frontera Roasted Tomato Salsa
9: 1  cup  red onion, chopped
10: 2   yellow peppers, grilled and sliced
11: 1   tomato, chopped
12: 12   flour tortillas, grilled
13: fresh cilantro for garnish
14: grilled lime wedges for garnish
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Mexican Cuisine
2: Mexican Taco Dishes
recipe_name: Tacos de Carne with Cilantro Lime Crema
recipe_instructions:
0: Start by making the crema. In a medium bowl, combine sour cream, milk, mayonnaise, cilantro, lime juice, and salt. Mix thoroughly and chill.
1: To make the beef, combine beef pieces, salsas, and red onion, and saute in a large skillet until bubbling. Continue simmering for 5 minutes, take off heat, and set aside.
2: Arrange grilled tortillas, peppers, beef, tomatoes, cilantro and a dish of crema on a serving platter and allow guests to assemble their own tacos.
recipe_description: Tender beef simmered in salsa provides a deep, rich flavor upon which to pile grilled fresh peppers and chopped tomatoes all cooled down with a cilantro lime crema.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 12  ounces  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into thin strips
1: 2  teaspoons  cooking oil
2: 1  medium red sweet pepper, cut into thin strips
3: 1/2 of a medium red onion, thinly sliced
4: Nonstick cooking spray
5: 1  10  ounce package refrigerated pizza dough
6: 1/2 cup  bottled mild picante sauce or taco sauce
7: 1/2 cup  shredded sharp cheddar cheese (2 ounces)
related_categories:
0: Chicken
1: Mexican Cuisine
2: Quick and Easy
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet cook chicken strips in hot oil over medium-high heat about 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Remove from skillet. Add sweet pepper and onion to skillet; cook about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from skillet; set aside.
1: Coat a 15x10x1-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Unroll pizza dough into pan; press with fingers to form a 12x8-inch rectangle. Pinch edges of dough to form crust.
2: Spread crust with picante sauce. Top with chicken and vegetables; sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 13 to 18 minutes or until crust is brown and cheese melts. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Give refrigerated pizza dough a quick Mexican twist by topping the dough with picante or taco saucethat's Spanish for spicy! Top with chicken, red sweet peppers, onions, and cheddar cheese, and bake until golden.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  ground beef
1: 1  1 1/4 ounce package taco seasoning mix
2: Water
3: 1  cup  Pace® Chunky Salsa
4: 1  17.3 ounce  (17.3 ounces) Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (2 sheets)
5: 1   egg
6: 1  tablespoon  water
7: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (about 4 ounces)
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Ground Beef
2: Ground Beef Tacos
3: Mexican Cuisine
4: Mexican Taco Dishes
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook the beef in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to separate meat. Pour off any fat. Add the taco seasoning mix and water according to the package directions. Stir the salsa in the skillet. Let the beef mixture cool.
1: Thaw the pastry sheets at room temperature for 40 minutes or until they're easy to handle. Heat the oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly grease or line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Stir the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
2: Unfold 1 pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface. Roll the pastry sheet into a 14-inch square. Cut the pastry sheet into 4 (7-inch) squares. Repeat with the remaining pastry sheet.
3: Place about 1/3 cup beef mixture onto half of each pastry square. Top each with 2 tablespoons cheese. Brush the edges of the pastry squares with water. Fold the pastry over the filling and crimp the edges with a fork to seal. Place the filled pastries on the baking sheets. Brush the pastries with the egg mixture.
4: Bake for 20 minutes or until the pastries are golden. Let cool for 5 minutes on a wire rack. Serve warm with additional salsa.
5: Serve with chopped avocado, tomatoes and sour cream. For dessert serve lime sorbet and shortbread cookies.
recipe_description: You can prepare the filling then call the family to help assemble these taco-inspired pastries that you can eat at home or take on the go.  What fun!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (about 1 pound)
1: 1  1  ounce package mild taco seasoning mix
2: 5 1/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Stock
3: 2  tablespoons  butter
4: 2  10 3/4 ounce cans Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
5: 10   fajita-size flour tortillas (10-inch), cut into 1-inch pieces
6: 4  cups  shredded Mexican cheese blend (about 16 ounces)
7: Hot cooked regular long-grain white rice
related_categories:
0: Chicken
1: Crockpot Chicken
2: Mexican Cuisine
3: Mexican Tortilla Dishes
4: Slow Cooker
recipe_name: Slow Cooker Cheesy Chicken and Tortillas
recipe_instructions:
0: Place the chicken into a 3 1/2-quart slow cooker. Top with all but 2 tablespoons of the taco seasoning. Pour 3 1/2 cups of the stock over the chicken.
1: Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 5 hours or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken to a cutting board.  Using 2 forks, shred the chicken.
2: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F.
3: Heat the butter in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat. Stir the remaining taco seasoning, stock and soup in the saucepan.  Stir in the chicken.
4: Layer half of the chicken mixture, tortillas, and cheese in a 3-quart shallow baking dish. Repeat the layer. Bake for 30 minutes or until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Serve over the rice.
recipe_description: Slow-cooking the chicken before shredding makes it especially tender and flavorful...when that chicken is layered with tortillas and cheese, you've got a simple, family-friendly casserole.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  chicken breast tenders
1: 1  package (8 ounces) sliced mushrooms
2: 4   whole-wheat tortillas
3: 1  cup  canned fat-free refried beans
4: 1  cup  reduced-fat shredded Mexican-blend cheese
5: 1/2 cup  prepared salsa
recipe_instructions:
0: Fill a large skillet halfway with water; bring to a boil. Poach chicken 7 minutes or until cooked through. Let cool, then shred with two forks.
1: Remove skillet from heat and wipe clean. Coat skillet generously with nonstick cooking spray and place over medium-high heat. Cook mushrooms 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until softened.
2: Spread all 4 tortillas with 1/4 cup refried beans. Divide cheese, chicken and mushrooms between 2 of the tortillas. Place remaining 2 tortillas on top, bean-side down.
3: Return skillet to medium-high heat. Coat skillet and tops of quesadillas with nonstick cooking spray. Cook one quesadilla 4 minutes per side or until cheese has melted, reducing heat to medium if tortilla becomes too brown. Repeat with remaining quesadilla. Cut both quesadillas in half and serve with salsa.
recipe_description: A layer of refried beans, chicken, mushrooms, and cheese makes these Mexican skillet sandwiches a favorite recipe for kids.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  ground pasilla, New Mexico, or ancho chile pepper
1: 1  teaspoon  ground coriander
2: 2   cloves garlic, minced
3: 1  teaspoon  snipped fresh oregano or 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed
4: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded orange peel
5: 1/2 teaspoon  ground black pepper
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1  2  pound  boneless pork shoulder roast, cut into 2-inch pieces
8: 2   large onions, cut into wedges
9: 1  14  ounce can reduced-sodium chicken broth
10: 3/4 cup  orange juice
11: 12   4- to 6-inch corn tortillas
12: 1/4 cup  coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
13: 1/4 cup  finely chopped green onion
14: 1/3 cup  bottled green salsa
15: Lime wedges (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, stir together ground pasilla pepper, coriander, garlic, oregano, orange peel, black pepper, and salt. Add pork to bowl; toss to coat with spices.
1: In a 3-1/2- to 4-quart slow cooker, place pork mixture; top with onion wedges. Pour broth and orange juice over all.
2: Cover; cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 4-1/2 to 5 hours.
3: Use a slotted spoon to remove meat from slow cooker. Using two forks, coarsely shred meat; discard any fat. Drizzle meat with some of the cooking liquid.
4: Wrap tortillas in foil. Heat in a 350 degrees F oven for 10 minutes or until warm. To serve, top each tortilla with 1/4 cup of the meat, some cilantro, and finely chopped green onions. Serve with salsa and, if desired, lime wedges.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 pounds  boneless beef round steak
1: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
2: 1/2 teaspoon  black pepper
3: 1/4 cup  lime juice
4: 3   garlic cloves, finely chopped
5: 1   jalapeno, seeded and finely chopped
6: 1   large onion, chopped
7: 1  tablespoon  chili powder
8: 1/4 teaspoon  cumin
9: 1/8 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
10: 12   packaged tostada or hard taco shells
11: 3/4 cup  fat-free refried beans
12: 1 1/2 cups  shredded iceberg lettuce
13: 1  cup  reduced-fat shredded Mexican-blend cheese
14: 3/4 cup  salsa
recipe_instructions:
0: Sprinkle steak with salt and pepper. Place 3 tablespoons of the lime juice, the garlic, jalapeno, onion, chili powder, cumin and cayenne in a slow cooker. Place beef on top and cook on HIGH for 6 hours or LOW for 8 hours.
1: Remove beef to a cutting board and when cool enough to handle, shred with fingers or using two forks. Place shredded beef in a large bowl.
2: Strain remaining liquid in slow cooker over a bowl or measuring cup, discarding solids. Add strained liquid and remaining 1 tablespoon lime juice to beef in bowl and stir to combine. Cover; keep warm.
3: Warm tostada shells in oven according to package directions. While tostadas are baking, heat refried beans in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes on HIGH, stirring halfway through until warm and spreadable.
4: Spread each tostada with 1 tablespoon refried beans. Place 1/3 cup beef over beans and divide lettuce equally among tostadas. Top each with 1 heaping tablespoon cheese and 1 tablespoon salsa.
recipe_description: The spicy meat for this tostada recipe is prepared in the slow cooker. Layer the beef with your favorite fixings on warm tortilla shells to finish off this main dish.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  parsley leaves
1: 1   shallot, coarsley chopped
2: 3   cloves garlic, chopped
3: 3  tablespoons  red wine vinegar
4: 1/4 cup  olive oil
5: 1/2 teaspoon  each salt and black pepper
6: 1  pound  boneless beef top sirloin
7: 3  cups  prepared white rice (optional)
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Mexican Cuisine
2: Quick and Easy
recipe_instructions:
0: In a food processor, combine parsley, shallot, garlic, vinegar, olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon each of the salt and pepper. Pulse until combined; set aside.
1: Heat a gas grill to medium-high heat or prepare a charcoal grill with medium-hot coals. Sprinkle remaining 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper over steak. Grill about 8 minutes per side.
2: Remove steak from grill and place in a glass baking dish; spread the sauce over top and cover dish with foil; allow to sit for 5 minutes. Remove steak from dish and slice. Serve with sauce remaining in baking dish and rice, if desired.
recipe_description: The flavors of this fragrant green chimichurri sauce complement grilled beef top sirloin. This recipe is ready to serve in just over 30 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 12  ounces  beef flank steak or sirloin steak or skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1: 4  8  inches  spinach or flour tortillas
2: 1  tablespoon  cooking oil
3: 1/3 cup  finely chopped onion (1 small)
4: 1/3 cup  finely chopped green sweet pepper
5: 1/2 cup  chopped tomato (1 medium)
6: 2  tablespoons  bottled reduced-fat Italian salad dressing
7: 1/2 cup  shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese (2 ounces)
8: 1/4 cup  bottled salsa or taco sauce
9: 1/4 cup  light dairy sour cream (optional)
related_categories:
0: Beef
1: Mexican Cuisine
2: Quick and Easy
recipe_instructions:
0: If desired, partially freeze beef for easier slicing. If using steak, trim fat from meat. Cut beef or chicken into bite-size strips.
1: Wrap tortillas tightly in foil. Heat in a 350 degree F oven about 10 minutes or until heated through. Meanwhile, heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add meat, onion, and green pepper; cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until desired doneness for steak or until chicken is no longer pink. Remove from heat. Drain well. Stir in tomato and salad dressing.
2: To serve, fill warm tortillas with meat mixture. Roll up tortillas. Serve with cheese, salsa and, if desired, sour cream. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Just 20 minutes, start to finish, these fajitas make great busy weeknight dinners.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium zucchini, halved lengthwise
1: 1   small yellow summer squash, halved lengthwise
2: 1   small red sweet pepper, halved lengthwise
3: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
4: 1  teaspoon  black pepper
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1   large ripe tomato, seeded and chopped
7: 1/4 cup  mayonnaise or salad dressing
8: 2  tablespoons  purchased pesto
9: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil
10: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh oregano
11: 4  6 - 7  inches  flour tortillas
12: 1  cup  shredded mozarella or smoked provolone cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Brush zucchini, yellow squash, and red pepper halves with olive oil. Sprinkle with black pepper and salt. Preheat gas grill. Reduce heat to medium. Place vegetables on the grill rack directly over heat. Cover and grill for 6 to 8 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender, turning once halfway through grilling. Remove from grill; cool slightly.
1: Chop the grilled vegetables. In a medium bowl combine chopped vegetables, tomato, mayonnaise, pesto, basil, and oregano. Place tortillas on the grill rack directly over heat. Cover and grill for 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly toasted on one side. Turn tortillas over and spread the vegetable mixture over the toasted sides of tortillas. Sprinkle with shredded cheese.
2: Cover and grill for 2 to 3 minutes more or until tortillas are lightly toasted, vegetables are just heated, and cheese begins to melt. Carefully remove from grill. To serve, cut into quarters. Makes 8 servings.
3: To use a charcoal grill, prepare vegetables as above. Grill directly over medium coals for 6 to 8 minutes, turning once. Prepare topping as above. Grill tortillas directly over medium coals for 1 to 2 minutes. Turn, spread with vegetable mixture, and grill 2 to 3 minutes more.
recipe_description: Make a trip to the garden or fresh outdoor market for a basketful of vegetables and herbs to make this summer pizza recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving
1: 1   head cauliflower (about 2 pounds) cut into florets
2: 1   can (15.5 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained
3: Coarse salt and ground pepper
4: 5  ounces  crusty bread, cut into 1/2-inch pieces (2 cups)
5: 1  pound  medium shells
6: 3  tablespoons  chopped fresh parsley
7: 1/2 cup  fresh ricotta
recipe_name: Shells with Roasted Cauliflower, Chickpeas, and Ricotta
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees, with racks in upper and lower thirds. On a rimmed baking sheet, toss together 2 tablespoons oil, cauliflower, and chickpeas; season with salt and pepper. Arrange cauliflower and chickpeas in a single layer and roast until cauliflower is tender and chickpeas are crunchy, 25 minutes. On another rimmed baking sheet, arrange bread in a single layer and toast until golden and crisp, 10 minutes.
1: Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta until al dente. Drain pasta and return to pot. Add cauliflower mixture, 2 tablespoons oil, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and toss to combine. To serve, top with croutons and ricotta, then drizzle with oil.
recipe_description: Here, simple ingredients nestle nicely into a small, curvaceous pasta shape. Instead of shells, this recipe also works with campanelle or lumache pasta.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  box (16 ounces) cavatappi or cellentani (corkscrew-shaped pasta)
1: 3  tablespoons  plus 1 teaspoon unsalted butter
2: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
3: 2 1/2 cups  2% milk
4: 1  teaspoon  onion powder
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
7: 8  ounces  Gouda cheese, grated
8: 4  ounces  sharp Cheddar cheese, grated
9: 4  ounces  Swiss cheese, grated
10: 1/2 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
11: 2/3 cup  plain panko bread crumbs
12: Chopped fresh parsley (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat broiler. Coat a 9 x 9-inch broiler-safe baking dish or six 1-cup ramekins with nonstick cooking spray. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook 11 minutes, following package directions. Drain and transfer to bowl.
1: Heat 3 tablespoons of the butter in a medium-size saucepan over medium heat until melted. Add flour, whisking to blend. Gradually add milk; whisk until smooth. Bring to a simmer over medium to medium-high heat, stirring, then add onion powder, salt and pepper. Simmer 3 minutes, then remove from heat.
2: Stir in Gouda, Cheddar, Swiss and 1/4 cup of the Parmesan until cheeses are melted and sauce is smooth. Mix into cooked pasta and pour mixture into prepared dish(es).
3: In medium-size microwave-safe bowl, melt remaining 1 teaspoon butter. Stir in panko and remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan. Divide evenly over pasta. Broil 3 minutes or until browned. Garnish with parsley, if desired.
recipe_description: Four cheeses combine to give this macaroni recipe its robust flavor. Oven-broiled bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese add a crunchy topping.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  coarsely chopped walnuts
1: 3/4 pound  bow tie pasta
2: 5  tablespoons  unsalted butter
3: 12   fresh sage leaves, coarsely chopped
4: 2  tablespoons  lemon juice
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/3 teaspoon  black pepper
7: 1  cup  shredded Romano cheese
recipe_name: Bow Ties with Walnuts, Butter & Sage
recipe_instructions:
0: Place walnuts in a large, dry nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook 4 to 5 minutes, until toasted, shaking pan constantly. Remove walnuts; set aside.
1: Cook pasta in boiling salted water according to package directions, about 10 minutes. When pasta is almost done, melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add sage, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook a minute or two to blend flavors. Remove from heat.
2: Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup pasta cooking water, then add pasta to butter in skillet. Gradually add pasta water. Stir in cheese and toss to combine. Garnish with toasted nuts and serve.
recipe_description: Fresh sage and toasted walnuts pair up to create an exquisite sauce for this pasta main-dish recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   medium onion, cut into 8 wedges
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
2: 1   medium eggplant (about 1 pound), halved lengthwise
3: 6  ounces  dried ziti, rigatoni, or penne pasta
4: 1/3  recipe Dried Tomato Pesto (see recipe below)
5: 1/4 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
6: Salt
7: 2  tablespoons  crumbled goat cheese (chevre) or feta cheese (optional)
8: Snipped fresh basil (optional)
9: 3/4 cup  oil-packed tomatoes
10: Olive oil
11: 1/4 cup  pine nuts or slivered almonds
12: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh basil
13: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
14: 4  teaspoons  bottled minced garlic
recipe_name: Ziti with Eggplant and Dried Tomato Pesto
recipe_instructions:
0: Place onion in a large shallow baking pan; brush with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Roast in a 425 degree F oven for 10 minutes; stir. Brush eggplant with remaining olive oil. Place eggplant in pan, cut sides down. Roast 15 minutes more or until onion is golden brown and eggplant is tender.
1: Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Add Dried Tomato Pesto and black pepper to pasta; toss gently to coat. Transfer pasta to a warm serving dish; keep warm.
2: Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss eggplant and onion with pasta. Season to taste with salt. Top with cheese and basil, if desired. Makes 4 servings.
3: Drain tomatoes, reserving oil. Add enough olive oil to the reserved oil to make 1/2 cup; set aside. Place tomatoes, pine nuts or slivered almonds, basil, salt, and garlic in a food processor. Cover; process until finely chopped. With machine running, gradually add the oil, processing until almost smooth. Divide pesto into thirds. Refrigerate or freeze unused portions. Makes three 1/3-cup portions.
recipe_description: This full-flavor pasta sauce is made richer and sweeter with roasted vegetables.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  medium onion, cut into 8 wedges
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
2: 1  medium eggplant (about 1 pound), halved lengthwise
3: 2  cups  dried rigatoni or penne (6 ounces) or 6 ounces dried fusilli
4: 1/3 cup  purchased dried tomato pesto of 1/3 recipe Dried Tomato Pesto
5: 1/4 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
6: 2  tablespoons  crumbled goat cheese or feta cheese (optional)
7: 3/4 cup  oil-packed dried tomatoes
8: olive oil
9: 1/4 cup  pine nuts or slivered almonds
10: 1/4 cup  snipped fresh basil
11: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
12: 8  cloves garlic, chopped
recipe_name: Rigatoni and Eggplant with Dried Tomato Pesto
recipe_instructions:
0: Place the onion wedges in a large shallow baking pan; brush with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Roast onion in a 425 degree F oven for 10 minutes; stir. Brush the eggplant halves with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Place eggplant in pan, cut sides down. Roast 15 minutes more or until onion is golden brown and eggplant is tender.
1: Meanwhile, cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Add pesto and pepper to pasta; stir gently to coat. Transfer pasta to a warm serving dish; keep warm.
2: Cut eggplant into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Gently stir eggplant and onion into pasta; season to taste with salt. If desired, top with cheese.
3: Makes 4 servings
4: Drain oil-packed dried tomatoes, reserving oil. Add enough olive oil to make 1/2 cup; set aside. Place tomatoes, pine nuts or slivered almonds, snipped fresh basil, salt, and garlic in a food processor. Cover; process until finely chopped. With machine running, gradually add the 1/2 cup oil, processing until almost smooth. Divide pesto into three portions. Chill extra portions for up to 2 days or freeze for up to 3 months.
recipe_description: Almost any small pasta will do in this roasted eggplant recipe that is tossed with a saucy tomato pesto.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  extra-virgin olive oil
1: 1   large Vidalia onion (or use other sweet onion), chopped
2: 2   medium eggplants, cut into 1/2- to 1-inch chunks
3: Salt
4: Freshly ground black pepper
5: 1  pound  farfalle or other dried pasta
6: 1/2 cup  ricotta cheese
7: 1/2 cup  freshly grated Parmesan cheese
8: Chopped fresh basil for garnish (optional)
recipe_name: Pasta with Eggplant, Sweet Onion, and Ricotta
recipe_instructions:
0: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it. Put the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When it's hot, add the onion and eggplant, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and stir occasionally until browned and tender, about 15 minutes.
1: Add pasta to boiling water and prepare as directed. When the pasta is done, drain it, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking water. Return pasta to the pot with 1/2 cup ricotta cheese and the reserved cooking water; toss to combine. Serve pasta topped with the eggplant mixture, freshly grated Parmesan and basil.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  whole black peppercorns
1: 1/2  bunch fresh thyme leaves
2: 2  cups  dry white wine
3: 6   medium shallots, chopped
4: 3   cloves garlic, minced
5: 1  3  ounce bottle capers
6: 1 3/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Broth (Regular, Natural Goodness or Certified Organic)
7: 1/4 cup  white wine vinegar
8: 1  tablespoon  Dijon-style mustard
9: 2   sticks (1 cup) butter, cut into cubes
10: 1/4 cup  olive oil
11: 1  tablespoon  pitted Nicoise olive
12: 8   fresh striped bass or sea bass fillets (about 6 ounces each), skin removed
13: 1  tablespoon  coarsely ground black pepper
14: 1/4 cup  canola oil
15: 3 1/2 cups  Swanson® Vegetable Broth (Regular or Certified Organic)
16: 1 1/4 cups  uncooked orzo pasta
17: 4  tablespoons  unsalted butter
18: 2   finely grated lemon zest
19: Fresh basil leaves
related_categories:
0: Fish and Seafood
1: Other Fish and Seafood
2: Pasta
recipe_name: Wild Striped Bass with Lemon Orzo and Caper Emulsion
recipe_instructions:
0: Place the peppercorns and thyme into a square of cheesecloth.  Fold the ends of the cheesecloth up and tie to secure. Heat the wine, shallots, garlic and cheesecloth bag in a 2-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Cook until the liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup.
1: Drain the capers, and reserve about 3 tablespoons brine. Add the chicken broth, vinegar, mustard and reserved brine to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is reduced by one-half. Remove the cheesecloth bag. Slowly whisk in the butter.
2: Pour the shallot mixture into a blender or food processor. Cover and blend until the mixture is smooth. Gradually add the olive oil during blending. Add 2 tablespoons capers and the olives and blend for 30 seconds.
3: Heat the canola oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook for 8 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork, turning the fish over once during cooking. Remove the fish from the skillet and keep warm.
4: Heat the vegetable broth in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for 10 minutes or until it's tender. Drain the pasta and return to the saucepanpan. Stir in the unsalted butter and lemon zest.
5: Spoon about 1/3 cup pasta into each of 8 bowls. Top each with 1 piece fish and about 1/2 cup caper mixture. Garnish with the basil, if desired.
recipe_description: Having a dinner party?  Here's a terrific recipe that requires a little bit of work, but you'll see that it's absolutely worth it.  Nicoise olives, capers, white wine and Dijon mustard are just some of the ingredients that come together to season this company's coming dish.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cups  dried rigatoni or penne pasta
1: 2  tablespoons  purchased dried tomato pesto
2: 1  10  ounce container refrigerated Alfredo, or four-cheese pasta sauce or 1 1/4 cups bottled Alfredo or four-cheese pasta sauce
3: 3  tablespoons  milk
4: 1  12  ounce can water-pack solid white tuna, drained and broken into chunks
5: 1/4 cup  finely shredded Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degree F. In a Dutch oven cook pasta according to package directions. Drain well; return to pan. Meanwhile, in a bowl combine pesto, Alfredo sauce, and milk. Add to pasta, stirring gently to coat. Gently fold in tuna.
1: Transfer pasta mixture to a 2-quart oval baking dish. Sprinkle with shredded Parmesan cheese. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is just melted. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Purchased pesto and refrigerated alfredo sauce are the shortcut ingredients that make this tuna casserole quick to make.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  tablespoons  low-sodium soy sauce
1: 2  tablespoons  rice vinegar
2: 1  tablespoon  sesame oil
3: 2  teaspoons  grated fresh ginger
4: 2  teaspoons  sugar
5: 1  teaspoon  lime juice
6: 1/4 teaspoon  hot sauce (such as Tabasco)
7: 1  pound  boneless, skinless, thinly sliced chicken breasts
8: 1  package (8.8 ounces) soba noodles
9: 3  cups  broccoli florets
10: 1   small sweet red pepper, thinly sliced
11: 1  tablespoon  sesame seeds, optional
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, sugar, lime juice and hot sauce.
1: Fill a large skillet halfway with water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 4 minutes or until cooked through; set aside. When cool enough to handle, shred chicken using two forks and place pieces in a large serving bowl.
2: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook noodles following package directions. Add broccoli florets to pot for final 4 minutes of cooking time. Drain noodles and rinse with cold water.
3: Place noodle mixture and red pepper in serving bowl with chicken. Drizzle soy sauce mixture on top and toss well to coat. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top, if desired, and serve at room temperature or cold.
recipe_description: Soba noodles, hot sauce, ginger, and soy sauce give a spicy Asian touch to this chicken and broccoli main-dish recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  9  ounce  package refrigerated light cheese ravioli
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 1  medium red sweet pepper, chopped
3: 1  medium green sweet pepper, chopped
4: 1  medium carrot, cut into long, thin strips
5: 1  small onion, chopped
6: 2  cloves garlic, minced
7: 1  medium tomato, chopped
8: 1/4 cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth
9: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh tarragon or 1 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed, or 3 tablespoons snipped fresh basil or 2 teaspoons dried basil, crushed
10: Fresh jalapeno chile pepper (optional)
11: Fresh tarragon or basil sprig (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook ravioli according to package directions, except omit any oil or salt. Drain. Return pasta to hot pan.
1: Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add sweet peppers, carrot, onion, and garlic; cook about 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in tomato, broth, and snipped or crushed tarragon or basil. Cook and stir about 2 minutes more or until heated through.
2: Add vegetable mixture to the cooked ravioli; toss gently to combine. If desired, garnish with jalapeno pepper and tarragon or basil sprig. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Packaged light cheese ravioli not only cut the cooking time for this pasta recipe, they also help trim the fat and calories.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  large onion, chopped
1: 1  clove garlic, finely chopped
2: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
3: 1/4 teaspoon  red pepper flakes
4: 1  14 1/2 ounce can Italian-style stewed tomatoes
5: 1  8  ounce can no-salt-added tomato sauce
6: 1/2 pound  shrimp, peeled, deveined, halved lengthwise
7: 12  ounces  angel hair pasta
recipe_instructions:
0: Saute onion and garlic in oil in saucepan 3 minutes. Add pepper flakes; saute 1 minute.
1: Add tomatoes and sauce; simmer 5 minutes. Add shrimp; simmer until shrimp are translucent, 5 minutes.
2: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Top with sauce. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Diavolo is the Italian word for devil and refers to sauces seasoned with hot chiles. In this quick and easy recipe, the sauce is made with stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, and red pepper flakes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  ditalini
1: 1  teaspoon  canola oil
2: 4  slices turkey bacon, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces
3: 1   small onion, chopped
4: 2  cups  fire-roasted diced tomatoes
5: 1   pinch red pepper flakes
6: 1  19  ounce can chickpeas, drained and rinsed
recipe_instructions:
0: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook ditalini according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water, and return pasta to the pot.
1: Heat oil in a medium-size saucepan over medium-high heat. Add bacon and onion and cook for 3 minutes. Lower heat to medium and add tomatoes and red pepper flakes to saucepan; cook another 15 minutes. Add chickpeas to pot and cook 1 minute or until warmed through.
2: Stir sauce into pasta, adding pasta water to the sauce if necessary. Serve immediately.
recipe_description: Fun shaped pasta joins forces with turkey bacon and chickpeas in a spicy tomato sauce. This dinner recipe takes less than 30 minutes to prepare.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  box (13.25 ounces) whole-grain penne pasta
1: 4  cups  broccoli florets (about 2 stalks)
2: 1  cup  skim milk
3: 1  tablespoon  all-purpose flour
4: 1  teaspoon  Dijon mustard
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
7: pinch of cayenne pepper
8: 8  ounces  2% sharp Cheddar cheese, grated (2 cups)
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat large pot of lightly salted water to boiling. Add pasta and cook 6 minutes. Add broccoli and cook an additional 4 minutes. Drain.
1: Meanwhile, whisk milk and flour together in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then simmer 3 minutes, until thickened. Remove from heat and whisk in mustard, salt, pepper and cayenne.
2: Add grated Cheddar, whisking constantly until melted. Transfer pasta and broccoli to serving bowl. Pour cheese sauce over pasta-broccoli mixture and stir until coated.
recipe_description: The cheese sauce for this classic recipe uses skim milk and 2 percent sharp cheddar cheese to make a low-fat meal in less than 30 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Salt and pepper
1: 3/4 pound  short pasta, such as campanelle
2: 1 3/4 cups  corn kernels (from 2 ears)
3: 1  cup  ricotta
4: 1/4 cup  grated Parmesan, plus more for serving
5: Chopped zucchini
6: 1/2 cup  fresh basil leaves, torn, plus more for serving
7: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh dill
recipe_name: Herbed Ricotta Pasta with Corn and Zucchini
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta 3 minutes less than package instructions; add corn and cook until tender, 3 minutes. Reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain.
1: In a large bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup pasta water, ricotta, and Parmesan. Add pasta mixture, zucchini, basil, and dill and toss to combine. Add more pasta water if necessary to create a light sauce that coats pasta. Season with salt and pepper and top with more basil and Parmesan.
recipe_description: Make the most of summer produce with this herbed ricotta pastaand in the winter, feel free to use seasonally-appropriate or frozen veggies instead.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  dried fusilli or spaghetti
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil or cooking oil
2: 1 1/2 ounces  Italian bread, torn into small pieces (1-1/2 cups)
3: 8  ounces  uncooked Italian sweet or hot sausage, or ground beef
4: 2   medium green tomatoes, cut into wedges
5: 1   medium red onion, coarsely chopped
6: 1   medium red, green, or yellow sweet pepper, cut into bite-size pieces
7: 1  26  ounce jar pasta sauce with olives
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add bread pieces. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until bread is toasted. Remove from skillet; set aside.
2: Remove casings, if present, from sausages. In the same skillet cook and stir the sausage or ground beef, tomatoes, onion, and pepper over medium heat 6 to 8 minutes or until vegetables are tender and sausage is browned. Drain off fat. Stir in pasta sauce. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve sauce over hot cooked pasta; sprinkle with toasted bread pieces. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Jarred sauce makes this sausage, vegetable, and pasta a quick dinner recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 12  ounces  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1: 6  ounces  dried multigrain or whole grain penne pasta
2: 1  tablespoon  olive oil or canola oil
3: 4   cloves garlic, minced
4: 1/4 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
5: 2  cups  broccoli florets
6: 1  14 1/2 ounce can diced tomatoes with green pepper, celery, and onions, undrained
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or oregano
8: Shaved Parmesan cheese (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Cut chicken into bite-size strips; set aside. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain.
1: Meanwhile, in a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and crushed red pepper; cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add broccoli; cook and stir for 3 minutes more. Remove broccoli from skillet.
2: Add chicken to the hot skillet; cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes or until no longer pink. Return broccoli to the skillet. Add undrained tomatoes and drained pasta. Cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
3: To serve, divide mixture among four shallow bowls. Sprinkle with basil and, if desired, Parmesan cheese.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  ears fresh sweet corn
1: 8  ounces  dried orecchiette pasta
2: 1/4 cup  pine nuts
3: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
4: 1  cup  grape tomatoes
5: 1   medium shallot, thinly sliced
6: 1 1/2 cups  half-and-half or light cream
7: 1/2 teaspoon  sea salt or kosher salt
8: 1/2 teaspoon  freshly cracked black pepper
9: 1/2 teaspoon  freshly grated nutmeg or 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
10: 2  cups  torn arugula
11: Sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper
12: 2  ounces  Pecorino Romano or Parmesan cheese, shaved
recipe_name: Orecchiette in Creamed Corn with Wilted Tomatoes and Arugula
recipe_instructions:
0: Remove husks from ears of corn. Scrub with a stiff brush to remove silks; rinse. Cut kernels from cobs; set kernels aside. Discard cobs. In a 5- to 6-quart Dutch oven cook pasta in lightly salted boiling water for 12 to 15 minutes or until al dente. Remove 1/2 cup of the pasta water; set aside. Drain pasta; return pasta to the Dutch oven.
1: Meanwhile, in a very large skillet cook pine nuts over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or just until toasted. Remove pine nuts from skillet; set aside.
2: For sauce, heat the olive oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add corn kernels, tomatoes, and shallot. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until corn begins to brown and shallot is tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in half-and-half and the reserved pasta water. Bring to boiling. Boil gently, uncovered, for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon sea salt, 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and the nutmeg. Pour sauce over pasta in pot. Add arugula and toss until well combined. Season with additional sea salt and cracked black pepper.
3: To serve, divide pasta mixture among bowls. Top with cheese and toasted pine nuts.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  15  ounce package rolled refrigerated unbaked piecrust (2 crusts)
1: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
2: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
3: 2  tablespoons  ground cinnamon
4: 1/4 cup  unsalted butter, softened
5: 3/4 cup  pecan halves
6: 1/3 cup  packed brown sugar
7: 4   medium Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and thinly sliced (about 5 cups)
8: 4   medium pears, peeled, cored and thinly sliced (about 4 cups)
9: 2  tablespoons  lemon juice
10: Creme Anglaise
11: Caramel ice cream topping
12: Sweetened Whipped Cream
13: Pecan halves
14: 1  cup  whipping cream
15: 2  tablespoons  sugar
16: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
17: 1 1/3 cups  whipping cream
18: 2/3 cup  sugar
19: 2   egg yolks
20: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
recipe_instructions:
0: Let pie crusts stand at room temperature according to package directions. Line a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate with foil, extending foil 1 inch beyond edges of plate; set aside. In a small bowl, combine granulated sugar, flour and cinnamon; set aside.
1: Spread 2 tablespoons of the softened butter over foil on bottom of pie plate. Press the 3/4 cup pecan halves, round sides down, into butter. Pat brown sugar into butter. Unroll pie crusts. Place 1 of the pie crusts over pecan mixture; press onto bottom and up sides of pie plate.
2: Arrange apple slices in pastry lined pie plate. Sprinkle half of the cinnamon mixture over apples. Arrange pear slices over apples. Sprinkle the remaining cinnamon mixture over pears. Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons butter; stir in lemon juice. Pour butter mixture over filling. Top with the remaining pie crust. Fold top pie crust under bottom pie crust and pinch together to seal. If desired, crimp edge. Cut slits in top pie crust. To prevent overbrowning, cover edge of pie with foil.
3: Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degree F. Bake 20 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 45 to 55 minutes more or until fruit is tender and filling is bubbly. Cool on a wire rack.
4: To serve, invert pie onto a large cutting board. Lift off the pie plate and carefully peel off foil. Cut pie into 10 wedges. For each serving, spoon about 3 tablespoons of Creme Anglaise onto each dessert plate. Make a ring of caramel ice cream topping around plate and swirl. Place a pie wedge in center of plate. Top with a dollop of Sweetened Whipped Cream. Sprinkle additional pecan halves on top. Makes 10 servings.
5: In chilled large mixing bowl combine whipping cream, sugar and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until soft peaks form. Makes about 2 cups.
6: In a heavy medium saucepan, bring whipping cream just to boiling, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. In a medium mixing bowl, combine about 1/3 cup of the hot cream, sugar and  egg yolks. Beat with an electric mixer on high speed for 2 to 3 minutes or until thick and lemon-colored. Gradually stir about half of the remaining cream into the egg yolk mixture. Return all of the egg yolk mixture to the saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat just until mixture returns to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Immediately place saucepan in a large bowl half filled with ice water. Stir for 2 minutes to cool quickly. Transfer cream mixture to a serving bowl. Cover surface of cream with plastic wrap. Chill for at least 2 hours or overnight. Makes about 2 cups.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  17.3 ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets, thawed
1: 1   egg
2: 1  tablespoon  water
3: 1  21  ounce can fruit pie filling, any variety
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork or whisk.
1: Unfold 1 pastry sheet on a baking sheet.  Spread the pie filling on the pastry to within 1 inch of the edge. Brush the edges with the egg mixture.  Unfold the remaining pastry sheet and place over the filling.  Crimp the edges with a fork to seal.  Brush with the egg mixture. Cut several slits in the top of the pastry.
2: Bake for 30 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.  Cool the pastry on the baking sheet on a wire rack for 15 minutes.
recipe_description: Nothing could be easier than this fruit pie made with puff pastry sheets. Add your favorite prepared pie filling--cherry, apple, blueberry--and you've got a delicious, homemade pie.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  recipe Pastry for Single-Crust Pie (see recipe below)
1: 4  cups  fresh or frozen unsweetened blackberries
2: 1  cup  sugar
3: 1/3 cup  quick-cooking tapioca
4: 1  teaspoon  ground cinnamon
5: 1  recipe Pecan Streusel Topping (see recipe below)
6: 1 1/2 cups  all-purpose flour
7: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
8: 1/4 cup  shortening
9: 1/4 cup  butter, cut up, or shortening
10: 1/4- 1/3 cup  ice water
11: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
12: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
13: 1/8 teaspoon  ground cinnamon
14: 1/8 teaspoon  ground nutmeg
15: 2  tablespoons  butter
16: 1/2 cup  toasted, coarsely chopped pecans
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare Pastry for Single-Crust Pie. On a lightly floured surface, use your hands to slightly flatten dough. Roll dough from center to edge into a circle about 12 inches in diameter. To transfer pastry, wrap it around the rolling pin. Unroll pastry into a 9-inch pie plate. Ease pastry into pie plate, being careful not to stretch pastry. Trim pastry to 1/2 inch beyond edge of pie plate. Fold under extra pastry. Crimp edge as desired. Do not prick pastry. Line the pastry with a double thickness of heavy foil. Bake the pastry in a 450 degree F oven for 8 minutes. Remove the foil. Bake for 4 to 5 minutes more or until the pastry is set and dry. Reduce the oven temperature to 375 degree F.
1: Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, combine the blackberries, sugar, tapioca, and cinnamon. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture starts to bubble. Reduce heat and simmer the berry filling, uncovered, for 10 minutes, stirring the mixture frequently.
2: Pour the berry filling into the prepared piecrust. Top with the Pecan Streusel Topping.
3: Bake the pie in the 375 degree F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the crust and topping turn golden. Makes 8 servings.
4: In a medium bowl stir together flour and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut in shortening and butter until pieces are pea-size. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon water over part of the flour mixture; toss gently with a fork. Push moistened dough to side of bowl. Repeat with additional water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until all of the flour mixture is moistened. Gather mixture into a ball, kneading gently until it holds together.
5: In a small bowl, stir together all-purpose flour, packed brown sugar, ground cinnamon, and ground nutmeg. Using a pastry blender, cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in toasted, coarsely chopped pecans.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cups  cups cut up squash, such as pattypan, yellow summer squash, or zucchini
1: 2   red and/or yellow sweet peppers, cut into wide strips
2: 1  large sweet onion and/or fennel bulb, cut into wedges
3: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
4: Salt or salt and freshly ground black pepper
5: 2  ounces  Parmesan cheese
6: 1/2 17.3 ounce package frozen puff pastry sheets (1 sheet), thawed
7: 1/2 cup  halved cherry tomatoes
8: 2  tablespoons  balsamic vinegar
9: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh thyme
10: 1  cup  purchased refrigerated creamy Parmesan dressing
11: 1/4 cup  finely chopped sweet onion
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Coat sides and bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Spread squash, sweet peppers, and onion wedges in pan. Toss with olive oil; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast, uncovered, 20 to 25 minutes or until tender, stirring once.
1: Meanwhile, using a vegetable peeler, cut Parmesan cheese in thin strips. Set aside. On lightly floured surface, roll puff pastry to 13x9-inch rectangle. Remove baking pan from oven. Add tomatoes to pan. Toss vegetables with balsamic vinegar and half the Parmesan cheese. Spread vegetables evenly in pan. Lay pastry over vegetables, tucking in edges. Return pan to oven; bake for 15 minutes or until pastry is puffed and golden.
2: Remove pan from oven; cool 5 minutes. Invert a 15x10x1-inch baking pan over pan with pastry. Carefully invert pans together; remove 13x9 pan. Transfer any vegetables that stick to finished tart. Sprinkle tart evenly with remaining cheese and 2 teaspoons of the thyme. In small bowl stir together dressing, chopped onion, and remaining 1 teaspoon thyme. Cut in squares. Serve tart warm or at room temperature with dressing. Makes 12 servings.
recipe_description: This savory and simple appetizer tart uses easy puff pastry as its base. Roasted vegetables and flavor-packed Parmesan cheese top it off.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  15  ounce box prepared piecrust sheets, thawed if frozen
1: Flour, for piecrust
2: 1  tablespoon  finely grated fresh lemon zest
3: 3/4 cup  fresh lemon juice
4: 1  cup  superfine sugar
5: 2  large eggs
6: 2  large egg yolks
7: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
8: 1 3/4 sticks (3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons) unsalted butter, cut up
9: Sweetened whipped cream, for garnish
10: Edible flowers, for garnish
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 400 degree F and arrange rack in lower third. Unfold 1 piecrust on a lightly floured surface. Using a floured rolling pin, roll out onto a 12-1/2-inch round. Using a 5-inch round cutter, cut out 4 rounds. Repeat with remaining piecrust to make a total of 8 rounds, for shells.
1: Fit each shell into a 4-inch round removable-rim fluted tart pan, allowing shell to extend up past edge of pans. Prick bottoms and sides of shells several times with a fork and chill until firm, 15 minutes. Bake on a cookie sheet until shells are golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Transfer in pans to a rack and cool completely.
2: Meanwhile, whisk together zest, juice, sugar, eggs, yolks, and salt in a heavy 2-quart saucepan. Add butter and cook over moderately low heat, whisking constantly, until butter is melted, curd is thick enough to hold traces of the whisk and just begins to simmer, about 15 minutes.
3: Using a spoon, push curd through a fine-mesh sieve set over a bowl to remove lumps. Cover surface of curd with parchment or waxed paper and let cool. Spoon into shells and chill, loosely covered, until curd is set, 4 hours or overnight. Garnish with whipped cream and flowers, if desired. Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: These little pies have a lemony custard filling which makes them a delightful spring dessert.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   recipe Pastry for Lattice-Top Pie
1: 1 2/3 cups  apple juice or apple cider
2: 3/4 cup  snipped dried apricots or peaches
3: 3/4 cup  snipped dried pitted plums (prunes)
4: 1/2 cup  dried tart cherries or raisins
5: 1/3 cup  packed brown sugar
6: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1/4 teaspoon  ground nutmeg
8: 1  cup  chopped, peeled cooking apple or pear
9: 1/2 cup  broken walnuts
10: Milk (optional)
11: Granulated sugar (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare and roll out Pastry for Lattice-Top Pie, except roll pastry half for bottom crust into a 12-inch circle. Line a 10- or 11-inch tart pan with a removable bottom with pastry. Press pastry into fluted sides of tart pan and trim edges. Save remaining pastry for lattice top.
1: For filling, in a medium saucepan combine apple juice or cider, apricots or peaches, plums, and cherries or raisins. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Meanwhile, stir together brown sugar, flour, and nutmeg; add chopped apple or pear and walnuts. Gradually stir dried fruit mixture into apple mixture.
2: Transfer filling to pastry-lined tart pan. Top with a lattice crust. If desired, brush pastry with milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake in 375 degree F oven about 45 minutes or until  fruit is bubbly and pastry is golden. Cool on wire rack. To serve, remove sides of tart pan. Makes 12 servings.
recipe_description: The filling for this tart is so easy that you'll have time to make the homemade crust.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 3/4 cups  sugar
1: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
2: 4  cups  chopped fresh rhubarb or frozen rhubarb*
3: 1   medium cooking apple, peeled and coarsely shredded
4: 1  recipe Pastry for a Double-Crust Pie (recipe follows)
5: 1  cup  raspberries
6: 2  cups  all-purpose flour
7: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
8: 2/3 cup  shortening
9: 7 - 8  tablespoons  water
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large mixing bowl stir together the sugar and flour. Stir in rhubarb, raspberries, and apple. Transfer to a pastry-lined 9-inch pie plate. Trim pastry even with the rim of the pie plate. Cut slits in the top crust. Place top crust over fruit filling. Seal and flute the edge. Cover edges with foil; bake in a 375 degree F. oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil. Bake 20 to 25 minutes more or until top is golden and fruit is tender. Cool on a wire rack for two hours before serving. Makes 8 servings.
1: In a bowl stir together flour and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut in shortening until pieces are pea size. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon cold water over part of the mixture; gently toss with a fork. Push moistened dough to side of bowl. Repeat using 1 tablespoon cold water at a time until all the dough is moistened (6 to 7 tablespoons total). Divide dough in half. Form each half into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, flatten 1 dough ball. Roll from center to edges into a 12-inch circle. To transfer pastry, wrap it around the rolling pin; unroll into a 9-inch pie plate. Ease pastry into pie plate, being careful not to stretch pastry. Fill as above. roll remaining dough into a circle about 12 inches in diameter. Continue as above.
recipe_description: Three pie favorites--rhubarb, red raspberries, and apples--provide the perfect complement of sweetness and tang in the rosy-hued filling.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   single crust of Perfect Piecrust prebaked in a 9-inch pie plate (see recipe center)
1: 3/4 cup  granulated sugar
2: 3  tablespoons  unsweetened cocoa
3: 1/2 cup  cornstarch
4: 3 1/2 cups  half-and-half
5: 8   egg yolks
6: 2  ounces  bittersweet chocolate, chopped
7: 2  teaspoons  vanilla extract
8: 1  tablespoon  unsalted butter
9: 1 1/4 cups  heavy cream
10: 3  tablespoons  confectioners' sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: In a heavy saucepan, whisk together 1/2 cup sugar, cocoa, 1/4 cup cornstarch and 1-3/4 cups half-and-half. Place over medium-high heat and stir until sugar is just dissolved, about 2 min. Whisk in 4 egg yolks; reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring constantly, until custard thickens and just boils, about 5 min. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate and 1 tsp vanilla. Place pan in a bowl of ice and water and stir occasionally until custard cools.
1: Remove from ice bath, dry pan bottom and transfer custard to prepared crust. Cover with plastic wrap, gently pressing wrap onto surface of custard; refrigerate.
2: In another heavy saucepan, stir together 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cornstarch and 1-3/4 cups half-and-half. Place over medium-high heat and stir 2 min. Reduce heat to medium and whisk in 4 egg yolks. Cook, stirring constantly, until custard thickens and just boils, about 5 min. Remove from heat and stir in 1 tsp vanilla and butter. Cool custard as above, then spoon on top of chocolate filling and smooth. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, at least 3 hr.
3: Whip cream and confectioners' sugar until firm peaks form and spread onto chilled pie. Garnish with chocolate curls. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  whole wheat flour
1: 1/2 cup  all-purpose flour, plus 2 tablespoons extra for your work surface
2: 1/2 cup  plus 1 Tbs. cold unsalted butter, divided, and cut into small pieces
3: 2 1/2 tablespoons  cold water
4: 3   medium apples, peeled and cored
5: 1  cup  cranberries
6: 1/3 cup  sugar
7: 1  teaspoon  cinnamon
recipe_instructions:
0: In a food processor with a blade attachment, mix both flours and 1/2 cup butter. Process until butter is the size of tiny peas. Add water; pulse until dough pulls together. Let your kid form it into a 5-inch disk on a floured surface. Cover; refrigerate for an hour.
1: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Prepare a floured surface. Ask your child to roll the dough into a 12-inch  circle about 1/8-inch thick. Help him check the size with a ruler. Put the dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
2: Quarter apples; slice 1/4-inch thick. Ask your kid to mix apples with the cranberries, sugar, and cinnamon and spoon into center of dough, leaving a 2-inch border. Fold dough over and dot center with remaining butter. Bake 35 minutes, until crust is golden and fruit bubbles.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Pastry for Single-Crust 9-Inch Pie (see recipe below)
1: 1 3/4 cups  sugar
2: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
3: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/2 cup  butter, melted and cooled
5: 3   eggs
6: 1/2 cup  buttermilk
7: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
8: 1/8 teaspoon  lemon extract
9: Fresh raspberries (optional)
10: 1 1/4 cups  all purpose flour
11: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
12: 1/3 cup  shortening
13: 4 - 5  tablespoons  cold water
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare and roll out the pastry into a circle about 12 inches in diameter. Wrap pastry around the rolling pin. Unroll and ease pastry into a 9-inch pie plate, being careful not to stretch the pastry. Trim the pastry to 1/2 inch beyond edge of pie plate. Fold under extra pastry. Crimp edge as you like. Don't prick pastry. Line the pastry with a double thickness of foil.
1: Bake in a 450 degree F oven for 8 minutes. Remove foil; bake 4 to 5 minutes more or until set and dry. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degree F.
2: Meanwhile, in small mixing bowl, stir together sugar, flour, and salt. In large mixing bowl, beat butter and eggs with electric mixer until just combined.
3: Add sugar mixture; mix well. Gradually stir in buttermilk, vanilla, and lemon extract. Place partially baked pastry shell on the oven rack. Carefully pour filling into shell. Cover edge of pie with foil to prevent overbrowning.
4: Bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil; bake pie for 10 to 15 minutes longer or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Refrigerate within 2 hours; cover for longer storage. If you like, serve with raspberries. Makes 8 servings.
5: Stir together flour and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut in shortening until pieces are pea-size. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon cold water over part of the mixture; gently toss with a fork. Push moistened dough to the side of the bowl. Repeat moistening dough, using 1 tablespoon cold water at a time, until all the dough is moistened (4 to 5 tablespoons cold water total). Form dough into a ball. On a lightly floured surface, use your hands to slightly flatten dough.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   Baked Pastry Shell
1: 1  cup  whipping cream
2: 1  cup  semisweet chocolate pieces (6 ounces)
3: 1/3 cup  butter
4: 1/3 cup  sugar
5: 2   egg yolks, lightly beaten
6: 3  tablespoons  creme de cacao or whipping cream
7: 1  12 1/4 ounce jar caramel ice cream topping (1 cup)
8: 3/4 cup  coarsely chopped toasted pecans or almonds
9: 1  cup  whipped cream
10: Chocolate curls (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare Baked Pastry Shell; set aside.
1: In a heavy medium saucepan combine the 1 cup whipping cream, the chocolate pieces, butter, and sugar. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat. Gradually stir half of the hot mixture into beaten egg yolks. Return egg mixture to chocolate mixture in saucepan. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is slightly thickened and begins to bubble (about  5 minutes). Remove from heat. (Mixture may appear to separate.) Stir in the 3 tablespoons creme de cacao or whipping cream. Place the saucepan in a bowl of ice water, stirring occasionally, until the mixture stiffens and becomes hard to stir (about 20 minutes). Transfer the chocolate mixture to a medium mixing bowl.
2: Beat cooled chocolate mixture with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 2 to 3 minutes or until light and fluffy.
3: Spread caramel ice cream topping in bottom of Baked Pastry Shell. Sprinkle pecans evenly over caramel. Carefully spread filling into pie shell. Cover and refrigerate pie for 5 to 24 hours. To serve, top with whipped cream. If you like, garnish with chocolate curls. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
1: 1/3 cup  butter-flavored shortening
2: 1/2 cup  finely shredded cheddar cheese
3: 3 - 4  tablespoons  cold water
4: 5  cups  thinly sliced, peeled cooking apples
5: 1  cup  sugar
6: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1  teaspoon  ground cinnamon
8: 1   recipe Cheddar Crunch Topping (see recipe below)
9: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
10: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
11: 3/4 cup  sugar
12: 3/4 cup  all-purpose flour
13: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
14: 1/3 cup  butter
15: 1  cup  finely shredded cheddar cheese (4 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a mixing bowl, stir together 1 cup flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cut in the shortening to the size of small peas.
1: Stir in cheese. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the water over part of the mixture; toss with a fork. Repeat until all is moistened. Form into a ball.
2: On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough to form a 12-inch circle. Ease into 9-inch pie plate. Trim to 1/2 inch beyond edge of plate; fold under pastry. Crimp edge. Do not prick pastry.
3: In a bowl, combine apples, sugar, 1/4 cup flour, cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Transfer to crust.
4: Prepare Cheddar Crunch Topping. Sprinkle over filling. Cover edge with foil. Bake in a 375 degree F oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes more or until top is golden and fruit is tender. Makes 8 servings.
5: In a bowl, stir together sugar, flour, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Gently stir in cheddar cheese.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
1: 2  tablespoons  sugar
2: 1  cup  slivered almonds
3: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine, softened
4: 1   egg
5: 1/2 cup  sugar
6: 1  teaspoon  ground cinnamon
7: 1  tablespoon  corn syrup
8: 1/8 teaspoon  almond extract
9: 3   eggs
10: 3  ounces  semisweet baking chocolate, melted, cooled
11: 6   tablespoons butter or margarine, melted
12: Whipped cream
13: Additional ground cinnamon
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In food processor or blender, place flour, 2 tablespoons sugar and the almonds. Cover; process until almonds are finely chopped. Add 1/2 cup butter and egg. Cover; process until well blended. Press mixture in bottom and 1/2 inch up side of ungreased 9-inch tart pan with removable bottom.
1: Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until light brown. If crust puffs while baking, poke with fork.
2: Meanwhile, in medium bowl, beat 1/2 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, the corn syrup, almond extract and 3 eggs with wire whisk until smooth. Stir in chocolate and 6 tablespoons butter.
3: Pour filling into hot crust. Bake 18 to 24 minutes or until almost set in center. Cool on cooling rack at least 30 minutes before serving.
4: Remove side of pan. Serve tart topped with whipped cream; sprinkle with additional cinnamon. Store covered in refrigerator.
5: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): In step 2, bake 25 to 30 minutes. In step 4, bake 20 to 25 minutes.
recipe_description: The sweet, pungent flavor of taste of cinnamon pairs well with chocolate in an impressive-looking tart.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/4 cups  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
1: 1/2 cup  macadamia nuts, finely chopped
2: 1/3 cup  butter or margarine, softened
3: 2  tablespoons  granulated sugar
4: 1/2 teaspoon  vanilla
5: 1   egg, beaten
6: 2/3 cup  granulated sugar
7: 1/4 cup  cornstarch
