8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: 3  cups  whole milk
10: 4   egg yolks
11: 2  tablespoons  butter or margarine
12: 1  tablespoon  vanilla
13: 2   large bananas, sliced
14: 1  cup  whipping cream
15: 2  tablespoons  powdered or granulated sugar
16: 1/2 cup  macadamia nuts, coarsely chopped, toasted*
recipe_instructions:
0: In medium bowl, beat all crust ingredients with electric mixer on low speed about 1 minute or just until blended. Press mixture on bottom and up side of ungreased 9-inch glass pie plate; prick mixture with fork. Refrigerate 30 minutes while preparing filling.
1: In 2-quart saucepan, mix 23 cup sugar, the cornstarch and salt. In large bowl, beat milk and egg yolks with wire whisk until blended; gradually stir into sugar mixture. Cook over medium-low heat about 15 minutes, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and boils. Boil 2 minutes, beating constantly with wire whisk; remove from heat. Beat in 2 tablespoons butter and 1 tablespoon vanilla with wire whisk. Press plastic wrap on filling to prevent a tough layer from forming. Cool at room temperature while baking crust.
2: Heat oven to 400 degrees F. Bake crust 16 to 18 minutes or until edge is golden brown. Cool at room temperature 15 minutes. Place banana slices on pie crust. Stir filling well; pour filling over bananas. Press plastic wrap on filling; refrigerate at least 2 hours until thoroughly chilled.
3: In chilled small bowl, beat whipping cream and 2 tablespoons sugar on high speed until soft peaks form; spread over top of pie. Sprinkle with toasted nuts.
4: *To toast nuts, bake uncovered in ungreased shallow pan in 350 degrees F oven 6 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until golden brown.
5: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft):  Bake crust 18 to 20 minutes.
recipe_description: Give banana cream pie a bit of crunch by using macadamia nuts in both the crust and topping.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
1: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
2: 1/3 cup  plus 1 tablespoon shortening
3: 2 - 3  tablespoons  cold water
4: 1 1/2 cups  sliced peeled apples (2 small)
5: 1  tablespoon  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
6: 1/2 cup  toffee bits (from 10-ounce bag)
7: 1   egg, beaten
8: 1  tablespoon  coarse white sparkling sugar
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Line cookie sheet with sides or 15x10x1-inch pan with cooking parchment paper or foil. In medium bowl, mix 1 cup flour and the salt. Using pastry blender (or pulling 2 tables knives through ingredients in opposite directions), cut in shortening until particles are size of small peas. Sprinkle with cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, tossing with fork until all flour is moistened and pastry almost leaves side of bowl (if necessary, 1 to 2 teaspoons more water can be added).
1: Gather pastry into a ball. On lightly floured surface, shape pastry into flattened round. Using rolling pin, roll into 12-inch round, about 1/8 inch thick. Place on cookie sheet.
2: In medium bowl, toss apples and 1 tablespoon flour. Mound apple mixture on half of pastry to within 3/4 inch of edge. Sprinkle with toffee bits. Fold pastry in half over apple mixture. Fold 1/2 inch of sealed edge of pastry over; firmly press tines of fork around edge to seal. Brush top of turnover with egg. Cut 3 slits, 1 inch long, in top to vent steam. Sprinkle top with sugar.
3: Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Immediately remove from cookie sheet to serving plate. Cool 30 minutes before cutting.
4: Into small bowl, measure 2 tablespoons water. In food processor, place shortening, flour and salt. Cover; process with on-and-off pulses until mixture is crumbly. With food processor running, pour water all at once through feed tube, processing just until dough leaves side of bowl (dough should not form a ball).
5: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake 35 to 45 minutes.
recipe_description: Skip the pie plate and make a turnover filled with tender apples and sweet toffee bits.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  8  ounce package cream cheese
1: 1/3 cup  sugar
2: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
3: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
4: 1   egg
5: 1   9-inch unbaked pie shell
6: 1 1/4 cups  chopped pecans
7: 2   egg yolks, slightly beaten
8: 2/3 cup  light corn syrup
9: 1/4 cup  sugar
10: 1  teaspoon  vanilla
recipe_instructions:
0: In a medium mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, 1/3 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla and the salt. Beat with an electric mixer till mixture is smooth. Add the 1 egg and beat on low speed till mixture is combined.
1: Spread mixture over bottom of the unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle pecans evenly over cream-cheese mixture.
2: In a large mixing bowl, combine 2 eggs, corn syrup, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Carefully pour over pecans in pie shell.
3: Bake in a 375 degree oven for 40 to 45 minutes or till puffed and center appears nearly set when you shake it.
4: Cool completely on a wire rack. Store in refrigerator. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Pastry for Single-Crust Pie (see recipe below)
1: 1 1/2 cups  sugar
2: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
3: 3/4 teaspoon  ground nutmeg
4: 3   slightly beaten eggs
5: 4  cups  sliced fresh rhubarb or thawed and drained frozen sliced rhubarb
6: 1/2 cup  all-purpose flour
7: 1/4 cup  sugar
8: 1/3 cup  butter
9: 1 1/4 cups  all-purpose flour
10: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
11: 1/3 cup  shortening
12: 3 - 4  tablespoons  cold water
recipe_instructions:
0: Prepare Pastry for Single-Crust Pie. Preheat oven to 400 degrees . For filling: In a large bowl, combine 11/2 cups sugar, 1/4 cup flour and the nutmeg. Add the eggs; mix well. Gently stir in the rhubarb. Turn the mixture into the pastry-lined pie plate.
1: For streusel: In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup flour and 1/4 cup sugar. Using a pastry blender or your fingers, cut or rub in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over the pie.
2: Cover edge of pie with foil to prevent overbrowning. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil. Bake about  20 minutes more or until topping is golden.
3: On a lightly floured surface, flatten dough with hands. Roll dough from center to edges, forming a 12-inch circle. Ease pastry into a 9-inch pie plate, being careful not to stretch pastry. Trim to 1/2 inch beyond edge of pie plate; fold under extra pastry. Flute edge; do not prick pastry.
4: In a bowl, stir together all-purpose flour and salt. Cut in shortening until pieces are the size of small peas. Using cold water, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the water over part of mixture; gently toss with a fork. Push to side of bowl. Repeat until all is moistened. Form dough into a ball.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   small zucchini and/or yellow summer squash
1: 1   small onion
2: 1   clove garlic
3: 1  tablespoon  olive oil or cooking oil
4: 1/2 teaspoon  dried Italian seasoning, crushed
5: 1  14 1/2 ounce can Italian-style stewed tomatoes
6: 1/2 cup  shredded mozzarella cheese (2 ounces)
7: 1/4 cup  shredded or grated Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Wash squash under cold running water. With a sharp knife, slice zucchini and/or summer squash into 1/2-inch thick slices. You should have about 2-2/3 cups.
1: To slice the onion, cut a small slice off one end of the onion. Peel the outer, paperlike skin from the onion. Starting at the cut end, cut the onion into 1/4-inch-thick slices and separate each slice into rings. With a garlic press or a sharp knife, mince the garlic clove (mincing means to chop into tiny pieces).
2: In an 8-inch skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat for 1 to 2 minutes or just until hot. Add zucchini and/or summer squash, onion, garlic, and Italian seasoning. Cook, uncovered, over medium-high heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3: With a large spoon, carefully add  undrained stewed tomatoes to the skillet. Cover skillet. Cook over medium-low heat about 3 minutes or until zucchini and/or summer squash is crisp tender. Spoon vegetable mixture onto 4 dinner plates.
4: Sprinkle some of the mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top of the vegetable mixture on each plate. Makes 4 side-dish servings.
recipe_description: Serve veggies pizza-style, topped with cheese, to make converts of child shying away from this healthful five-a-day food.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2 3/4- 17  cups  all-purpose flour
1: 1  package active dry yeast
2: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
3: 1  cup  warm water (120 degrees F to 130 degrees F)
4: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil or olive oil
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large mixing bowl combine 1-1/4 cups of the flour, the yeast, and salt; add warm water and oil. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds, scraping bowl constantly. Beat on high speed for 3 minutes. Using a wooden spoon, stir in as much of the remaining flour as you can.
1: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead in enough remaining flour to make a moderately stiff dough that is smooth and elastic (6 to 8 minutes total) . Divide dough into 8 pieces. Cover; let rest for 10 minutes. Makes 8 mini pizzas.
recipe_description: Kids love dough. It introduces them to the tactile side of making food. If time is short, buy pizza dough.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 - 1 1/2 pound package whole-wheat bread or pizza dough, thawed if frozen
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil, divided
2: 5   plums, pitted and thinly sliced
3: 1/2 cup  crumbled feta cheese (2 oz.)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Split dough in half. On a floured surface, roll each half into a ten-inch square. Place each on a greased baking sheet. Build up sides slightly. Prick dough with a fork. Brush with half of the oil.
1: Bake for 12 minutes, or until lightly browned. Brush again with remaining oil. Arrange plum slices on dough and sprinkle with feta. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes more, or until heated through. Cut each pizza into 6 slices.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  canned black beans, rinsed
1: 1/2 cup  coarsely chopped jarred roasted red peppers
2: 1   garlic clove
3: 1  tablespoon  chili powder
4: Kosher salt
5: 1  pound  whole-wheat pizza dough
6: Cornmeal, for dusting
7: 1  cup  shredded low-fat Monterey Jack cheese (3 ounces)
8: 1/2 cup  grape tomatoes, halved
9: 1/4 cup  pitted black olives, sliced
10: 1   scallion, thinly sliced
11: 1  cup  shredded butter lettuce
12: 3  tablespoons  reduced-fat sour cream
recipe_instructions:
0: Set a pizza stone on the bottom of the oven and preheat the oven to 450 degrees. In a food processor, combine the black beans with the roasted red peppers, garlic clove, and chili powder and puree until smooth. Season with salt.
1: Stretch the pizza dough to a 12-inch round and transfer to a cornmeal-dusted pizza peel. Spread the black-bean puree on top, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Sprinkle with the cheese, tomatoes, olives, and scallion.
2: Slide the pizza onto the preheated stone and bake for 12 minutes, until the bottom is crisp and the cheese is bubbling. Transfer the pizza to a work surface and top with the lettuce and dollops of the sour cream. Cut into 4 or 6 wedges and serve at once.
recipe_description: Deconstructed nachos were the inspiration behind this fun pizza. Made with chili-spiced black-bean puree, tomatoes, olives, shredded lettuce, and low-fat Jack cheese on a whole-wheat crust, the pie also gets a little low-fat sour cream (that nacho staple) on top.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 16  ounces  prepared pizza dough
1: Corn meal for dusting
2: 8  sticks string cheese
3: 2  cups  pizza sauce, divided
4: 4  cups   shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
5: 4  ounces  Canadian style bacon
6: 1/2 cup  bell pepper, sliced into strips
7: 2  cups  diced bacon, cooked
8: 1  cup  crumbled cooked sausage
9: 4  ounces  sliced pepperoni
10: 1/4 cup  black olive slices, drained
11: 1  tablespoon  grated Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 475 degrees F.
1: Roll out pizza dough into a 14-inch circle. Place on 12-inch oiled pizza pan dusted with cornmeal (drape crust evenly over outer edges of pan).
2: Position 1 stick string cheese along inside edges of dough, fold dough over cheese and press to seal. Repeat with remaining cheese sticks; forming a cheese stuffed crust around outer edge of pizza pan.
3: Spread 1/2 cup pizza sauce evenly over center of pizza crust; top with 2 cups shredded cheese.
4: Arrange Canadian bacon, bell pepper strips, bacon, sausage, pepperoni and black olives over top of pizza. Top with shredded cheese and  bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden and bubbly. Remove from oven. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese evenly over top of pizza.
recipe_description: This monster starts with a cheese-stuffed crust and has Hall of Fame written all over it. Indulgent? Well, yeah. It's topped with four kinds of meat, two kinds of cheese, bell peppers and black olives.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pouch Betty Crocker® sugar cookie mix (1 pound 1.5 ounces)
1: 1/2 cup  butter or margarine, melted
2: 1   egg
3: 1  cup  whipping cream
4: 1/2 cup  Betty Crocker® Rich & Creamy cream cheese frosting (from 1-pound container)
5: 3 1/2 cups  assorted fresh fruit
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray 14-inch pizza pan or 15x10-inch baking pan with cooking spray.
1: In medium bowl, stir cookie mix, melted butter and egg until soft dough forms. Press dough in bottom of pan. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely, about 45 minutes.
2: In chilled medium bowl, beat whipping cream with electric mixer on high speed until soft peaks form. Gently stir frosting into whipped cream. Spread over cookie pizza. Arrange fruit on top.
3: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Use 1/3 cup melted butter. Bake 12 to 17 minutes.
recipe_description: Try a sweet dessert pizza made with a rich sugar-cookie crust, frosting, whipped cream and your favorite fresh fruit.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3/4 pound  bulk pork sausage
1: 1/2 cup  chopped onion (1 medium)
2: 2  tablespoons  Gold Medal® all-purpose flour
3: 1  can diced tomatoes, undrained (14.5 ounces)
4: 1  can Green Giant® mushroom pieces and stems, undrained (4 ounces)
5: 1  teaspoon  dried oregano leaves
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried basil leaves
7: 1/4 teaspoon  garlic powder
8: 1/8 teaspoon  pepper
9: 1  can Pillsbury® Golden Layers® refrigerated buttermilk flaky biscuits (12 ounces)
10: 1  cup  shredded mozzarella cheese (4 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In 10-inch ovenproof skillet with 2-inch-deep sides, cook sausage and onion over medium heat 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until sausage is no longer pink.
1: Sprinkle flour over sausage mixture in skillet. Add tomatoes, mushrooms, oregano, basil, garlic powder and pepper; mix well. Cook until slightly thickened, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat; simmer uncovered while preparing biscuits.
2: Separate dough into 10 biscuits; cut each into quarters. Arrange biscuit pieces over hot sausage mixture. Sprinkle with cheese.
3: Bake uncovered 16 to 20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Bake at 375 degrees F 21 to 25 minutes.
recipe_description: From Betty's Soul Food Collection...  Bake flaky biscuits with pizza ingredients, and claim your own style of deep-dish pizza with zesty sausage. Mamma Mia! This is pizza delizioso!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   12-inch whole wheat Italian bread shell (Boboli®)
1: Reserved no-salt-added tomato paste from Wine-Braised Beef Brisket
2: Reserved beef and cooking juices from Wine-Braised Beef Brisket
3: 1  cup  sliced fresh mushrooms
4: 1/2 cup  chopped green sweet pepper
5: 3/4 cup  shredded reduced-fat mozzarella cheese (3 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place bread shell on a large pizza pan or baking sheet; set aside. In a small bowl whisk together tomato paste and the reserved cooking juices from the Wine-Braised Beef Brisket. Chop the reserved beef.
1: Spread tomato paste mixture over bread shell. Top with beef, mushrooms, sweet pepper, and cheeses. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Cut into 6 wedges to serve.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  lean ground beef
1: 3/4 cup  water
2: 1  4  ounce can diced green chilie peppers, drained
3: 1/2 1 1/2 ounce  envelope (about 2 tablespoons) taco seasoning mix
4: 1  teaspoon  chili powder
5: 1  tablespoon  cornmeal
6: 1  10  ounce package refrigerated pizza dough
7: 1  15  ounce can pinto beans with jalapeno peppers, rinsed and drained
8: 1  cup  shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese (4 ounces)
9: 1  cup  shredded lettuce
10: 1   medium tomato, chopped
11: 1/2 cup  thinly sliced green onions (4)
12: Bottled taco sauce (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet cook ground beef until brown. Drain off fat. Stir in the water, chile peppers, taco seasoning mix, and chili powder. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, 15 to 20 minutes or until most of the liquid is gone.
1: Meanwhile, grease a baking sheet and sprinkle with the cornmeal. Pat pizza dough into a 12x8-inch rectangle on the baking sheet. Bake in a 400 degree F oven for 5 minutes.
2: In a small bowl mash pinto beans with a fork. Spread beans over partially baked dough to within 1/2 inch of edges. Spoon meat mixture over beans. Bake, uncovered, 10 minutes more or until crust is just golden. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake 1 to 2 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Top with lettuce, tomato, and green onions. If desired, serve with taco sauce. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Kids will love this fun dinner recipe that features two favorite foods: pizza and tacos!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   pita bread rounds
1: 1/4 cup  bottled blue cheese salad dressing
2: 1  9  ounce package refrigerated Southwest-flavor cooked chicken breast strips
3: 3/4 cup  thinly sliced celery
4: Blue cheese crumbles (optional)
5: Bottled hot pepper sauce or buffalo wing sauce (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Place pita rounds on baking sheet. Brush with blue cheese dressing. Scatter chicken strips and celery on dressing. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until heated through and pitas are crisp.
1: Transfer to plates. Sprinkle with blue cheese. Pass hot pepper sauce. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Named after the classic appetizer, this pizza is loaded up with spicy chicken tenders and a blue cheese salad dressing. Your guests will be eating it in 20 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 cups  Original Bisquick® mix
1: 1/3 cup  boiling water
2: 2  tablespoons  sliced green onions
3: 1  package cream cheese, softened (8 ounces)
4: 1/2 cup  sour cream
5: 1  teaspoon  dried dill weed
6: 1/8 teaspoon  garlic powder
7: 1  can tuna, drained (5 ounces)
8: 3  cups  fresh vegetables, such as sliced mushrooms, cherry tomato halves, chopped broccoli
9: 1  cup  shredded cheese (4 ounces)
related_categories:
0: Appetizers
1: Fish and Seafood
2: Pizza
3: Tuna
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 450 degrees F. In medium bowl, stir Bisquick mix, boiling water and onions until soft dough forms; beat vigorously 20 strokes.
1: In ungreased 12-inch pizza pan, pat dough with floured hands, forming 1/2-inch rim.
2: Bake about 10 minutes or until light brown. Cool 10 minutes.
3: In medium bowl, stir cream cheese, sour cream, dill weed, garlic powder and tuna until smooth; spread evenly over crust. Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours or until chilled. Just before serving, top with vegetables and cheese. Cut into bite-size wedges. Refrigerate any remaining wedges.
recipe_description: Have a cool, fresh slice. This fun appetizer pizza has a cream cheese-tuna sauce and is topped with loads of fresh vegetables.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   Pepperidge Farm® 100% Whole Wheat English Muffin, split and toasted
1: 1  tablespoon  diced tomato
2: Freshly ground black pepper
3: 1  tablespoon  diced roasted red pepper
4: Crushed red pepper
5: 1/3 cup  shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
6: 1  teaspoon  chopped fresh basil leaves
7: 1  teaspoon  chopped fresh oregano leaves
recipe_instructions:
0: Place the muffin halves onto a baking sheet.  Spoon the tomato on 1 muffin half.  Season with the black pepper.  Spoon the roasted pepper on the remaining muffin half.  Season with the crushed red pepper.
1: Divide the cheese between the muffin halves.
2: Heat the broiler.  Broil for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted.  Sprinkle the tomato-topped pizza with the basil. Sprinkle the roasted pepper-topped pizza with the oregano.
recipe_description: A whole wheat English muffin makes a fabulous "crust" for this cheesy individual pizza that is ready in just 25 minutes. It makes a great after-school snack or a quick lunch or dinner for one.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   large onion, coarsely chopped
1: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
2: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
3: 1  13 - 15  inch  Whole Wheat Pizza Dough (see Recipe Center) or desired pizza crust
4: 1  8  ounce can tomato sauce or pizza sauce
5: 1   large clove garlic, minced
6: 2  cups  shredded mozzarella cheese (8 ounces)
7: 1/2 cup  lightly packed, finely shredded yellow summer squash
8: 1/2 cup  lightly packed, finely shredded zucchini
9: 1/2 cup  lightly packed, finely shredded carrot
10: 2   medium fresh garden heirloom tomatoes, such as Cherokee Purple, Green Zebras, and/or Marvel Stripe, or desired red or yellow tomatoes, cored and cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices or 1 cup mixed baby tomatoes, such as Sungold, Yellow Pear, and/or Sweet 100, halved
11: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil
recipe_instructions:
0: In a shallow baking pan, toss together the onion, olive oil and salt. Roast, uncovered, in a 450 degree F oven for 20 minutes or until tender and golden brown, stirring occasionally. Remove from oven; set aside.
1: Bake Whole Wheat Pizza Dough crust in a 450 degree F oven for 7 to 9 minutes or until crust is light brown. Remove from oven. (Or grill as directed in Whole Wheat Pizza Dough recipe.)
2: Spread tomato sauce evenly over crust; sprinkle with garlic. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with roasted onion, yellow squash, zucchini and carrot. Arrange tomato slices on top of the layer of vegetables. Sprinkle with the snipped basil.
3: Return to oven; bake for 8 to 10 minutes more or until heated through and bottom of crust is crisp and brown. (Or grill as directed.) Remove from oven; cool in pan on wire rack 5 minutes. Makes one 13- to 15-inch pizza (four 2-piece servings).

recipe_ingredients:
0: Half of one of our dough recipes or 1 pound store-bought dough
1: 1  tablespoon  unsalted butter
2: 1  tablespoon  flour
3: 2/3 cup  fat-free, reduced-sodium chicken broth
4: 1/2 teaspoon  sage
5: 1/2 teaspoon  thyme
6: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
8: 1  cup  shredded Swiss or mozzarella (about 4 ounces)
9: 1  10  ounce box frozen mixed vegetables, thawed and patted dry with paper towels
10: 1/4 cup  finely grated Parmesan (about 1 ounce)
recipe_instructions:
0: Position the rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 400 degrees . If you're using a pizza stone, warm it on the rack for 30 minutes.
1: Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Whisk in the flour, then let the mixture cook 1 minute. Slowly whisk in the broth until the mixture is smooth, then cook, whisking constantly, until it thickens and begins to bubble, about 2 minutes. Whisk in the sage, thyme, salt, and pepper and cook 1 minute more. Remove the pan from the heat and let the sauce cool for 10 minutes.
2: Lightly flour a large baking sheet or a pizza peel, then place the dough on top. Dimple and stretch the dough to fit your baking surface.
3: Use a large spoon to spread the sauce onto the crust, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Scatter on the cheese, then top it with the vegetables. Sprinkle on the Parmesan.
4: Bake the pizza until the crust is brown and the cheese has melted and is beginning to bubble, about 20 minutes. Let the pie cool for 5 minutes before serving.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  8  inches  tortillas
1: 8  ounces  goat cheese
2: 8  ounces  cream cheese, whipped
3: Salt and pepper to taste
4: 1  tablespoon  chopped, fresh thyme leaves
5: Truffle oil
recipe_instructions:
0: Combine goat cheese, cream cheese, salt and pepper. Set aside.
1: On work surface lay out four tortillas. Spread evenly over two; cheese mixture, sprinkle thyme leaves and drizzle truffle oil. Close with remaining two tortillas.
2: Heat griddle or 2 skillets.
3: Place crisps on griddle and cook until blistered and golden.
4: Turn them with a large spatula and cook until golden.
recipe_description: This double-tortilla pizza "crisp" makes an excellent far-from-ordinary appetizer.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  12 1/2 ounce can * Swanson® Premium White Chunk Chicken Breast in Water, drained
1: 4  ounces  cream cheese, softened
2: 1  cup  Pace® Chunky Salsa
3: 1  cup  shredded Mexican cheese blend, Colby Jack or Cheddar Cheese (about 4 ounces)
4: 1   (about 10 ounces) refrigerated pizza dough
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 425 degrees F.
1: Stir the chicken, cream cheese, 1/2 cup salsa, and shredded cheese in a medium bowl and set it aside.
2: Unroll the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface into a 12-inch square. Cut the dough into 4 (6-inch) squares.
3: Place about 1/2 cup chicken mixture on half of each square. Fold the dough over the filling and press the edges together to seal.
4: Place the calzones on a baking sheet and bake for 12 minutes or until they're golden brown.
5: Cool the calzones on the baking sheet for 1 minute and serve them with the remaining salsa for dipping.
6: *Or 3 cans (4.5 ounces each)
recipe_description: This recipe proves that the smart use of convenience products, like canned chicken, prepared salsa and refrigerated pizza crust, gives you mouthwatering, made-from-scratch taste in very little time.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  6  inches  Italian flatbreads (focaccia)
1: 2  large tomatoes, sliced
2: Salt and ground black pepper
3: 1  8  ounce round Camembert cheese, chilled
4: 1/3 cup  chopped walnuts
5: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh chives
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat broiler. Place flatbreads on the unheated rack of a broiler pan. Top with tomato slices; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cut cheese in thin slices. Place cheese slices on tomato slices.
1: Broil 4 to 5 inches from heat about 2 minutes or until cheese begins to melt. Sprinkle with walnuts; broil 1 minute more. Sprinkle with fresh chives. Serves 4.
recipe_description: This quick and easy pizza recipe features the perfect combination of cheese, nuts, and vegetables. Better yet, it will be on your table in 30 minutes or less.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  teaspoon  fennel seeds, crushed
1: 1/2 teaspoon  dried oregano, crushed
2: 1/2 teaspoon  garlic powder
3: 1/2 teaspoon  paprika
4: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
6: 1  1 1/2- 2  pound  boneless pork shoulder roast
7: 1  pound  sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
8: 1  cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth
recipe_name: Italian Pork with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small bowl, combine fennel seeds, oregano, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Trim fat from meat. Sprinkle fennel seed mixture evenly over meat; rub in with your fingers. If necessary, cut meat to fit into a 3-1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker. Set aside.
1: Place sweet potatoes in cooker. Add meat. Pour broth over mixture in cooker.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 8 to 10 hours or on high-heat setting for 4 to 5 hours.
3: Remove meat from cooker, reserving cooking juices. Slice meat. Using a slotted spoon, transfer sweet potatoes to a medium bowl. Use a potato masher to mash sweet potatoes, adding enough of the cooking juices, if necessary, to moisten. Serve meat with mashed sweet potatoes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  orange marmalade
1: 3  tablespoons  low sodium soy sauce
2: 3  tablespoons  plum sauce
3: 2  tablespoons  rice vinegar
4: 1/2 teaspoon  garlic powder
5: 2 3/4 pounds  pork spare ribs (about 10 ribs)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small microwave-safe bowl, stir together the marmalade, soy sauce, plum sauce, vinegar and garlic powder. Cover with microwave-safe plastic wrap and vent slightly. Microwave on full power for 3 minutes. Set aside.
1: Fit ribs into a 10 by 10-inch microwave-safe dish. Cover with plastic wrap and vent at one corner. Microwave on 50% power 25 minutes. Carefully drain liquid from dish.
2: Brush ribs with 1/2 cup of the sauce. Cover and microwave on full power for 5 minutes. Let stand, covered, for 10 minutes.
3: Serve with the remaining sauce on the side.
recipe_description: A pair of intense fruity flavors combined with soy sauce make this spare rib recipe simply irresistible.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   pork butt or shoulder (about 2-1/2 pounds), trimmed
1: 1 1/2 tablespoons  sodium-free steak seasoning blend (such as Mrs. Dash)
2: 1   large onion, chopped
3: 3   ribs celery, sliced
4: 1/4 cup  plus 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
5: 2  tablespoons  corn starch
6: 2 1/2 tablespoons  Cajun seasoning blend (such as McCormick)
7: 6  tablespoons  light mayonnaise
8: 6   whole-wheat hamburger buns
recipe_instructions:
0: Rub pork with steak seasoning.
1: Place pork in slow cooker bowl. Scatter onion and celery around pork and pour 1/4 cup of the vinegar over top. Cover and cook on HIGH for 6 hours or LOW for 8 hours.
2: Remove pork from slow cooker and cut into chunks. Let stand until cool enough to handle.
3: While pork is cooling, strain contents of slow cooker over a fat separator, setting vegetables aside. Pour defatted liquid into a small saucepan.
4: In a small bowl, stir together remaining 2 tablespoons vinegar with cornstarch. Bring defatted liquid to a boil over medium-high heat. Whisk in vinegar mixture and 1 tablespoon of the Cajun seasoning. Boil 1 minute, or until thickened.
5: Using two forks or your hands, pull pork into shreds, discarding excess fat. Place meat in a bowl and stir in vegetables. Add thickened liquid and toss to combine.
6: Stir together remaining 11/2 tablespoons Cajun seasoning and mayonnaise. To serve, place 1/2 cup pork mixture on each bun and top with
7: 1 tablespoon spiced mayo.
recipe_description: These Cajun-spiced sandwiches make a great game-day snack. Make this mouthwatering pork recipe overnight in your slow cooker to reduce preparation time the next day.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  canola oil
1: 2  cups  cut-up trimmed fresh asparagus or chopped trimmed broccoli
2: 1 1/2 cups  sliced fresh mushrooms
3: 1/2 cup  chopped red or yellow sweet pepper
4: Nonstick cooking spray
5: 3   whole grain English muffins, torn or cut into bite-size pieces (4 cups)
6: 2  cups  shredded smoked chicken or cooked chicken breast (10 ounces)
7: 3/4 cup  shredded Swiss cheese (3 ounces)
8: 1  cup  refrigerated or frozen egg product, thawed, or 4 eggs, lightly beaten
9: 1  cup  fat-free milk
10: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add asparagus, mushrooms, and sweet pepper; cook about 3 minutes or just until vegetables are crisp-tender.
1: Lightly coat six 12-ounce individual casserole dishes with cooking spray. Divide half of the English muffin pieces among the dishes. Top with the chicken, asparagus mixture, and 1/2 cup of the cheese. Top with the remaining English muffin pieces.
2: In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, and black pepper. Pour egg mixture evenly over the layers in dishes. Using the back of a large spoon, press muffin pieces down. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Cover; chill for 2 to 24 hours.
3: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Bake, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in centers comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   medium red, green, and/or yellow sweet peppers, cut into strips
1: 1  cup  thinly sliced celery (2 stalks)
2: 1/2 cup  chopped onion (1 medium)
3: 8   pork loin chops (with bone), cut 3/4 inch thick
4: 1/2 teaspoon  garlic salt
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
6: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
7: 1/4 cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth
8: 1/4 cup  orange juice
9: 1  tablespoon  chopped chipotle chile peppers in adobo sauce
10: 1/2 teaspoon  dried oregano, crushed
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 4- to 5-quart slow cooker, place sweet peppers, celery, and onion; set aside. Season chops with garlic salt and black pepper. In a 12-inch skillet, cook chops, half at a time, in hot oil over medium heat until brown on both sides. Add chops to cooker. In a small bowl, combine broth, orange juice, chipotle peppers, and oregano. Pour over chops in cooker.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 7 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 to 3-1/2 hours. Using a slotted spoon, transfer chops and vegetables to a serving platter; discard cooking liquid.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 10   boneless pork loin chops, cut 3/4 inch thick (about 3-1/2 pounds)
1: 2  teaspoons  dried sage, crushed
2: 1  teaspoon  ground black pepper
3: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
4: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
5: 1   medium onion, thinly sliced
6: 1/2 cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth
7: 1/3 cup  dry white wine or apple juice
8: 3  tablespoons  quick-cooking tapioca, crushed
9: 1/2 of a medium head green cabbage, cut into 1/2-inch strips
10: 1  tablespoon  Dijon-style mustard
11: 1  teaspoon  caraway seeds
12: Ground black pepper
13: Fresh sage sprigs (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from chops. In a small bowl, stir together sage, 1 teaspoon pepper, and the salt. Rub sage mixture onto one side of each chop. In an extra-large skillet, brown both sides of chops, half at a time, in hot oil over medium heat.
1: In a 6- or 7-quart slow cooker, place onion, broth, wine, and tapioca. Add the browned chops to cooker. Top with cabbage.
2: Cover; cook on low-heat setting for 4 to 5 hours or on high-heat setting for 2 to 2-1/2 hours.
3: Reserve and store* four chops. Use for Cheesy Meat and Potatoes Casserole. Transfer remaining six chops to a platter; cover and keep warm. Using a slotted spoon, transfer cabbage and onion to a serving bowl. Stir mustard and caraway seeds into remaining juices in cooker. Season sauce to taste with pepper. Spoon sauce over pork and cabbage. If desired, garnish with fresh sage.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2 1/2 pounds  sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch chunks
1: 1  3 1/2- 4  pound  boneless pork shoulder roast
2: 1  teaspoon  dried tarragon, crushed
3: 1 1/2 teaspoons  fennel seeds, crushed
4: 3  cloves garlic, minced
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  salt
6: 1  teaspoon  freshly ground black pepper
7: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
8: 12 - 16  ounces  kielbasa or other smoked sausage links, halved lengthwise and cut into 2-inch-long pieces
9: 1  14  ounce can chicken broth
10: 3/4 cup  apricot nectar
11: 1/2 cup  dried apricots
12: 4  teaspoons  cornstarch
recipe_name: Pork and Apricots with Mashed Sweet Potatoes
recipe_instructions:
0: Place sweet potatoes in the bottom of a 6-quart slow cooker. Trim fat from pork roast. Combine the tarragon, fennel seed, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; rub onto pork roast.
1: In a very large skillet, brown roast on all sides in hot oil. Drain off fat. Place meat on top of sweet potatoes in cooker. Add sausage. Pour broth and 1/2 cup of the apricot nectar over all.
2: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 7 to 9 hours or on high-heat setting for 3-1/2 to 4-1/2 hours, adding dried apricots for the last 30 minutes of cooking.
3: With a slotted spoon, transfer pork, sausage, and apricots to serving platter. Transfer sweet potato chunks to a large bowl; mash with a potato masher.
4: Strain cooking liquid into a glass measuring cup. Skim fat from cooking liquid; discard fat. Reserve 2 cups liquid (if necessary add chicken broth to measure 2 cups). In a small bowl whisk together the remaining 1/4 cup apricot nectar and the cornstarch. In a medium saucepan, combine cooking liquid and the cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly; cook for 2 minutes more. Serve with pork and mashed sweet potatoes. Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: This harvest meal features tender pork shoulder and sausage seasoned with tarragon and fennel, plus a generous helping of fluffy mashed sweet potatoes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Reserved meat from Cider-Braised Pork Roast and Apples
1: 6  cups  torn mixed greens
2: 3  cups  mixed berries, such as sliced strawberries, blueberries, and/or raspberries
3: 1/2 cup  bottled reduced-calorie balsamic vinaigrette or your favorite vinaigrette
recipe_instructions: 0: Chop or slice meat. Arrange 1 cup of greens on each of 6 serving plates. Top each with about 2-1/2 ounces meat and 1/2 cup berries. Drizzle each with about 1-1/2 tablespoons vinaigrette.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  finely chopped prosciutto or 2 slices bacon, coarsely chopped
1: 2  9  ounce package frozen cut green beans
2: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
3: 3/4 cup  water
4: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
5: 12  ounces  pork tenderloin, cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices  (11 to 12 slices)
6: 1/2 cup  orange juice
7: 3  tablespoons  molasses
8: 1  teaspoon  cornstarch
9: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
10: 1/4 teaspoon  pepper
11: Steamed spinach or turnip greens (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large skillet cook prosciutto or bacon over medium heat until crisp; drain and set aside. In the same skillet cook green beans and onion in 3/4 cup water according to bean package directions. Drain bean mixture; set aside.
1: In the same skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add pork tenderloin slices; cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until just barely pink in center, turning once halfway through cooking.
2: Meanwhile, in a small bowl stir together orange juice, molasses,  cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Add to meat in skillet. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir about 2 minutes more. Stir bean mixture into mixture in skillet; heat through.
3: If desired, serve with steamed spinach. Top individual servings with prosciutto or bacon. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Consider old-fashioned corn bread as a charming dinner partner for this Southern-inspired dish of Molasses-Glazed Pork Tenderloin.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  2 1/2- 3  pound  boneless pork shoulder roast
1: 2  tablespoons  cooking oil
2: 1 1/2 cups  beef broth
3: 2   medium leeks, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
4: 1  teaspoon  dried basil, crushed
5: 1  teaspoon  dried marjoram, crushed
6: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
7: 1/2 teaspoon  pepper
8: 1   bay leaf
9: 1   medium acorn squash (1 pound)
10: 8   small parsnips, quartered (3 cups)
11: 3   medium carrots, sliced (1-1/2 cups)
12: 8  ounces  fresh mushrooms, sliced (3 cups)
13: 1/2 cup  cold water
14: 1/4 cup  all-purpose flour
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from meat. In a 6-quart Dutch oven brown meat on all sides in hot oil. Drain fat. Add beef broth, leeks, basil, marjoram, the 1/2 teaspoon salt, the 1/2 teaspoon pepper, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 1-1/4 hours.
1: Cut squash in half lengthwise; discard seeds. Cut each half into 4 pieces. Add squash to meat mixture. Then add parsnips, carrots, and mushrooms. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes more or until vegetables and meat are tender. Remove meat and vegetables from Dutch oven; keep warm. Discard bay leaf.
2: For sauce, skim fat from pan juices. Measure 1-1/2 cups pan juices. Stir cold water into flour; stir into reserved juices in Dutch oven. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly; cook and stir for 1 minute more. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve sauce with meat and vegetables. Makes 8 servings.
recipe_description: Hours of simmering tenderizes the pork shoulder to perfection. We have added squash, parsnips, carrots, and mushrooms for a satisfying one-pot meal.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  pounds  pork shoulder roast (bone-in)
1: 3  tablespoons  vegetable oil
2: 2  teaspoons  crushed red pepper
3: 1  0.87 ounce envelope pork gravy mix
4: 6  cloves garlic, minced
5: 1   jalapeno chile pepper*, halved, seeded, and sliced
6: 2   Anaheim chile peppers*
7: 1   poblano chile pepper*
8: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
9: 3  tablespoons  vegetable oil
10: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
11: 3  tablespoons  chili powder
12: 2  15  ounce can hominy (undrained)
13: 1  14 1/2 ounce can diced tomatoes (undrained)
14: 1  14 1/2 ounce can vegetable broth
15: 1  15 - 16  ounce can pinto beans (undrained)
16: 1   habanero chile pepper, seeded and minced*
17: 1  teaspoon  dried oregano, crushed
18: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
19: Dairy sour cream
20: Shredded cheddar cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Brush all sides of pork with 3 tablespoons oil. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper and gravy mix; rub into meat with fingers. In a roasting pan, stir together garlic, jalapeno, and 1 cup water. Add roast. Roast, uncovered, for 3 hours or until pork is tender, adding water as needed to the roasting pan. Remove and let cool slightly. When cool enough to handle, shred pork with 2 forks; set aside. Strain the cooking liquid through a fine mesh strainer; discard solids. Skim fat from liquid and set aside.
1: Preheat broiler. Place the Anaheim and poblano peppers on a foil-lined baking sheet. Broil 4 to 5 inches from the heat about 5 minutes per side or until blistered and just starting to char. Remove and wrap in the foil. Let stand 20 minutes or until cool enough to handle. Stem and seed the peppers. Use a small sharp knife to peel the skin from the peppers. Chop the peppers; set aside.
2: In a 4-quart Dutch oven, cook onion in 3 tablespoons oil over medium heat until tender. Stir in flour and chili powder until combined. Stir in pork, roasted peppers, hominy with liquid, tomatoes, vegetable broth, reserved broth from pork, beans, habanero pepper, oregano and cumin. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 10 to 20 minutes or until desired consistency. Serve with sour cream and shredded cheese

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  16  ounce jar pickled mixed vegetables (1-1/2 cups)
1: 1/4 cup  chopped pimiento-stuffed green olives and/or pitted ripe olives, drained
2: 1   clove garlic, minced
3: 1  tablespoon  olive oil or salad oil
4: 1   9-inch round loaf unsliced Italian bread
5: 6  ounces  thinly sliced lower-sodium cooked ham
6: 4  ounces  sliced provolone cheese
7: 4  ounces  thinly sliced salami
8: Black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain vegetables, reserving 2 tablespoons liquid. Chop vegetables. Combine vegetables, reserved liquid, olives, garlic, and oil.
1: Slice bread in half horizontally. On bottom half layer ham, cheese, and salami. Top with vegetable mixture. Sprinkle with black pepper. Cover with bread top. Secure with wooden picks. To serve, cut into wedges. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
recipe_description: Pickled vegetables and olives are the trademarks of this New Orleans classic. This hearty sandwich is great for tailgating or football-themed parties at home.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4  cups  mesquite wood chips
1: 1  cup  ketchup
2: 1/2 cup  light-colored corn syrup
3: 1/4 cup  white vinegar
4: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
5: 1/4 cup  finely chopped onion
6: 2  tablespoons  yellow mustard
7: 1 1/2 teaspoons  Worcestershire sauce
8: 2   cloves garlic, minced
9: 1/2 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
10: 1/2 teaspoon  bottled hot pepper sauce
11: 1/4 teaspoon  ground cumin or chili powder
12: 1/8 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
13: 4  pounds  pork loin back ribs
14: 1   Rib Rub (see recipe below)
15: 2  teaspoons  dried rosemary
16: 2  teaspoons  dried thyme
17: 2  teaspoons  dried, minced onion
18: 2  teaspoons  dried, minced garlic
19: 1  teaspoon  coarse salt
20: 3/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: At least 1 hour before grilling, soak wood chips in enough water to cover.
1: For sauce, in a 1-1/2-quart saucepan, combine ketchup, corn syrup, white vinegar, brown sugar, onion, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, black pepper, hot pepper sauce, cumin or chili powder, and cayenne pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 25 to 30 minutes or until thickened, stirring occasionally.
2: Cut the ribs into serving-size pieces. Sprinkle Rib Rub evenly over all sides of ribs; rub in with your fingers.
3: Drain wood chips. In a grill with a cover, arrange medium-hot coals around a drip pan. Test for medium heat above pan. Put some of the drained mesquite chips onto coals. Place ribs, bone sides down, on grill rack over pan. Cover and grill for 1-1/2 to 1-3/4 hours or until ribs are tender, adding more coals and remaining mesquite chips as needed. Brush ribs with some of the sauce during the last 10 minutes of grilling. Pass remaining sauce. Makes 4 to 6 servings.
4: In a blender container or small food processor bowl combine dried rosemary, dried thyme, dried minced onion, dried minced garlic, coarse salt, and ground black pepper. Blend or process until coarsely ground.
recipe_description: These pork ribs are smeared with a peppery rub, slathered with barbecue sauce, then grilled over mesquite chips for a great smoke flavor.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  1  pound  pork tenderloin
1: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
2: 3  tablespoons  whole wheat flour
3: 4  teaspoons  olive oil
4: 2   cloves garlic, minced
5: 1/2 cup  dry white wine or reduced-sodium chicken broth
6: 2  teaspoons  snipped fresh sage or 1/2 teaspoon dried sage, crushed
7: 1  teaspoon  snipped fresh rosemary or 1/4 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
8: 1  cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth
9: 2  tablespoons  water
10: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
11: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh parsley (optional)
recipe_name: Pork Scaloppini in White Wine Sauce
recipe_instructions:
0: Trim fat from meat. Cut meat into 1/2-inch slices. Place each slice between two pieces of plastic wrap. Using the flat side of a meat mallet, pound meat lightly until 1/4 inch thick. Remove plastic wrap. Sprinkle meat with pepper. Place flour in a shallow dish. Dip meat into flour, turning to coat evenly.
1: In a very large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the meat to skillet. Cook about 4 minutes or until meat is browned, turning once halfway through cooking. Remove meat from skillet; cover and keep warm.
2: Add the remaining 2 teaspoons oil to skillet; cook the remaining meat as directed above. Remove from skillet; cover and keep warm.
3: Add garlic to the same skillet; cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add wine, sage, and rosemary; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add broth; return meat to skillet. Bring just to boiling. Cook, uncovered, for 2 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the water and cornstarch; stir into broth mixture. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more.
4: Transfer meat to serving plates; top with sauce. If desired, sprinkle with parsley.
recipe_description: Sage and rosemary perfectly season the wine sauce in this Diabetic Living recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
1: 1  tablespoon  paprika
2: 1  teaspoon  ground coriander
3: 1  teaspoon  kosher salt
4: 1 1/2 pounds  pork shoulder, trimmed of excess fat
5: 1  tablespoon  vegetable oil
6: 1  14 1/2 ounce can chopped tomatoes
7: 1 1/2 cups  low-sodium chicken broth
8: 1   medium yellow onion, cut into large dice
9: 1   bay leaf
10: 2  tablespoons  apple cider vinegar
11: 1  pound  butternut squash
12: 1  cup  frozen lima beans
13: 1  cup  frozen corn
recipe_instructions:
0: Stir together flour, paprika, coriander and salt in a large bowl. Cut pork into 1-inch cubes and toss with flour mixture. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet, Dutch oven or pot over medium-high heat. Add pork (reserving any excess flour mixture), reduce heat to medium and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 min. Transfer to a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker if using.
1: Add remaining flour mixture to slow cooker or pot along with 1 cup water, tomatoes with juice, broth, onion, bay leaf and vinegar. Cook 6 to 7 hr on low or 3 hr on high for slow cooker or 1 hr 45 min at a simmer on the stove.
2: Peel and cut squash into 1-inch cubes. Adjust heat to high if using low heat on the slow cooker and add squash, lima beans and corn; continue to cook until squash is tender, about 1 hr for slow cooker or 1 hr at a simmer on the stove. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  ketchup
1: 1/3 cup  apple cider vinegar
2: 1/4 cup  packed brown sugar
3: 2  tablespoons  Worcestershire sauce
4: 2  teaspoons  paprika
5: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
6: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
7: 1/4 teaspoon  chili powder
8: 2 - 2 1/2 pounds  boneless pork loin roast
9: 1  medium onion, halved and thinly sliced
10: 2  cloves garlic, minced
11: 1/2 cup  water
12: 8   whole grain buns
13: 1  cup  deli coleslaw
recipe_instructions:
0: In a medium bowl stir together the ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, salt, black pepper, and chili powder. Set aside 1/2 cup of the mixture. Transfer remaining mixture to a storage container; cover and chill until needed.
1: Place pork, onion, garlic, the 1/2 cup reserved ketchup mixture, and 1/2 cup water in a large resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. Seal the bag and turn to coat the pork. Chill for several hours or overnight.
2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Remove pork from bag and place in a 2-quart rectangular baking dish. Add remaining contents of bag to the dish with pork. Cover tightly. Bake for 3 hours or until pork shreds easily.
3: Remove pork to a large platter and use 2 forks to shred the meat. Return the pork to the baking dish and toss with cooking liquid. Serve pork on rolls topped with coleslaw and remaining ketchup mixture.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  extra-virgin olive oil
1: 1  pound  lean ground pork
2: 1/2 cup  chopped onion
3: 1/4 teaspoon  freshly ground black pepper
4: 1  tablespoon  minced fresh garlic (6 cloves)
5: 1  tablespoon  chili powder
6: 1  teaspoon  ground cumin
7: 1  teaspoon  ground cinnamon
8: 1  15  ounce can no-salt added pinto beans, rinsed and drained
9: 1  15  ounce can no-salt-added kidney beans, rinsed and drained
10: 1  14 1/2 ounce can diced tomatoes (undrained)
11: Crushed tortilla chips or cooked brown rice (optional)
12: Plain yogurt
recipe_instructions:
0: Put the oil in a large pot over medium heat. When it's hot, add the pork, onion, and black pepper. Cook and stir until meat has lost its pink color and onion is soft; drain off fat. Stir in garlic, chili powder, cumin, and cinnamon and cook for 1 minute more.
1: Add the beans and tomatoes. Bring to boiling; reduce heat and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have begun to break down and the flavors have melded, about 15 minutes. Serve over chips or rice, if desired, and garnish with a dollop of yogurt.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2/3 cup  wheat berries
1: 1/2 cup  regular barley
2: 1/2 cup  wild rice
3: 2  14  ounce can vegetable broth or reduced-sodium chicken broth
4: 2  cups  loose-pack frozen shelled sweet soybeans (edamame) or baby lima beans
5: 1   medium red sweet pepper, chopped
6: 1   medium onion, finely chopped
7: 1  tablespoon  butter
8: 3/4 teaspoon  dried sage, crushed
9: 1/4 teaspoon  coarsely ground black pepper
10: 4   cloves garlic, minced
recipe_instructions:
0: Rinse and drain wheat berries, barley, and wild rice. In a 3 1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker, combine uncooked wheat berries, uncooked barley, uncooked wild rice, broth, soybeans, sweet pepper, onion, butter, sage, black pepper, and garlic.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 8 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 to 4 hours. Stir before serving.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/4 cup  quinoa, rinsed and well drained
1: 1   clove garlic, minced
2: 1  teaspoon  olive oil
3: 3/4 cup  reduced-sodium chicken broth
4: 1/3 cup  chopped seeded cucumber
5: 1   large green onion, thinly sliced, or 3 tablespoons snipped fresh chives
6: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh basil
7: Fresh basil (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small nonstick saucepan, cook quinoa and garlic in hot oil over medium heat for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.
1: Add broth. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the quinoa is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in cucumber, green onion, and snipped basil. If desired, garnish with additional basil.  Makes 2 (2/3-cup) servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  packed brown sugar or brown sugar substitute* equivalent to 1/2 cup brown sugar
1: 1/4 cup  granulated sugar*
2: 1/4 cup  50% to 70% tub-style vegetable oil spread
3: 1/4 teaspoon  salt
4: 1 1/2 teaspoons  vanilla
5: 12  cups  popped light popcorn
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 4-quart Dutch oven heat and stir the brown sugar, granulated sugar, vegetable oil spread, and salt over medium heat until just boiling and sugar is dissolved. Stir in vanilla. Add popcorn and toss until coated.
1: Place coated popcorn in a shallow roasting pan. Bake, uncovered, in a 300 degree F oven for 15 minutes, stirring once. Transfer to a large piece of foil or a large roasting pan to cool.
recipe_description: This caramel popcorn recipe includes lower-fat margarine and light popcorn to make a sweet snack that kids and adults love.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  authentic wild rice
1: 6   white bread
2: 1  pound  sausage, casings removed
3: 1   medium yellow onion, chopped (about 1 cup)
4: 1  cup  celery, chopped
5: 1  small can (4 oz) mushroom pieces, drained
6: 1  small can sliced water chestnuts, drained
7: 3  cans (10.5 oz each) Campbells condensed chicken and rice soup
recipe_instructions:
0: The night before, place uncooked rice in a Dutch oven, just covered with water, and soak overnight. Set bread slices out on a cooling rack to dry.
1: On the day of, heat oven to 350 degrees . Drain rice in a colander. Cut bread slices into cubes.
2: In a large skillet, brown sausage over medium-high heat and break into small pieces. Transfer to a large bowl; add onion, celery, mushroom pieces and water chestnuts. Add soup and wild rice; mix gently. Add bread cubes and mix gently.
3: Pour mixture into a 4-quart covered casserole (or cover dish with foil) and bake at 350 degrees  for 11/2 hours.
recipe_description: Browned sausage infuses flavor into each and every bite of this rice and bread stuffing (or dressing, you might say, since it's cooked in a casserole pan.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  14 1/2 ounce  can reduced-sodium chicken broth
1: 1  cup  carrot juice
2: 2  tablespoons  butter
3: 1/2  small onion, finely chopped
4: Coarse salt and finely ground pepper
5: 1  cup  long-grain rice
6: 1/4 cup  dry white wine
7: 1/3 cup  finely grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving
8: 3  tablespoons  chopped fresh parsely
recipe_instructions:
0: Combine broth, carrot juice, and 2 cups water in a 2-quart saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium-low heat.
1: Meanwhile, melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, until softened, 5 minutes. Season with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
2: Raise heat to medium; add rice and cook, stirring until grains are translucent around the edges, about 3 minutes. Stir in wine, if using; cook until absorbed, about 2 minutes.
3: Add 1/2 cup hot broth mixture, stirring with a wooden spoon until most liquid is absorbed. Continue adding broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring until it is incorporated and rice is tender but still a little firm to the bite, 25 to 30 minutes. Stir in remaining tablespoon butter and Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Divide among dishes, and sprinkle with parsley and more Parmesan.
recipe_description: Carrot juice, which replaces some of the broth in this recipe, adds a subtle sweetness that goes well with the nuttiness of the Parmesan cheese.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  wheatberries, soaked for 4 hours or overnight
1: Kosher salt
2: 2  tablespoons  olive oil or unsalted butter
3: 1/2  medium onion, chopped into medium dice
4: 4   scallions (white and light green parts only), chopped
5: 1/4 teaspoon  ground allspice
6: 1/4 teaspoon  ground cinnamon; more to taste
7: 1/2 cup  basmati or other long-grain white rice
8: 1/3 cup  dried currants or coarsely chopped raisins
9: 3/4 cup  homemade or low-salt canned chicken or vegetable broth
10: 1 1/2 ounces  (1/3 cup) slivered almonds, toasted
11: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley
12: 1  tablespoon  grated lemon zest
13: Freshly ground black pepper
recipe_name: Wheatberries with Fragrant Spices, Currants & Almonds
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain the wheatberries. In a small saucepan, bring the wheatberries and 3 cups salted water to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer until tender but pleasantly chewy, 25 to 50 minutes. Drain well.
1: Meanwhile, heat the oil or butter in a small saucepan over medium low. Add the onion and scallions; cook until tender and translucent, about 7 minutes. Stir in the allspice, cinnamon, and rice, cook until the spices are fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes, and then add the currants or raisins, the broth, and salt to taste. Bring to a boil, turn the heat to low, cover, and simmer until the liquid is just absorbed and the rice is tender, 12 to 15 minutes.
2: In a bowl, combine the wheatberries, rice mixture, and almonds. Stir in the parsley and lemon zest and adjust the salt, pepper, and cinnamon to taste.
3: If you're planning to use this recipe as a stuffing, it yields enough to stuff about two 3 to 4-pound chickens, 6 bell peppers, or 10 to 12 tomatoes.
recipe_description: You can serve this dish as a pilaf-like side dish or as a vegetarian main dish. I also use it to stuff poultry and vegetables, such as baked red peppers and tomatoes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  dried apricots, cut into 1-inch pieces  (10 ounces)
1: 2 1/2 cups  basmati rice
2: 2  tablespoons  vegetable oil, plus more for frying
3: 1   large red onion, thinly sliced
4: 1  teaspoon  saffron threads
5: 1/2 cup  milk
6: 2  teaspoons  cumin seeds
7: 3   garlic cloves,  minced
8: 1   2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled, and finely julienned (1/4 cup)
9: 2  cups  plain yogurt
10: 1/2 teaspoon  cayenne pepper
11: 1  cup  water
12: 2 1/2 cups  unsalted shelled pistachios, 1/2 cup chopped, for garnish  (8 1/2 ounces)
13: 1  tablespoon  garam masala
14: Salt
15: 4  tablespoons  unsalted  butter, melted
16: 2   serrano chiles, seeded and minced
17: 1/2 cup  finely chopped mint
18: 1/4 cup  finely chopped cilantro
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large bowl, cover the apricots with warm water and let stand for 1 hour; drain. In a medium bowl, cover the rice with water and let soak for 30 minutes; drain.
1: Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, heat 1 inch of vegetable oil to 325 degrees. Add the onion slices and fry, stirring occasionally, until browned and crisp, about 7 minutes. Drain on paper towels.
2: In a large saucepan, toast the saffron over moderately high heat, 30 seconds. Transfer the saffron to a small bowl and let cool. Crumble the threads and add the milk.
3: In the same large saucepan, heat the 2 tablespoons of oil. Add the cumin seeds and cook over moderately high heat until fragrant. Add the garlic and 2 tablespoons of the ginger and cook over moderately high heat until the garlic is golden. Add the yogurt, cayenne pepper, and the 1 cup of water and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes. Add the apricots, pistachios, and garam masala and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt.
4: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. In another large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook the rice until al dente. Drain and return to the saucepan. Stir in half of the saffron milk, cover, and set aside. Add the remaining saffron milk to the pistachio-yogurt mixture.
5: Spread half of the pistachio yogurt in a large, deep casserole or Dutch oven. Drizzle 1 tablespoon of the melted butter over the yogurt and top with half of the chiles, fried onions, and 1 tablespoon of the ginger. Spread half of the rice in the casserole and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the melted butter. Spread with the remaining pistachio-yogurt mixture, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the butter and scatter the remaining chiles, fried onion, and 1 tablespoon of ginger on top. Cover with the remaining rice and drizzle on the remaining 1 tablespoon of melted butter. Cover the casserole tightly with foil, then cover with a lid.
6: Bake the biryani for about 15 minutes, until heated through. Uncover the biryani. Garnish with the chopped pistachios, mint, and cilantro and serve immediately.
recipe_description: Many Indian restaurants call any spiced rice dish biryani, but Suvir Saran insists, "Biryani must be layered." Here, he boils rice like pasta to make it fluffy, then layers it in a casserole dish with yogurt, pistachios, and apricots.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3  cups  vegetable stock
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
2: 1   clove garlic, minced
3: 1   very small yellow onion, diced
4: 1  cup  Arborio rice
5: 1/2 cup  white cooking wine
6: 3/4 teaspoon  marjoram
7: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
8: 1  10  ounce package frozen spinach, thawed and squeezed of excess moisture
9: 1  cup  frozen peas, thawed
10: 1  tablespoon  soy- and dairy-free margarine
recipe_instructions:
0: Pour the stock into a medium saucepan and heat over medium heat until it just simmers. Turn the heat down to low.
1: Meanwhile, in a large saute pan, heat the oil over medium-high heat. When the oil is hot, add in the garlic and onions and cook until they are soft and translucent, about 5 to 7 minutes.
2: Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat it with the olive oil. Let the rice cook in the hot oil for about 30 seconds to open the grains. Pour in the wine, stir the rice, and let it cook for another 30 seconds to cook off the alcohol. Turn the heat down to medium.
3: Add 2 cups of the warmed stock and stir the rice until the stock is completely absorbed. Add the remaining stock a half cup at a time, stirring after each addition until all of the stock is absorbed and the rice is soft, about 20 minutes. Stir in the marjoram, salt, vegetables, and margarine and serve.
4: Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container, refrigerated, for up to 3 days.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 3/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Broth (Regular, Natural Goodness or Certified Organic)
1: 3/4 cup  uncooked regular long-grain white rice
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the broth in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-high heat to a boil.
1: Stir in the rice. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 20 minutes or until the rice is tender.
2: Easy Substitution: This recipe will work with any variety of Swanson® Broth.
3: Florentine Simmered Rice: Add 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning to broth. Add 1 cup chopped spinach with the rice. Stir in 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese before serving. Serve with additional cheese.
recipe_description: Cooking rice in broth instead of water ensures fabulous flavor and delicious results.  Try it- we bet you'll never cook rice with water again!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  pound  bulk pork sausage
1: 1  8  ounce package sliced mushrooms
2: 2   stalks celery, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
3: 1   large red pepper, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
4: 1   large onion, coarsely chopped (about 1 cup)
5: 1  teaspoon  dried thyme leaves, crushed
6: 1/2 teaspoon  dried marjoram leaves, crushed
7: 1  6  ounce box seasoned long-grain and wild rice mix
8: 1 3/4 cups  Swanson® Chicken Stock
9: 1  10 3/4 ounce can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Mushroom Soup (Regular or 98% Fat Free)
10: 1  cup  shredded Cheddar cheese (about 4 ounces)
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook the sausage in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until it's well browned, stirring often to separate meat. Pour off any fat.
1: Add the mushrooms, celery, pepper, onion, thyme, marjoram and seasoning packet from the rice blend to the skillet and cook until the vegetables are tender-crisp.
2: Stir the sausage mixture, stock, soup, rice blend and 1/2 cup cheese in a 3-quart shallow baking dish. Cover the baking dish.
3: Bake at 375 degrees F. for 1 hour or until the sausage is cooked through and the rice is tender. Stir the sausage mixture before serving. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
4: For an extra-special touch, substitute 1 package (8 ounces) baby portobello mushrooms, sliced, for the sliced mushrooms.
recipe_description: Come in from the cold and enjoy this flavorful sausage, vegetable and rice casserole that's easy to put together and even better to eat!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 8  ounces  sharp cheddar cheese, shredded (2 cups)
1: 1/2 cup  butter
2: 1 1/2 cups  all-purpose flour
3: 1/4- 1/2 teaspoon  salt
4: 1/4 teaspoon  ground red pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large mixing bowl combine shredded cheese and butter; bring to room temperature (about 1 hour). Beat with an electric mixer until well combined. Stir in flour, salt, and red pepper. Divide the dough in half. Shape dough into two 7-inch logs. Wrap and chill logs for at least 1 hour.
1: Preheat oven to 350 degree F. With a knife or a crinkle cutter, slice the cheese logs into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place slices on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 15 minutes. Store in an airtight container up to 3 days. Makes about 4-1/2 dozen crackers.
recipe_description: Make the dough for these cheesy, savory appetizer crisps as much as three days before baking. Serve them fresh from the oven.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 1  10 3/4 ounce can reduced-fat and reduced-sodium condensed cream of mushroom soup
2: 1  cup  uncooked wild rice, rinsed and drained
3: 1  cup  uncooked regular brown rice
4: 1  cup  sliced fresh mushrooms
5: 1  cup  packaged julienned or coarsely shredded carrot
6: 1/2 cup  sliced celery (1 stalk)
7: 1/3 cup  chopped onion (1 small)
8: 1 1/2 teaspoons  poultry seasoning
9: 2   cloves garlic, minced
10: 3/4 teaspoon  black pepper
11: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
12: 6  cups  water
13: 1/2 cup  light dairy sour cream
recipe_instructions:
0: Lightly coat the inside of a 3 1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray; set aside. In the prepared cooker combine soup, wild rice, brown rice, mushrooms, carrot, celery, onion, poultry seasoning, garlic, pepper, and salt. Stir in water.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 8 to 9 hours or on high-heat setting for 4 to 4-1/2 hours.
2: Before serving, stir in sour cream.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  cup  long-grain, parboiled rice
1: 2  cups  reduced-sodium chicken broth
2: 4  teaspoons  jerk seasoning
3: 1  can (15 ounces) red kidney beans, drained and rinsed
4: 1 1/2 pounds  boneless, skinless chicken breasts
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 450 degree F. Coat a baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
1: Cook rice following package directions, about 25 minutes, replacing water with the broth and adding 1 teaspoon of the jerk seasoning. Gently stir in kidney beans during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
2: Meanwhile, cut the chicken into 1-inch pieces and toss with remaining 3 teaspoons of jerk seasoning. Place in prepared pan and bake at 450 degree F for 15 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160 degree F on an instant-read thermometer, turning once halfway through.
3: Serve the chicken with the rice and beans on the side.
recipe_description: Jerk seasoning adds its famous spicy kick to this chicken, bean, and rice main-dish recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2/3 cup  shelled pistachios
1: 2  tablespoons  canola oil
2: 1   small yellow onion, finely diced (about 1 cup)
3: 1/2 teaspoon  kosher salt; more to taste
4: 1/2 tablespoon  coriander seeds, lightly smashed
5: 12   whole green cardamom pods
6: 3-inch piece cinnamon stick
7: 1   bay leaf
8: 2  cups  basmati rice, rinsed
9: 2 3/4 cups  low-salt chicken broth
recipe_instructions:
0: Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 325 degrees F. Spread the pistachios on a baking sheet and toast in the oven until golden and fragrant, 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer the baking sheet to a wire rack to cool. Roughly chop the nuts and set aside.
1: Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion and salt, and saute for 2 minutes; add the coriander, cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaf to the pan and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is softened and turning brown, 1 to 3 minutes more. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until the rice is well coated with oil and slightly translucent, about 3 minutes.
2: Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low, cover, and let simmer until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 15 minutes. Discard the cinnamon stick, bay leaf, and cardamom pods.
3: Season to taste with salt if necessary. When ready to serve, sprinkle with the chopped pistachios.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  10  ounce container refrigerated light Alfredo pasta sauce
1: 1/2 cup  milk
2: 2 1/2 cups  cooked white rice or wild rice
3: 2  cups  cubed cooked chicken
4: 1  cup  frozen peas
5: 1/3 cup  chopped bottled roasted red sweet peppers
6: 1/4 cup  slivered almonds, toasted (optional)
7: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh basil or 1/2 tsp. dried basil, crushed
8: 1  cup  soft bread crumbs
9: 1  tablespoon  butter, melted
recipe_instructions:
0: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine pasta sauce and milk. Stir in rice, chicken, peas, sweet peppers, nuts, and basil. Transfer to 1-1/2-quart baking dish.
1: Bake, covered, 30 minutes. Uncover and stir. Combine bread crumbs and melted butter; sprinkle atop. Bake, uncovered, 20 to 25 minutes more or until heated through and crumbs are golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4.
recipe_description: Looking for a yummy casserole recipe? This old-fashioned chicken and rice main dish is truly comfort food at its best.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2   eggs, lightly beaten
1: 1  box (5.2 ounce) Asian-flavored rice mix
2: 1  pound  pork roast, cut into 3/4-inch cubes (about 2 1/2 cups)
3: 1  bag (16 ounces) frozen Asian stir-fry vegetables, thawed
4: 1  can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts
5: 2  tablespoons  light soy sauce
6: 1  tablespoon  hoisin sauce
7: 2  teaspoons  sesame oil
8: 2   scallions, chopped
recipe_instructions:
0: Add eggs to a large nonstick skillet. Cook until set and remove to a plate. Cut into strips. Wipe out skillet; prepare rice mix in it following package directions.
1: During last 7 minutes, add pork, vegetables, water chestnuts, soy and hoisin. Stir in egg and cook, covered, for remaining 7 minutes.
2: Remove from heat and stir in sesame oil. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with scallions.
recipe_description: This tasty pork fried rice recipe is stir-fried in a simple light soy and hoisin sauce. Add this to your list of weeknight dinner ideas that can be prepared in just over 30 minutes.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  coarsely chopped walnuts
1: 1   small yellow sweet pepper, cut in bite-size strips
2: 1/2  of a small red onion, cut in slivers
3: 2   cloves garlic, minced
4: 2  teaspoons  olive oil
5: 1  8.8 ounce package cooked brown rice
6: 1/4 cup  coarsely chopped Italian (flat-leaf) parsley
7: 1/2 teaspoon  finely shredded lemon peel
8: 2  tablespoons  lemon juice
recipe_instructions:
0: In large dry skillet heat walnuts over medium heat 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly toasted, stirring frequently. Remove from skillet; set aside. In same skillet cook sweet pepper, onion, and garlic in hot oil over medium heat 5 minutes or just until tender, stirring occasionally.
1: Add rice to skillet. Cook and stir to heat through. Stir in nuts, parsley, lemon peel and juice, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Makes 4 side-dish servings.
recipe_description: Chopped walnuts add a delicious crunch to this rice side dish recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Nonstick cooking spray
1: 4   small skinless, boneless chicken breast halves (about 1 pound total)
2: 1/8 teaspoon  salt
3: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
4: Citrus Vinaigrette
5: 8  cups  fresh spinach leaves and/or torn mixed salad greens
6: 3  cups  sliced nectarines
7: 1/3 cup  coarsely chopped pecans, toasted
8: 2  tablespoons  crumbled reduced-fat feta cheese
9: 1  teaspoon  finely shredded orange peel
10: 1/4 cup  orange juice
11: 3  tablespoons  olive oil
12: 1  tablespoon  snipped fresh thyme, oregano, or basil
recipe_instructions:
0: Coat a large nonstick skillet with nonstick spray; preheat over medium heat. Sprinkle both sides of chicken with salt and pepper. Cook chicken in hot skillet for 8 to 10 minutes or until chicken is tender and no longer pink (170 degrees F), turning once to brown evenly. Remove from skillet. Cut chicken into strips.
1: In a large salad bowl toss together chicken, spinach, and nectarines. Pour vinaigrette over salad; toss to coat. Divide salad among 4 serving plates. Sprinkle with toasted pecans and feta cheese.
2: 2 cups salad with about 1-1/2 tablespoons pecans and 1/2 tablespoon cheese
3: In a screw-top jar combine orange peel, orange juice, olive oil and thyme, oregano, or basil. Cover and shake well. Serve immediately or cover and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Shake well before using.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 10 - 12  ounces  (4 cups) snow peas, stems trimmed
1: 1/2  fennel bulb, fronds reserved
2: 1  cup  frozen baby peas, thawed
3: 1/2 cup  chopped walnuts
4: 3  tablespoons  fresh lemon juice
5: 1/4 teaspoon  kosher salt
6: 1   small clove garlic, minced
7: 1  teaspoon  sugar
8: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
9: Zest of 1 lemon
recipe_name: Crispy Snow Pea and Fennel Slaw
recipe_instructions:

1: In a separate bowl, whisk together lemon juice, salt, garlic and sugar. Drizzle in olive oil, whisking constantly. Dress salad with vinaigrette to taste and season with ground black pepper. Makes 8 servings.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 2  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil
2: 1   large garlic clove, thinly sliced

5: 2  tablespoons  unsalted butter

9: 1  tablespoon  chopped tarragon
recipe_name: Charred Fava Bean Salad with Lemon and Tarragon
recipe_instructions:
0: Fill a large bowl with ice water. In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, blanch the fava beans for 1 minute. Transfer to the ice water, drain, then peel them.
1: In a small saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the garlic and cook over low heat until golden, about 2 minutes. Add the jalapeno and cook for 1 minute longer. Season with salt.
2: In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil until shimmering. Add the fava beans and cook over moderately high heat, without stirring, until blackened, about 1 minute. Transfer to a serving bowl and season with salt.
3: Add the butter to the skillet and cook over moderately high heat until it just starts to brown, about 30 seconds. Add the shallot and cook over low heat until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and remove from the heat.
4: Add the garlic-jalapeno mixture and warm shallot vinaigrette to the beans along with the cheese and tarragon and toss well to coat. Season the salad with salt and serve.
5: The blanched and peeled fava beans can be refrigerated overnight.
recipe_description: It's impossible to grill tiny favas, but the sweet-starchy beans get a similar smoky flavor when they're charred quickly in a hot skillet. Jean-Georges Vongerichten tosses the charred beans with garlic, jalapeno, tarragon, and cubes of cheese for a warm salad.

recipe_ingredients:

recipe_description: From Betty's Soul Food Collection...  Aw...go ahead! Enjoy a second helping of our lightened slaw. It's mixed with perfectly seasoned reduced-fat dressing and plenty of fresh, healthy vegetables.

recipe_name: Italian Basil, Tomato, and Pasta Salad
recipe_instructions:

1: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Rinse with cold water; drain again.
2: Meanwhile, in a large saucepan cook frozen beans according to package directions; drain. Rinse with cold water; drain again.
3: Toss one-third of the dressing with the cooked pasta; place pasta in the bottom of a very large salad bowl. Layer ingredients on top of the pasta in the following order: cooked green beans, tomatoes, and olives. Top with remaining dressing. Sprinkle with the basil leaves, the Parmesan cheese, and parsley. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours. To serve, toss lightly to combine. Makes 16 servings.
recipe_description: This fresh side salad recipe, perfect for a potluck or cookout, uses lots of basil. Make it when basil is in full supply, in the garden or at the market, during the height of summer.

recipe_ingredients:

3: 3  tablespoons  red wine vinegar

1: Serve the salad dressing with your choice of greens and/or fruit. You can cover and store the dressing in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks. Just before serving, shake well and drizzle over the salad.

recipe_ingredients:

recipe_instructions:

1: For dressing, in a screw-top jar combine oil, vinegar, shallot, mustard, sugar, and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and shake well. Pour dressing over potato mixture.* Sprinkle salad with feta cheese and basil leaves. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 5 - 6  large red and/or yellow tomatoes, cut into wedges
1: 1/4 cup  olive oil
2: 1/4 cup  fresh basil leaves, torn into thirds
3: 2  teaspoons  balsamic vinegar (optional)

5: Freshly ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:

1: If the olive oil solidifies when chilled, let the salad stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Grind pepper over salad and toss lightly. Makes 12 to 16 side-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1   egg
1: 1  tablespoon  water
2: 1/2 17.3 ounce package Pepperidge Farm® Puff Pastry Sheets (1 sheet), thawed
3: 3   pears halves packed in juice, well drained
4: 3/4 cup  crumbled Gorgonzola cheese (about 3 ounces)
5: 1/4 cup  walnuts , toasted and chopped
6: 2  tablespoons  honey
7: 6  cups  mixed salad greens
8: 2  tablespoons  prepared oil and vinegar salad dressing
recipe_name: Gorgonzola and Honey Pear en Croute Salad
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 400 degrees F.  Beat the egg and water in a small bowl with a fork.
1: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Cut the pastry sheet in half lengthwise.  Cut each half into thirds, making a total of 6 pieces.  Roll each pastry piece into 1 (5x5-inch) square.  Brush the pastry squares with the egg mixture.
2: Cut the pear halves in half lengthwise.  Place 1 pear piece on the bottom half of each pastry square.  Top each with 2 tablespoons cheese, 2 teaspoons walnuts and 1 teaspoon honey.  Fold 2 opposite sides of the pastry over the filling.  Starting at the short side with the pear, roll up like a jelly roll.  Press the seams to seal.  Place the pastries, seam-side down, onto a baking sheet.  Brush the pastries with the egg mixture.  Cut 1 (1/2-inch) slit in each pastry top.
3: Bake for 20 minutes or until the pastries are golden brown. Remove the pastries from the baking sheet and let cool on a wire rack for 5 minutes.  Cut the pastries diagonally into bite-sized pieces.
4: Place the salad greens into a large bowl.  Add the dressing and toss to coat.  Arrange the salad on a serving platter and top with the pastry pieces.
recipe_description: This restaurant-style salad is sure to impress your guests...but it's so easy to make, you can enjoy it anytime!

recipe_ingredients:
0: Coarse salt
1: 1/2 pound  orzo
2: 1  pound  sugar snap peas, trimmed and halved crosswise
3: 2   small yellow squash, halved lengthwise and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces
4: 3  tablespoons  fresh lemon juice
5: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
6: 2  tablespoons  finely grated Parmesan cheese

recipe_description: A cross between snow peas and English (regular) peas, sugar snaps have a pod that contains small peas. The entire pea is edible, including the pod.

recipe_ingredients:
