Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until skin is blistered and charred. Bring foil up around peppers to enclose. Let stand about 15 minutes or until cool. Use a sharp knife to loosen edges of the skins; gently pull off the skin in strips and discard.
1: Place peppers in a blender or food processor. Add lime juice, vinegar, olive oil and salt. Cover and blend or process until smooth.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1  15  ounce can kidney beans, rinsed and drained

recipe_description: Sweet soybeans, kidney beans, and garbanzo beans combine to make this tasty salad recipe that's perfect for your next potluck.

recipe_ingredients:

Using a slotted spoon, remove bacon from skillet, reserving 2 tablespoons of the drippings in skillet (discard the remaining drippings or add olive oil, if necessary, to measure 2 tablespoons). Drain bacon on paper towels. Crumble bacon; set aside.
1: Add green onions and garlic to the reserved drippings in skillet; cook and stir until green onions are tender. Stir in vinegar, sugar, mustard, and 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper. Stir in crumbled bacon; heat through. Serve warm over desired salad greens.

recipe_ingredients:

Place butter in a 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Place in oven for 1 to 2 minutes or until butter is melted. Break ramen noodles in small pieces. (Use one seasoning packet for Sweet and Tangy Dressing, below. Discard the other.)  Stir noodles and peanuts into hot butter. Bake about 15 minutes or until crisp and slightly browned, stirring once; cool. Sprinkle over lettuce mixture. Drizzle with dressing. Toss well to combine. Serve immediately.
1: In a small saucepan combine sugar, sesame oil, cider vinegar, soy sauce, and seasoning packet from ramen noodles. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, 1 minute. Cool completely. Whisk before adding to salad mixture. Makes 12 (1-3/4 cups) servings.
recipe_description: This salad bowl special, complete with chicken, toasted ramen noodles, and peanuts, is a meal in itself.

recipe_ingredients:

0: Remove stems from spinach, if desired. In a large bowl combine spinach and apricots; set aside.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 3/4 pounds  white, yellow or purple fingerling or banana potatoes

recipe_name: Fingerling Potato Salad with Leeks and Fennel
recipe_instructions:
0: Place potatoes in a large pot with lightly salted cold water to cover. bring to a simmer and cook over medium-high heat until potatoes are just tender, about 20 min. Drain, transfer a bowl and toss with 2 tbsp vinegar; allow to cool slightly. When cool enough to handle, slice potatoes in half lengthwise.
1: Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add leeks and reduce heat to medium. Cook until just tender and translucent, 5 to 8 min. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon and add to potatoes, reserving oil.
2: Thinly slice fennel with a knife or on a mandolin. Add to the potatoes along with savory leaves and fennel fronds.
3: In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tbsp vinegar, lemon juice, sugar, salt and pepper. Drizzle in warm olive oil and whisk to combine. Add dressing to salad and gently toss. Serve warm or chilled. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: Summer savory, a minty herb, complements buttery potatoes and zesty fennel.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  bag  (6 oz) baby spinach
1: 3  cups  low-sodium chicken broth
2: 1 1/2 tablespoons  olive oil
3: 1   small onion, finely chopped
4: 1  cup  arborio rice

6: 1/3 cup  white wine
7: 6  ounces  (1-3/4 cups) snow peas, stems trimmed, coarsely chopped
8: 1/3 cup  (2 oz) soft goat cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Pulse the spinach in a food processor until very finely chopped; set aside. In a medium saucepan, heat broth and 1/2 cup water and leave over low heat.
1: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft, about 5 min. Add rice and salt; stir to coat rice with oil. Stir in wine and cook until absorbed, 1 min.
2: Add about 3/4 cup broth and stir constantly, until broth is absorbed. Continue adding broth, about 3/4 cup at a time, stirring occasionally; let rice absorb broth before adding it again (risotto should be gently simmering as you stir), 18 to 22 min.
3: With the last addition of broth, stir in the spinach, peas and cheese until cheese is just melted, about 1 min. Serve immediately with extra cheese. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 1/4 cup  apricot preserves
3: 2  tablespoons  orange juice

0: If using bamboo skewers, soak in water at least 30 minutes before using to prevent burning. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Line 15x10x1-inch pan with foil; spray with cooking spray.
1: Cut kielbasa at an angle into 48 chunks, about 1 inch each. On each skewer, thread 4 chunks of sausage; place in pan.
2: In small bowl, mix preserves and orange juice with fork; brush glaze over kabobs. Turn kabobs over; brush other side.
3: Bake about 45 minutes or until kielbasa is browned.

recipe_description: Coat chunks of zesty kielbasa with a sweet apricot-and-orange glaze. Great alternative to bacon!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   fresh bratwursts (about 12 ounces total)
1: 1  12  ounce can beer
2: 10   whole black peppercorns
3: 1   large onion, sliced and separated into rings
4: 1  tablespoon  margarine or butter
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  caraway seed
6: 2  tablespoons  white wine vinegar
7: 1  teaspoon  Worcestershire sauce
8: 4   frankfurter buns, split and toasted
9: Coarse-grain brown mustard
recipe_instructions:
0: Use a fork to prick several holes in the skin of each bratwurst. In a saucepan combine bratwursts, beer, and peppercorns. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover; simmer about 20 minutes or until bratwursts are no longer pink. Drain.
1: Meanwhile, in a small skillet cook onion in hot margarine until tender but not brown. Add caraway seed and cook 5 minutes more. Stir in the vinegar and the Worcestershire sauce.
2: Grill bratwursts on an uncovered grill directly over medium-hot coals for 7 to 8 minutes or until skins are golden, turning frequently (170 degrees F). Serve bratwursts on buns with mustard. Spoon onion mixture over bratwursts. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Beer and bratwurst are the usual fare at local events in Germany, and the tradition is now an American crowd-pleaser too!

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  margarine or butter
1: 1/2 cup  chopped green sweet pepper
2: 1   small onion, chopped (1/3 cup)
3: 2  tablespoons  brown sugar
4: 1  teaspoon  prepared mustard
5: 1/2 teaspoon  caraway seed
6: 1  cup  drained sauerkraut
7: 6   fresh bratwurst (1-1/4 to 1-1/2 pounds)
8: 6   hoagie buns, split
recipe_instructions:
0: In a small skillet heat margarine or butter over medium heat until melted. Add green pepper and onion. Cook over medium heat about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in brown sugar, mustard, and caraway seed. Add sauerkraut; toss to mix. Tear off a 36x18-inch piece of heavy foil. Fold in half to make a double thickness of foil that measures 18x18 inches. Place sauerkraut mixture in center of foil. Bring up two opposite edges of foil and seal with double fold. Then fold remaining ends to completely enclose sauerkraut mixture, leaving space for steam to build. Prick the bratwurst in several places with a fork or the tip of a sharp knife.
1: Arrange preheated coals around a drip pan in a covered grill. Test for medium heat above the pan. Place bratwurst and the foil packet on grill over pan. Cover and grill for 20 to 25 minutes or until bratwurst juices run clear, turning bratwurst over once. To serve, toast cut sides of buns on grill. Serve bratwurst in the buns and top with sauerkraut mixture. Makes 6 servings.
recipe_description: A sweet yet tart sauerkraut relish tops these spicy grilled brats.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
3: 1  medium yellow sweet pepper, cut into bite-sized strips
4: 2  tablespoons  fresh sage or basil leaves cut into thin strips

7: 1  16  ounce tube refrigerated cooked polenta, cut into 12 slices
8: 1/3 cup  pure maple syrup
9: Small fresh sage or basil leaves
recipe_instructions:
0: In a medium saucepan cook butternut squash, covered, in a small amount of boiling salted water for 10 minutes or until tender; drain and set aside.
1: In a very large skillet cook turkey kielbasa in 1 tablespoon hot oil over medium heat until lightly browned and crisp on the edges. Add butternut squash, yellow sweet pepper, sage, vinegar, and sugar; bring to boiling. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, until vinegar has almost evaporated. Remove from skillet. Cover with foil to keep warm.
2: Rinse and wipe out skillet. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Fry polenta slices in hot oil over medium-high heat until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Turn with pancake turner; fry 5 minutes more. Stack three polenta slices on each of four dinner plates. Top with sausage mixture; drizzle each serving with maple syrup. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Scrapple began as a Pennsylvania Dutch dish of leftover pork, cornmeal, and spices. This recip calls for butternut squash, turkey kielbasa, polenta, sweet peppers, and herbs.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 3/4 cup  chopped onion
3: 2  cloves garlic, minced
4: 1  26  ounce jar pasta sauce
5: 1  cup  shredded mozzarella cheese (4 ounces)
6: 1/4 teaspoon  black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain; set aside.
1: In a large skillet cook the sausage, onion, and garlic until sausage is brown; remove from skillet. Drain.
2: In a large bowl stir together pasta sauce, 3/4 cup of the mozzarella cheese, and the pepper. Add the cooked pasta and the drained sausage mixture. Stir gently to combine. Spoon the mixture into a 2-quart casserole.*
3: Bake, covered, in a 375 degree F oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until nearly heated through. Uncover; sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup mozzarella cheese. Bake about 5 minutes more or until cheese is melted.
4: Makes 5 or 6 servings
recipe_description: This quick and easy cavatelli casserole recipe uses simple but tasty ingredients such as fresh mozzarella and sausage.

recipe_ingredients:

7: 3/4 cup  milk
8: 1/4 cup  blue cheese
9: 1   egg
10: 3  slices bacon, crisp-cooked and finely crumbled or chopped

recipe_instructions:

In a blender combine milk, blue cheese, and egg; cover and blend until almost smooth. Add egg mixture to flour mixture along with bacon; mix well. (Batter will be thick.)
1: Meanwhile, heat 1 inch of oil in a heavy 10-inch skillet over medium heat to 365 degrees F. (should take about 15 minutes).
2: Insert skewers into ends of franks. Holding onto skewers, hold franks over bowl of cornmeal mixture. Spoon cornmeal mixture on franks and slightly spread to completely cover. Place coated franks, 3 or 4 at a time, on their sides in hot oil. Turn franks with tongs after about 10 seconds of cooking to prevent batter from sliding off. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or until golden brown, turning to brown evenly. Remove and drain on a baking sheet lined with paper towels. Keep warm in a 200 degrees F. oven while frying remaining franks. Serve warm with honey mustard and/or Blue Cheese Dip. Sprinkle parsley. Makes 12 appetizer corn dogs.
3: In medium bowl combine mayonnaise, dairy sour cream, crumbled blue cheese, Worcestershire sauce, and ground black pepper. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
recipe_description: Bring the state fair to your backyard. Blue cheese and bacon in the batter make these little treats blue ribbon-worthy.

recipe_ingredients:

2: 8  ounces  dry chorizo, peeled and thinly sliced
3: 1   large sweet onion, diced
4: 1   large carrot, cut into fine matchsticks

recipe_instructions:

1: In a large soup pot, cook the chorizo over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the chorizo to a plate. Add the onion, carrot, garlic, and paprika to the pot and cook over moderate heat until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook until the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Return the chorizo to the pot, add the shrimp broth and bring to a boil. Simmer over moderate heat for 25 minutes. Stir the flour mixture, whisk it into the soup, and boil for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the shrimp to the soup and cook just until pink and curled, about 2 minutes. Ladle the soup into bowls and top with the avocado. Serve with the toasts.

recipe_ingredients:

1: 1/2 cup  vegetable oil

3: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
4: 1  cup  all-purpose flour
5: 1   large white onion, coarsely chopped
6: 3  stalks celery, coarsely chopped
7: 1  cup  chopped green bell pepper
8: 3   cloves garlic, minced
9: 2  quarts  low-salt chicken broth
10: 2   bay leaves
11: 2  teaspoons  dried thyme
12: 1  bunch scallions, thinly sliced (dark- and light-green parts only)
13: Louisiana-style hot sauce, to taste
14: 1/4 cup  hot cooked white rice per serving
15: 1/2- 1  teaspoon  file powder per serving
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat a heavy-duty 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat until hot, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the andouille and cook, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon, until well browned, 4 to 6 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup water to the skillet and immediately scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon to release any cooked-on bits. Reserve this liquid.
1: Heat the oil in a 7- to 8-quart Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Season the chicken pieces with salt and pepper and saute the chicken in two batches until golden brown on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer to the bowl with the sausage.
2: Add the flour to the oil remaining in the Dutch oven and stir constantly with a wooden spoon or heatproof spatula over medium-high heat until the roux reaches the color of caramel, 4 to 8 minutes. Add the onion and stir until the roux deepens to a chocolate-brown, 1 to 3 minutes. Add the celery, bell pepper, and garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until slightly softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth, 1 quart of water, the liquid reserved from the sausage pan, and the sausage, chicken, bay leaves, and thyme.
3: Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat and simmer uncovered until the chicken is falling off the bone, about 45 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a plate. If you like, skim the fat from the surface of the gumbo with a large shallow spoon.
4: When the chicken is cool enough to handle, discard the skin and bones, pull the chicken meat into bite-size pieces, and return the meat to the gumbo. Season to taste with salt and pepper if necessary (you may find that the sausage and broth provided enough seasoning).
5: Five minutes before serving, add the scallions and hot sauce to taste. Serve in large soup bowls over 1/4 cup cooked rice per serving. Sprinkle 1/2 to 1 teaspoon of the file powder on top of each bowl of gumbo and stir to thicken, or pass the file at the table for everyone to add to taste.
6: Store gumbo in the refrigerator for up to three days and then reheat gently before serving. As with many stews and braises, gumbo tastes better the second day. You can also freeze it for up to eight months. Simply transfer to freezer-safe containers.
recipe_description: Do not add file powder to the entire pot of gumbo. If gumbo is reheated with file powder in it, the file will become stringy and unpleasant.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  water
1: 2/3 cup  milk
2: 2  tablespoons  margarine or butter
3: 1  box Betty Crocker® scalloped potatoes (4.9 ounces)
4: 2  cups  sliced fully cooked reduced-fat Polska-kielbasa sausage (from 1-pound ring)
5: 1/2 cup  Old El Paso® Thick 'n Chunky salsa (any variety)
6: 2  cups  Green Giant® Select® frozen broccoli florets
related_categories:
0: Broccoli
1: Dinner
2: Kielbasa
3: Potatoes
4: Sausage
5: Vegetables
recipe_instructions:
0: In 12-inch skillet or 3-quart saucepan, heat water, milk and margarine to boiling. Stir in contents of uncooked potatoes and sauce mix pouches (from potato mix box). Add sausage and salsa; stir until well mixed. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
1: Stir in broccoli. Cover; cook 8 minutes longer or until potatoes and broccoli are tender (sauce will thicken as it stands).
2: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): Increase water to 2 -1/2 cups. Thaw broccoli florets.
recipe_description: With only six ingredients, you can go from cooktop to tabletop with a complete meal of meat, potatoes and veggies.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  self-rising all-purpose flour *
1: 1/3 cup  vegetable shortening
2: 3/4 cup  milk
3: 1  14 1/2 ounce can Campbell's® Country Style Sausage Gravy
related_categories:
0: Biscuits
1: Bread and Pastry
2: Breakfast and Brunch
3: Sausage
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oven to 450 degrees F.
1: Place the flour and shortening into a medium bowl.  Cut in the shortening using a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Add the milk and stir just until blended.
2: Place the dough on a lightly floured surface and knead until it holds together.  Pat the dough into a 8x6-inch rectangle.  Cut into 6 biscuits.  Place the biscuits onto a baking sheet.
3: Bake for 10 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown.  Heat the gravy in a 1-quart saucepan over medium-high heat until hot and bubbling.  Split the biscuits and serve topped with the gravy.
4: *If you don't have self-rising flour on hand, substitute a mixture of 2 cups all-purpose flour, 3 teaspoons baking powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
recipe_description: Biscuits hot from the oven are smothered with a savory, creamy sausage gravy.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6  ounces  bulk hot pork sausage
1: 1/4 teaspoon  garlic powder
2: 1  can pizza sauce (15 ounces)
3: 1   box Pillsbury® refrigerated pie crusts, softened as directed on box
4: 1   egg, beaten
related_categories:
0: Appetizers
1: Calzone
2: Mexican Cuisine
3: Mexican Empanadas
4: Pizza
5: Sausage
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat oven to 425 degrees F. In 8-inch skillet, cook sausage over medium-high heat 6 to 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pork is no longer pink; drain well. Stir in garlic powder and 1/4 cup of the pizza sauce.
1: Remove 1 crust from pouch. On work surface, roll into 13-inch round. With 3-inch round cutter, cut 11 rounds. Repeat with second crust.
2: Spoon about 1 teaspoon sausage mixture onto each round. Fold each in half; seal edges with fork. Cut small slit in top of each with sharp knife. Place on ungreased large cookie sheet. Brush each foldover with beaten egg.
3: Bake 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, in 1-quart saucepan, heat remaining pizza sauce until hot. Serve warm appetizers with warm pizza sauce for dipping.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change.
recipe_description: From Betty's Soul Food Collection...  Good things come in small packages, like these party-pleasin' pizza-flavored foldovers--similar to empanadas, meat-filled pastries popular in Latin America.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Vegetable cooking spray
1: 1/2 pound  sweet Italian pork sausage, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
2: 4  cups  Swanson® Chicken Broth (Regular, Natural Goodness or Certified Organic)
3: 1/2 teaspoon  dried oregano leaves, crushed
4: 1   medium onion, chopped (about 1/2 cup)
5: 1   medium carrot, sliced (about 1/2 cup)
6: 2  cups  coarsely chopped fresh spinach leaves
related_categories:
0: Pork
1: Pork Sausage
2: Sausage
3: Soup
4: Spinach
5: Vegetables
recipe_instructions:
0: Spray a 4-quart saucepot with the cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat for 1 minute. Add the sausage and cook until it's well browned, stirring often. Pour off any fat.
1: Stir the broth, oregano, onion and carrot in the saucepan. Heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until the sausage is cooked through.
2: Stir the spinach in the saucepan and cook for 1 minute.
recipe_description: Swanson® Chicken Broth is the secret to making a quick and delicious homemade soup featuring sweet Italian sausage and fresh spinach.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 - 4  cups  assorted vegetables, such as small radishes, red sweet pepper slices, cauliflower, yellow squash, or small pattypan squash
1: 6  ounces  firm cheese, such as sage Derby, white cheddar, or smoked Gouda, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
2: 6  ounces  smoked sausage, cut into 1/2-inch chunks, and/or cooked medium shrimp
3: 1/2 cup  bottled Italian salad dressing
recipe_instructions:
0: In a medium bowl, toss together vegetables, cheese, and smoked sausage. Pour dressing over mixture in bowl. Toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours, stirring occasionally.
1: Remove vegetable-sausage mixture from refrigerator. Alternately thread vegetables onto eight 6-inch bamboo skewers. Alternately thread cheese, smoked sausage, and/or shrimp onto eight 6-inch bamboo skewers. Makes 16 servings.
recipe_description: Great party appetizes--let guests pick between skewers of vegetables or flavorful bites of sausage, shrimp, and cheese.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 16  ounces  no-added salt chicken or vegetable broth
1: 9  ounces  cheese ravioli
2: 1   large zucchini
3: 1/4 cup  diced red pepper
4: Parmesan to taste
recipe_instructions:
0: In a stockpot, bring the broth to a boil. Add the ravioli and let it cook according to the package instructions.
1: Meanwhile, grate the zucchini with a cheese grater.
2: When the pasta is almost fully cooked, add the zucchini to the soup and cook it for one or two minutes more.
3: Season the soup with diced red pepper, shredded Parmesan cheese, and black pepper to taste before serving, if desired.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 6   ears fresh corn
1: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2: 4  slices bacon (preferably thick-cut), chopped into 1/4-inch pieces
3: 1   onion, chopped
4: 4  cups  low-fat milk
5: 1  tablespoon  cornstarch
recipe_name: Summer Corn Chowder By Mark Bittman
recipe_instructions:
0: Shuck the corn, then stand each ear up in a bowl and use a knife to scrape off the kernels; set aside. Put the cobs, 1 cup water, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper in a 4-quart pot with a tight-fitting lid over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat so the water bubbles gently, cover, and cook for 20 to 30 minutes. Leave the cobs in the pot until you are ready to make the soup, then discard them, reserving the corncob stock
1: Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until it begins to render its fat and turns golden-brown, about 4 to 6 minutes. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until soft, another 5 minutes or so.
2: Add the milk, reserved corn kernels, and bacon and onion to the stock, and bring to a boil; lower the heat so that the soup bubbles gently. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently to prevent scorching, until the corn is tender, about 10 minutes
3: Whisk the cornstarch in a small bowl with 2 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to the soup, stirring until the soup thickens, about a minute. Taste, adjust the seasoning, garnish with parsley, and serve.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1 1/2 cups  Chardonnay or dry white wine
1: 1/2 cup  white wine vinegar
2: 4  cup (1 quart) whipping cream or heavy cream
3: 1  12  ounce  round Brie cheese, rind removed and cut into 1-inch pieces
4: 1   clove garlic, minced
5: 1   sprig fresh thyme
6: 1   sprig fresh basil
7: Salt and ground white pepper
8: Snipped fresh basil and/or fresh thyme (optional)
9: Sliced baguette-style French bread, toasted
recipe_instructions:
0: In a heavy medium saucepan, bring wine and vinegar to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, until liquid is reduced to 1 cup (this should take about 15 minutes). Stir in whipping cream, Brie, garlic, sprig of thyme and basil. Cook and stir about 8 minutes, or until Brie melts.
1: Set a fine mesh strainer over a large bowl. Carefully pour soup through the strainer. Season soup to taste with salt and white pepper. Serve in bowls topped with additional snipped basil and/or thyme. Serve with bread slices.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/2 cup  sour cream
1: 4  teaspoons  chopped fresh basil leaves
2: 4  teaspoons  chopped fresh oregano leaves
3: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
4: 1   large onion, finely chopped (about 1 cup)
5: 1   clove garlic, minced
6: 4   medium zucchini, thinly sliced (about 6 cups)
7: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
8: 3  cups  Swanson® Vegetable Broth (Regular or Certified Organic)
recipe_instructions:
0: Stir the sour cream, 1 teaspoon of the basil and 1 teaspoon of the oregano in a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate.
1: Heat the oil in a 4-quart saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until they're tender. Add the zucchini and black pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until the zucchini is tender.
2: Add the broth, remaining basil and remaining oregano. Heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 15 minutes.
3: Place one third of the zucchini mixture into a blender or food processor. Cover and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture into a large bowl. Repeat the blending process twice more with the remaining zucchini mixture. Return all of the pureed mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until hot.
4: Divide the soup among 6 serving bowls and top with about 1 tablespoon of the sour cream mixture, using a spoon to swirl the cream in a decorative pattern on the soup surface.
recipe_description: It takes less than one hour to make this smooth and creamy zucchini soup, served with a dollop of flavorful herbed cream.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
1: 1   fennel bulb, chopped
2: 1   large onion, chopped (about 1 cup)
3: 1   large carrot, chopped (about 1/2 cup)
4: 1  stalk celery, chopped (about 1/2 cup)
5: 4   medium Italian plum tomatoes, chopped
6: 2   cloves garlic, minced
7: 1/2 teaspoon  crushed red pepper
8: 1   bay leaf
9: 8  cups  Swanson® Chicken Broth (regular, Natural Goodness or Certified Organic)
10: 1  16  ounce bag dried lentils, rinsed
11: 2  cups  coarsely chopped watercress
12: Freshly grated Parmesan cheese (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the oil in a 6-quart saucepot over medium heat. Add the fennel, onion, carrot and celery and cook until tender.
1: Stir the tomatoes, garlic, red pepper, bay leaf, broth and lentils into the saucepot. Heat to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook for 25 minutes or until the lentils are tender. Discard the bay leaf.
2: Stir the watercress into the saucepot and cook for 2 minutes. Serve with the cheese, if desired.
recipe_description: Tender lentils, fennel, onion, carrot, celery and plum tomatoes simmer together in Swanson® Chicken Broth that has been flavored with bay, crushed red pepper and garlic.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 12  ounces  andouille, kielbasa or smoked pork sausage, halved lengthwise and cut into 1/2-inch slices
1: 1   large onion, chopped (1 cup)
2: 2  stalks celery, chopped (1 cup)
3: 1  tablespoon  minced garlic (6 cloves)
4: 3  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
5: 1 1/2 teaspoons  ground cumin
6: 1 1/2 teaspoons  chili powder
7: 1  teaspoon  Cajun or Creole seasoning
8: 6  cups  chicken broth
9: 1  16  ounce package frozen whole kernel corn or 3 cups fresh sweet corn kernels
10: 2  cups  1/2-inch cubes peeled sweet potato (about 2 small)
11: 12  ounces  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
12: 1  cup  whipping cream
13: 1  teaspoon  freshly ground black pepper
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 6-quart Dutch oven, brown sausage over medium heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add onion, celery and garlic. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in flour, cumin, chili powder and Cajun seasoning. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Stir in chicken broth. Bring to boiling.
1: Add corn, sweet potatoes, and chicken. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, about 20 minutes or until sweet potatoes are tender. Stir in whipping cream and pepper; heat through. Makes 8 to 10 main-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 5  slices bacon
1: 1   medium onion, sliced and separated into rings
2: 2 1/2 cups  milk
3: 2  cups  frozen corn (1 10-ounce package)
4: 1  10 3/4 ounce can condensed cream of mushroom soup
5: 1  cup  diced potato, cooked
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan, cook bacon until crisp. Remove; drain on paper towels. Crumble bacon. Reserve 2 to 3 tablespoons drippings in the saucepan.
1: Cook onion rings in reserved drippings until tender. Stir in the milk, corn, soup and potato.
2: Bring mixture to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Season to taste with salt. Top each bowl of chowder with some of the crumbled bacon. Makes 5-1/2 cups soup.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  10  ounce can whole baby clams, undrained
1: Water
2: Nonstick cooking spray
3: 2  slices turkey bacon, halved
4: 1   medium onion, chopped
5: 1   stalk celery, thinly sliced
6: 2   medium potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
7: 2  cups  small cauliflower florets (about 1-inch pieces)
8: 1/4 teaspoon  dried thyme, crushed
9: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
10: 2 1/2 cups  fat-free milk
11: 1/2 cup  fat-free half-and-half
12: 2  tablespoons  all-purpose flour
13: 3/4 cup  coarsely shredded carrots
recipe_instructions:
0: Drain clams, reserving liquid. Chop half of the clams; set chopped and whole clams aside. Add enough water to the reserved clam liquid to measure 1 1/2 cups; set clam liquid aside.
1: Coat a large saucepan with cooking spray; heat saucepan over medium heat. Add bacon, onion, and celery to saucepan. Cook for 5 to 8 minutes or until onion is tender and bacon is cooked through, stirring occasionally. Remove bacon from pan; drain on paper towels. Chop bacon and set aside.
2: Stir potatoes, cauliflower, thyme, pepper, and reserved clam liquid into onion mixture. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat; cool slightly. Transfer half of the potato mixture (about 2 cups) to a blender or food processor. Cover and blend or process until smooth. Return to the remaining potato mixture in saucepan.
3: In a medium bowl, whisk together milk, half-and-half, and flour until smooth. Add all at once to potato mixture. Cook and stir just until boiling. Stir in chopped and whole clams and carrots. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cook for 1 minute more. Sprinkle each serving with chopped bacon.
recipe_description: Using a combo of cauliflower and potatoes, rather than all potatoes, lowers the carbs in this creamy meal-in-a-bowl.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil
1: 2   medium shallots, finely chopped
2: 2   bunches spring onions or scallions, chopped, white and green parts separated
3: 2  cups  vegetable stock
4: 2  cups  fresh shelled peas
5: Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
6: Ramp Crostino
7: 12   fresh mint leaves, thinly sliced
recipe_name: Spring Onion and Pea Soup with Ramp Crostino
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat olive oil in a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and onion or scallion whites until soft and translucent, about 3 minutes. Add stock, onion or scallion greens, and peas; season with salt and pepper.
1: Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a boil; immediately reduce heat to a simmer, cover, and simmer until peas are tender, about 6 minutes.
2: Working in batches, transfer soup to the jar of a blender or bowl of a food processor; carefully blend until pureed. Strain soup through a fine mesh sieve set over saucepan; season with salt and pepper. Divide soup evenly between 4 bowls. Place 1 crostino in each bowl and garnish with mint; serve immediately.
recipe_description: This lovely soup recipe is courtesy of Mario Batali.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  15  ounce can no-salt-added red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1: 1  15  ounce can small white beans, rinsed and drained
2: 1  15  ounce can low-sodium black beans, rinsed and drained
3: 1  14 1/2 ounce can diced tomatoes and green chile peppers, undrained
4: 1  cup  beer or chicken broth
5: 3  tablespoons  chocolate-flavored syrup
6: 1  tablespoon  chili powder
7: 2  teaspoons  Cajun seasoning
8: Dairy sour cream (optional)
9: Shredded cheddar cheese (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 3-1/2- or 4-quart slow cooker, combine kidney beans, white beans, black beans, undrained tomatoes and green chile peppers, beer or broth, chocolate syrup, chili powder, and Cajun seasoning.
1: Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6 to 8 hours or on high-heat setting for 3 to 4 hours.
2: If desired, garnish individual servings with sour cream and cheese. Makes 4 servings.
recipe_description: Chocolate-flavored syrup adds an intriguing undertone to this Cajun-accented chili recipe.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4   cloves garlic or 1 to 2 bulbs spring garlic, chopped
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
2: 1/4 cup  chopped onion
3: 1  pound  Yukon Gold potatoes, quartered
4: 2  14 1/2 ounce cans reduced-sodium chicken broth
5: 1 3/4 cups  water
6: 1  medium fennel bulb, thinly slivered (fronds reserved)
7: 1 1/2 cups  sugar snap peas, trimmed
8: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
9: 1/4 teaspoon  ground black pepper
10: 1  tablespoon  fresh snipped fennel fronds
11: Plain yogurt (optional)
12: Olive oil (optional)
recipe_name: Hearty Garlic and Snap Pea Soup
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan cook garlic in the 2 tablespoons hot oil over medium heat for 1 minute. Add onion and cook until tender. Add potatoes, chicken broth, and the water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cook, covered, for 15 to 18 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cool slightly.
1: Using a food processor or blender, puree soup in batches until smooth. Return to saucepan. Add slivered fennel and peas. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 3 minutes.
2: Stir in salt and pepper. Top each serving with fennel fronds. If desired, spoon yogurt onto each serving and drizzle with additional olive oil.
recipe_description: This springtime meal starter is a healthy vegetable soup full of sweet sugar snap peas and gently flavored fennel.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  cups  Black Bean and Corn Salsa (see Recipe Center)
1: 1  pound  tomatoes (about 3 tomatoes), cored and chopped
2: 1  14  ounce can reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth
3: 1   small cucumber, peeled and chopped (about 1/2 cup)
4: 1  tablespoon  red wine vinegar
5: 1  teaspoon  Worcestershire sauce
6: Snipped fresh cilantro (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a blender or food processor, combine 1-1/2 cups of the Black Bean, Grilled Corn, and Jicama Salsa; the tomatoes; broth; cucumber; vinegar; and Worcestershire sauce. Cover and blend or process until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl. Cover and chill for 8 hours.
1: Top individual servings with the remaining 1/2 cup salsa. Pass cilantro. Makes 6 (about 1-cup) servings.
recipe_description: Add pizzazz to any meal by starting itoff with this refreshing blend of bean-and-corn salsa, tomatoes, and cucumber.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 4 1/2 cups  watermelon cubes
1: 1/2 teaspoon  salt
2: 1/4 teaspoon  ground coriander
3: 1/8 teaspoon  pepper
4: 1/4 cup  plain Greek yogurt
5: 2  tablespoons  raisins
recipe_instructions:
0: Place watermelon, salt, coriander, and pepper in a food processor or blender (split into two batches if equipment is small). Cover and puree until smooth. Mix in the Greek yogurt just until combined.
1: Serve soup in bowls and top with raisins to look like "seeds".

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1/3 cup  butter or margarine
1: 1/3 cup  all-purpose flour
2: 1/8 teaspoon  ground white pepper
3: 3  cups  chicken broth
4: 1/3 cup  half-and-half or light cream
5: 1/3 cup  milk
6: 1 1/2 cups  finely chopped, cooked chicken
recipe_instructions:
0: In a medium saucepan, melt butter.
1: Stir in flour and white pepper. Stir in chicken broth, half-and-half, and milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
2: Stir in chicken; heat through. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: Carcass from cooked 10- to 12-pound turkey
1: 3  quarts  water (12 cups)
2: 1  teaspoon  salt
3: 1/2 teaspoon  pepper
4: 1/4 teaspoon  poultry seasoning or dried sage leaves
5: 1   dried bay leaf
6: 1/2 cup  uncooked pearl barley
7: 3   medium carrots, sliced (1 1/2 cups)
8: 1   large onion, chopped (1 cup)
9: 2   medium stalks celery, sliced (1 cup)
10: 3  cups  cut-up cooked turkey
11: 2  tablespoons  chopped fresh parsley, if desired
recipe_instructions:
0: Break up turkey carcass to fit 6-quart Dutch oven. Add water, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning and bay leaf. Heat to boiling over high heat; reduce heat to low. Cover; simmer 1 hour 30 minutes.
1: Skim off any residue that rises to the surface. Remove bones, meat and bay leaf from broth; cool. When cool enough to handle, remove meat from bones and cut into bite-size pieces; set aside. Discard bones and bay leaf.
2: Skim fat from broth; discard. Add turkey meat cut from bones to broth; stir in barley. Heat to boiling; reduce heat to low. Cover; simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3: Stir in carrots, onion, celery and 3 cups cooked turkey. Simmer uncovered 20 to 25 minutes longer, stirring occasionally, until vegetables and barley are tender. Stir in parsley.
4: High Altitude (3500-6500 ft): No change.
recipe_description: Use your leftover holiday turkey to make from-scratch soup packed with barley and vegetables.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 2  tablespoons  butter
1: 2  tablespoons  olive oil
2: 2   large onions, chopped (2 cups)
3: 2  stalks celery, chopped (1 cup)
4: 2   medium carrots, chopped (1 cup)
5: 2   cloves garlic, minced
6: 4  14  ounce can beef broth
7: 2   large red potatoes, peeled and cubed (2-1/4 cups)
8: 1  10  ounce can tomato puree
9: Basil Meatballs
10: Salt (optional)
11: Red bottled hot pepper sauce (optional)
12: 1/2 cup  shredded fresh basil
13: 1   egg, slightly beaten
14: 1/2 cup  soft bread crumbs
15: 2  tablespoons  fresh basil, shredded
16: 2  tablespoons  snipped fresh Italian (flat-leaf) parsley
17: 1  teaspoon  kosher salt
18: 1/2 teaspoon  freshly ground black pepper
19: 1  pound  lean ground beef
recipe_instructions:
0: In a 5-quart Dutch oven, heat butter and oil over medium heat. Add onions, celery, carrots and garlic. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring often.
1: Stir in the broth and potatoes. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Add tomato puree and Basil Meatballs* to the soup, a few at a time and cook, covered, 10 to 15 minutes more or until no pink remains in meatballs. Season to taste with salt and hot pepper sauce, if you like. Skim fat and garnish each serving with some of the fresh basil. Makes 8 servings.
2: In a large bowl, combine egg, bread crumbs, basil, parsley, salt and pepper. Add ground beef. Using two forks, lightly toss together all ingredients. Shape into tiny meatballs. (If you like, use a melon baller or small cookie scoop to shape the meatballs.) Makes 42 (3/4-inch) meatballs.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 5  cups  chicken broth
1: 4  cups  carrots sliced 1/2-inch thick
2: 3   leeks, sliced (1 cup)
3: 1   bay leaf
4: 3  tablespoons  fresh lemon juice
5: 2 - 3  tablespoons  snipped fresh lemon thyme or thyme, or 2 to 3 teaspoons dried thyme, crushed
6: 1  teaspoon  snipped fresh summer savory (optional)
7: Freshly ground black pepper
8: 1   lemon, thinly sliced
9: Fresh lemon thyme or thyme sprigs (optional)
recipe_instructions:
0: In a large saucepan, combine the chicken broth, carrots, leeks, and bay leaf. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Add lemon juice, snipped thyme, savory (if you like), and pepper. Simmer, covered, for 5 minutes more or till carrots are tender. Cool slightly.
1: Remove bay leaf; discard. Place one-third of the carrot mixture in a food processor or blender. Cover and process or blend till smooth. Repeat with the remaining mixture. Return all to saucepan; heat.
2: To serve, ladle the soup into bowls. Top each serving with lemon slices and, if you like, lemon thyme or thyme. Makes 8 to 10 side-dish servings.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 1  tablespoon  olive oil

recipe_instructions:

2: Unfold the pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface.  Roll the pastry sheet into a 16x10-inch rectangle.  Brush the pastry sheet with the egg.
3: With the short side facing you, arrange the Swiss chard leaves on the bottom half of the pastry to within 1 inch of the edge.  Top with the roasted vegetable mixture.  Starting at the short side, roll up like a jelly roll.  Place the pastry, seam-side down, onto a baking sheet.  Tuck the ends under to seal.  Brush the pastry with the egg. Add broth, vinegar, oregano, remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; bring to a boil. Cook until thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Add roasted vegetables and stir until completely coated with sauce. Let cool.
2: Meanwhile, roll out 3 piecrust sheets, 1 at a time, on a lightly floured surface using a floured rolling pin, into 15-inch rounds. Using a 6 1/2-inch round cutter, cut out 4 rounds from each. Arrange rounds, in a single layer, on a cookie sheet and cover with a piece of parchment paper or damp cloth; set aside.
3: Roll out remaining 2 piecrust sheets into 12-inch rounds. Using a 4 1/2-inch round cutter, cut out 6 rounds from each. Using a small Halloween cookie cutter, cut out 1 shape in center of each round. Arrange rounds, in a single layer, on a cookie sheet and refrigerate 10 to 15 minutes.
4: Meanwhile, preheat oven to 425 F. and arrange rack in lower third. Place one 6 1/2-inch round in each cup of 1 (12-cup) standard muffin pan and press gently to fit, pushing dough up sides to reach over top. Fill each cup with 1/2 cup vegetable mixture. Cover each with one 4 1/2-inch round and pinch together dough around edges to seal. Lightly brush tops with egg.
5: Bake until crust is golden and filling is bubbling, about 25 minutes. Transfer pies in pan to rack and cool 10 minutes before unmolding.
recipe_description: Need to eat more vegetables? These savory little pies have butternut squash, turnips, Brussels sprouts, parsnips, and portobello mushrooms. Serve them as a filling vegetarian meal.

recipe_ingredients:
0: 3 1/2 cups  Swanson® Chicken Broth (Regular, Natural Goodness or Certified Organic)
1: 1 1/2 cups  stone-ground yellow cornmeal
2: 1   bay leaf
3: 1/8 teaspoon  ground black pepper
4: 1  tablespoon  olive oil
5: 1  tablespoon  chopped fresh basil leaves or 1 tsp. dried basil leaves, crushed
6: 1/2 cup  grated Parmesan cheese
recipe_instructions:
0: Heat the broth, cornmeal, bay leaf and black pepper in a 3-quart saucepan over medium heat to a boil. Stir in the oil. Cook and stir for 10 minutes or until the mixture is thickened.
1: Remove and discard the bay leaf. Stir the basil and cheese in the saucepan. Spread the polenta in a greased 9-inch pie plate. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until the polenta is firm.
2: Cut the polenta into 6 wedges. Grill, Bake or Pan-Fry the polenta. Serve topped with meat sauce, roasted vegetables or grated Parmesan cheese, if desired.
3: To Grill: Brush the wedges on both sides with olive oil. Place on a hot grill and cook for 4 minutes, turning the wedges over once during grilling.
4: To Bake: Heat the oven to 375 degrees F. Place the wedges on a greased baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until the wedges are browned and crispy, turning the wedges over once during baking.
5: To Pan-Fry:  Heat oil in a nonstick skillet. Add the wedges in 2 batches and cook for 10 minutes or until the wedges are browned and crispy, turning them over once during cooking.
recipe_description: This cheesy polenta recipe is very easy to make, and makes the perfect complement to roasted veggies or braised meats and poultry.
